story:
Please help us complete the documentary story about my uncle Jimmy Shendo and his band Moiety. The story of determined indigenous southwest musicians, with BIG MUSICAL DREAMS. 


Short Summary

Our mission at Life Road Productions, is to produce, educational video projects that show different aspects of music, culture, language, life and human values. With Jimmy Shendo & Moiety, we hope to tell in a documentary, the  story of a musician who was bound for greatness but passed away in a tragic car accident before reaching that goal and the impact that had on those he left behind. We will showcase many local talented musicians and actors in the project and help bring light to the great talent around us. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • With the $4,500 raised we hope to be able to rent or buy equipment to make sure the talent in this documentary and concert both look and sound as great as they can. We hope to provide an EPIC end of the year event showcasing the world premiere of documentary and local music talent of the area headlining The Redd Katz (Moiety). 

  • When you donate you can receive great perks such as producer credits, got moiety t-shirts, digital and hard album copies, digital & hard copy of the documentary and concert tickets to release concert during late April 2015 in Santa Fe, NM. 

  • If we for some reason do not reach our goal any money received will still go to the project and be used in the best way possible to make this dream that Tamara Colaque (the director/producer etc) her crew (hardworking cinematic arts & technology students from the Institute of American Indian Arts) Moiety/Redd Katz (producers and band members) and Jimmy Shendo (producer/story/star)  have had for several years come true. 

The Impact

  • This project will be used for the main purpose of showcasing the great musical and acting talent the "Land of Enchantment" has to offer and is sometimes sadly overlooked. 
  • Jimmy Shendo & Moiety was a popular band which consisted of many talented artists from New Mexico, who has a growing following in the area and have been called some of the greatest musicians in the New Mexico area. 
  • Our main goal of promoting the talent of the New Mexico area is a passion that Jimmy and his loved ones have hoped to accomplish in some small or large part with this documentary and concert by showing it around the country and hopefully the world through film festivals and hopeful distribution.
target="_blank">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJEVS73ByjI

Risks & Challenges

  • The only major challenge in this project is time management with all those involved and we plan to work around everyone's schedule to capture on video the best story possible and showcase some amazing local talent. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this with anyone who you feel can help and get the word out about this great project.


Find This Campaign On (Coming Soon)

www.liferoadproduction.com

story:
Who we are!

Hey y'all! 
Welcome to our IndieGoGo campaign! We are the Lauren Zoeller Band - a Blues band nestled away in the heart of good ol' music city, Nashville, Tennessee! 
Wondering what we have to offer? 
Close your eyes and imagine this: 
A soulful blues singer, a swingin' jazz drummer, a honky tonk fiddle player, a rock and roll guitarist, a studio utility player, and a funk bassist ALL come together to create a new hip sound.
Pretty cool right?! Well, that's The Lauren Zoeller Band! 
With influences such as Blind Lemon Jefferson, Miles Davis, Stevie Ray Vaughn, Hank Williams Jr., Etta James, and Keith Richards, the Lauren Zoeller Band breaks the barriers of genres by connecting them through their historical root in blues. Add the ambitious flare of young, undiscovered talent, and the result is a unique style that is universal in listener appeal. 

Why We Need You & Your Support!

We are setting out to create our very first ALL ORIGINAL debut album and we need your help to make it happen. As mentioned in the video, ANY amount you can contribute is greatly appreciated. We have several amazing incentives that we all know you will love! 
Risks & Challenges

In most recording situations, record labels financially back all albums but reserve the right to make all artistic decisions regarding the production of the music. By keeping the project independent, we have decided to maintain our artistic license which allows us to present a project untainted by views solely based on profit. This is why money is so important in helping this project come to life. We have made the  decision to not allow a record label to steal our artistic dignity. We hope that through our artistic input and the help of our fans (that means YOU!) that we can create an album full of love and expression. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please do us a favor and share our campaign with any and everyone that you know! Please use the share tools provided on this site to post to social media and email our link to your family and friends. You can also head to http://www.laurenzoeller.com to grab all  the information you need to stay connected on our journey from beginning to end! 

ALSO! JUST for being a fan! Take a FREE listen to a rough take from our Indiegogo Video Shoot and River Man Rehearsal. Just click the link below!

https://soundcloud.com/lauren-zoeller-1/river-m...

story:
Musketeer Gripweed, a critically acclaimed Colorado blues-fusion band of 15 years, has toured the U.S. extensively, and shared the stage with major acts such as The Revivalists, JJ Grey & Mofro, Los Lobos, Trampled by Turtles, Greensky Bluegrass, Aquarium Rescue Unit and many more.  

This is the first time we have asked our community of family and friends for financial support.

We have always taken a lot of pride in working hard as a band, playing the gigs, and funding our albums ourselves.  That's just not possible right now.

In 2020, we're reaching out to you for help through this campaign to record some of our best work yet.

 

 

More Than Ever

 

In late 2019, we started pre-production of the songs to be released on the new album, More Than Ever, with the goal to hit the studio in February 2020.   In March, everything changed.

Due to the pandemic, our studio sessions were delayed several times and our plans to fund the album ourselves were halted.   Without shows, we thought this project was dead in the water.

Finally, in June 2020, we were able to use personal funds to finish the basic tracking of this new CD at The Blasting Room Studios in our hometown of Fort Collins, CO.  We hired some of the best in the business, Grammy-nominated producer, Andrew Berlin (Gregory Alan Issacov, Rise Against), and in-house engineer Chris Beeble.

Stretching every dollar we could pull together, we were able to create something we love. But, there is so much more to do and we can't finish it without some outside help.

We need to pay for mastering, promotions, merchandise, music videos, pressing CDs/Vinyl, and so much more.

In order to complete More Than Ever , we are looking to our fans and community for the support to get this album done right.  

Without a doubt, we love how this album sounds already.  It's truly incredible.  Varying styles & tempos, insightful lyrics, and amazing production work. It is some of the finest music we've recorded to date. 

And, we want to get this into the hands of radio stations and promoters who can continue to help us grow as a band, and return to the big stages we love once that is safe to do so.  All of this takes significant financial resources to make it happen.

However, we also wanted to do things a little different than other album crowdfunding campaigns...

 

 

So Much More Music

 

Over the last several years, we have written material for at least three albums, including the tracks you will hear on More Than Ever.   

So, our goal for this campaign is really pretty simple: We only want to fundraise once.  We want to finish More Than Ever AND record 2 more albums.

Fundraising is new to us, but we are setting our sights high to be able to look forward to the next couple years, the limited options for touring, and the insane amount of music we are writing.  With your help, we can unleash all of this new music to our fans.  Your support will take us to a whole new level of our careers and continue to push us for another 15 years!

 

 

Thank You...Thank You...Thank You

 

We can't say thank you enough to those who can support us to continue to do what we love and create music for you all.  From the way More Than Ever sounds already, we will not disappoint!

Thank you, thank you, thank you to all those that have supported us on this wild 15 year journey and those who continue to do so.   None of this would be possible without your generosity and energy.

With love, more than ever...

Musketeer Gripweed
Jason, Matt, Stu, Lance, and Ben

 

 

What We Need

 

Here is the specific breakdown of what we need to raise through this campaign and how we will use it:

 

 

What Does More Than Ever mean to you?

 

More Than Ever started out as a love song. As we recorded and listened back to the tune, we knew as a band it would become the name of the album. The term itself took on a life of its own and became a concept we've turned around and asked the community. 

In addition to creating music we are passionate about, we want to encourage our community to recognize their own passions during these difficult times. 

We gave this challenge to our community and asked them to make their own More Than Ever videos, answering the question, "What is your 'more than ever'?"  The responses have been amazing.

 

 

Who the f*@& is Musketeer Gripweed anyway?

 

The band began from humble beginnings in 2005 when Ben and Jason were neighbors in Fort Collins, Colorado and started casually playing some music together.  Soon after, Gripweed was formed.  Jason's roots in the blues and Ben's wide musical background created an instant bond that led to deep songwriting sessions and their first album release, "Peace Will Win".

The name 'Musketeer Gripweed' was taken from a John Lennon reference, specifically his character's name when he acted in the movie "How I Won the War".  And, legend has it that he would use that 'Musketeer Gripweed' pseudonym as an alias when checking into hotels.  The name was strange, but it stuck with fans and friends alike.

 

 

Fast forward to 2008 and Matt Goldberg joined them on keys, bringing a whole new dimension to the music.  Matt brought many layers of sounds to the songwriting with piano, organ, and synths sounds layered over top of the blues.  The music turned towards a more blues-funk sound than ever before.

 

 

In 2010, the band recorded their next album, "Dyin Day" at Backbone Studios in Loveland, CO.  During these sessions, the band met the incredible Sheryl Renee and her companions in the Black Swan Singers group, which has continued to this day as an amazing friendship and musical bond.   

The album received critical praise not only for the songs, but Jason's lyrical growth touching on subjects of social justice and a need for change.

 

 

In summer 2010, Gripweed needed a sub on drums for some upcoming shows.  Matt and Stu Crair had been playing already together in another project, Dead Floyd, at the time.  Stu sat down at the drum throne with the guys for his first show with the band at NewWestFest and has never looked back, taking over full-time soon after.  Stu's driving beats and deep roots in funk and jazz became infused with the music, and the songwriting began to go a whole new direction.

 

 

Around this time, the band's popularity began to explode across Colorado and beyond.  Working with new management, Gripweed toured extensively across the U.S., opening for major acts and playing the festival circuit.

 

 

Over the next few years, the band continued to grow musically with two more full length releases, "Straight Razor Revival" and "Floods and Fires".  "Floods and Fires" was the most intense work the band had done to date, travelling to Los Angeles to work with producer Justin Andres.  Songs like "End of the Day" and "9 LB Hammer" are sill on regular rotation on Colorado radio stations.

Listen to "Floods & Fires" on Spotify

 

Packing the house regularly, the band started to find a balance between playing shows on the road and staying home as families grew.   There was always an intense focus on 'family first' with Gripweed, and making sure the band members were able to keep the music alive but their homes lives intact.

 

 

After the departure of longtime guitarist Ehren Crumpler in 2018, Lance Ruby joined the band on guitar.  Bringing a whole new level of musicianship to the band, Lance had an accomplished background with a Masters in Jazz from UNC, but an even more varied resume of performing  with everything from funk to country bands. 

With Lance on board, the band began stretching their writing capabilities and the songs gained an edgier rock sound like never before.  The musical growth of a 15 year life span as a band in the new songs is obvious to the Gripweed fan base.

 

 

Today, you can continue to hear that Gripweed's music is evolving as much as ever. The way in which each member continues to push each other to be better as individual musicians and collectively as a group has led us to the new album, More Than Ever. 

For those that have been with us for this entire ride, we know that you will love what you hear. 

For anyone new to Gripweed, we think this is our best work yet and we are so excited to share it with you.

While shows have mostly halted for 2020, we know that we will back to a busy gigging schedule once allowed and continuing  another 15 years of music for you.  Thank you all for your continued support of the band, and our passion to constantly bring you new music.  We could not do this without you.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you've read this far but you aren't in a position to contribute financially to this campaign, you can still help us out! Share this IndieGoGo with your friends and family and help us spread the word about More Than Ever and the upcoming two albums to come.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MusketeerGripweed

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/msktrgripweed/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmlT9QF1nVGZGbfVLz7W0xQ

 

Campaign Photo/Video Credits: Backstage Flash, Jim Mimna, Phil Broste, Nicholas Stock/Fat Guerilla Productions

story:
Hi,

my name is Philipp and I am a world citizen born and raised in Germany to a German mother and a Serbian-Bosnian father. I have lived, studied and worked abroad in Turkey, Palestine and Egypt and traveled most of Europe and the Middle East. As a result, my art and personality are profoundly shaped by these diverse influences.

So far I have written and compose poems and songs in four languages: German, English, Turkish and Arabic. Playing the guitar as well as Turkish Saz and Ney (Oriental Flute) I, both willingly and subconsciously blended different styles of music, poetry and emotion, resulting in what I feel is a new and original, still authentic expression of handmade Folk-Music.

Feeling a constantly growing connection to the tradition of traveling musicians and bards or ‘aşık’, the "loving one", in Turkish I dedicated myself more and more to substantial music and topics such as love, fear, (self-chosen) exile and hope, to express innermost feelings with the utmost honesty and empathy. While sharing some of my musical and poetic work with dear friends who had experienced prolonged physical and/or emotional hardship, I was blessed enough to find out that it moved them just as much as me, expressing feelings that had never been released or revealed before. To be able to not only help or even heal yourself but others with your art as well, is one of the greatest gifts and feelings ever and I am deeply grateful for it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 3000 $ to produce and record 9-10 songs for the Demo CD in a professional studio. Another 1000 $ are estimated for necessary travel and borrowing musical and technical equipment where needed.

Every supporter who donates 30 $ or more will receive a CD with my demo songs, 3 in English, 3 in Turkish, 3 in German, 1 Surprise Song, with a booklet including the English translation of all lyrics.

If I don’t reach the entire funding goal, I will use the collected funds to still record as many songs as possible, either 2 songs for each language or 3 songs in English and Turkish each to start my search for a record label.

 

The Impact

What I can offer is honest, substantial music for which I sometimes put my heart and soul on the line to find ways and expressions that truly connect to other people’s feelings and realities. I believe I can translate – literally, musically and emotionally – between the so called East and West to help people understand each other and to make them feel understood. Your support helps me on this way and my next major step towards this goal.

This is my first major music recording project, but it is by far not my first intercultural project bridging difficult cultural gaps. With a previous crowdfunding project on startnext I realized a year-long music workshop project with teenagers from different religious and social backgrounds in Bethlehem, Palestine. In Germany I have coached young refugees from the Balkans, Turkey and Syria on their way to form a band from scratch, guiding them from their first encounter with a musical instrument until their final performances live on stage in front of an audience. In addition, I am the first foreign student to ever successfully complete and, despite the difficult circumstances, pull through a post-graduate program (including a year at the national conservatory of music) in the West Bank, Palestine.

Risks & Challenges

When I succeed to find a record label supporting me, my plan is to create an album that tells my story(ies) in four different languages and musical traditions to merge them into something completely new. This has rarely done before, especially by a single person and as far as the Arabic and Turkish Singer-Songwriter Traditions are concerned, I might as well be the first person coming from a different background and country to write and play self-written Folk-Music and Poetry in their respective languages and style.

 

This creates not only musical and lingual challenges, but also numerous logistic and practical difficulties, such as traveling to remote places to purchase appropriate instruments or rare books and poetry as well as immersing myself in different cultures and world views. Besides these environmental issues there are more specific challenges like me recording oriental instruments for the first time in a professional studio or singing again after a very long break, still re-discovering my singing voice. I am confident though to solve these problems, since this is not my first experience with a intercultural music project as I have mentioned above.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This current project is a development in progress, but I am happy and grateful about the process so far which is why I want to start sharing my journey with you. Knowing that there is still a lot of room for improvement, I am always open to new ideas and very much welcome your feedback.

Even if you cannot donate at the moment for whatever reasons, you support is still very valuable and you can spread the word and share my project with others.

Thank you very much for your interest and your support,

with love,

Philipp
story_txt:
Hi,
my name is Philipp and I am a world citizen born and raised in Germany to a German mother and a Serbian-Bosnian father. I have lived, studied and worked abroad in Turkey, Palestine and Egypt and traveled most of Europe and the Middle East. As a result, my art and personality are profoundly shaped by these diverse influences.
So far I have written and compose poems and songs in four languages: German, English, Turkish and Arabic. Playing the guitar as well as Turkish Saz and Ney (Oriental Flute) I, both willingly and subconsciously blended different styles of music, poetry and emotion, resulting in what I feel is a new and original, still authentic expression of handmade Folk-Music.
Feeling a constantly growing connection to the tradition of traveling musicians and bards or ‘aşık’, the "loving one", in Turkish I dedicated myself more and more to substantial music and topics such as love, fear, (self-chosen) exile and hope, to express innermost feelings with the utmost honesty and empathy. While sharing some of my musical and poetic work with dear friends who had experienced prolonged physical and/or emotional hardship, I was blessed enough to find out that it moved them just as much as me, expressing feelings that had never been released or revealed before. To be able to not only help or even heal yourself but others with your art as well, is one of the greatest gifts and feelings ever and I am deeply grateful for it.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need 3000 $ to produce and record 9-10 songs for the Demo CD in a professional studio. Another 1000 $ are estimated for necessary travel and borrowing musical and technical equipment where needed.
Every supporter who donates 30 $ or more will receive a CD with my demo songs, 3 in English, 3 in Turkish, 3 in German, 1 Surprise Song, with a booklet including the English translation of all lyrics.
If I don’t reach the entire funding goal, I will use the collected funds to still record as many songs as possible, either 2 songs for each language or 3 songs in English and Turkish each to start my search for a record label.
 

The Impact
What I can offer is honest, substantial music for which I sometimes put my heart and soul on the line to find ways and expressions that truly connect to other people’s feelings and realities. I believe I can translate – literally, musically and emotionally – between the so called East and West to help people understand each other and to make them feel understood. Your support helps me on this way and my next major step towards this goal.
This is my first major music recording project, but it is by far not my first intercultural project bridging difficult cultural gaps. With a previous crowdfunding project on startnext I realized a year-long music workshop project with teenagers from different religious and social backgrounds in Bethlehem, Palestine. In Germany I have coached young refugees from the Balkans, Turkey and Syria on their way to form a band from scratch, guiding them from their first encounter with a musical instrument until their final performances live on stage in front of an audience. In addition, I am the first foreign student to ever successfully complete and, despite the difficult circumstances, pull through a post-graduate program (including a year at the national conservatory of music) in the West Bank, Palestine.

Risks & Challenges
When I succeed to find a record label supporting me, my plan is to create an album that tells my story(ies) in four different languages and musical traditions to merge them into something completely new. This has rarely done before, especially by a single person and as far as the Arabic and Turkish Singer-Songwriter Traditions are concerned, I might as well be the first person coming from a different background and country to write and play self-written Folk-Music and Poetry in their respective languages and style.
 
This creates not only musical and lingual challenges, but also numerous logistic and practical difficulties, such as traveling to remote places to purchase appropriate instruments or rare books and poetry as well as immersing myself in different cultures and world views. Besides these environmental issues there are more specific challenges like me recording oriental instruments for the first time in a professional studio or singing again after a very long break, still re-discovering my singing voice. I am confident though to solve these problems, since this is not my first experience with a intercultural music project as I have mentioned above.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
This current project is a development in progress, but I am happy and grateful about the process so far which is why I want to start sharing my journey with you. Knowing that there is still a lot of room for improvement, I am always open to new ideas and very much welcome your feedback.
Even if you cannot donate at the moment for whatever reasons, you support is still very valuable and you can spread the word and share my project with others.
Thank you very much for your interest and your support,
with love,
Philipp

story:
EurAsian Gold  

CD album 

 

violin/ piano music by Nikolaj Medtner & 

EurAsian fusion by Viktoria Elisabeth Kaunzner

with Oleg Poliansky (piano) & UKOREVV:

Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.

 

 

 

"Unique" (Fono Forum)  

 

Dear music lovers,

 

would you take some calm 30 minutes of your appreciated time you will learn and listen about an amazing musical topic: EurAsian Gold - a new CD coming soon in 2021.

Above you find a beautiful video. ​The whole project only could happen thanks to my highly appreciated colleagues Oleg Poliansky (piano), Lee Seunghee (haegeum/ Korean violin) & Kim Hyoyoung (saengwhwang/ Chinese mouth Organ) and UKOREVV e.V.

 Currently we are negotiating the label contract with SONY CLASSICAL which would be fantastic to work out for this exciting programme!

The year 2020 was a very hard one because of the COVID - 19 pandemic, which significantly affected the musical scene. Many concerts were cancelled on very short terms, such as an important orchestra concert at the famous Lotte Concert Hall Seoul with the plan to be broadcasted by Korean TV. Viktoria´s newly arranged piece "Lucid Dreams" was part of the program. 

Lotte Concert Hall Seoul

 

Because of this disastrous Corona year many freelance musicians used the time for recording sessions and video shootings - isolated from audiences and beloved friends. It is a time when humans tend to accept a dimension of "audio-visual autism". This can last for a while but cannot replace any analogue activity or fundamentally change our behavior. Still, Germany seems to keep an exception worldwide and some of our friends perform again in South Korea - as normality.  

https://www.bz-berlin.de/leute/geiger-daniel-ho...

Ten years ago - in 2010 - I had been selected at the age of  28 years as the youngest Western professor of violin in the history of South Korea for the former branch of Music University Franz Liszt Weimar - the German School of Music - at Kangnam University, and stayed for 7 years. I regard this as an enormous gift to my life, having spent such a long time in this energetic country in East Asia - "A nation of winners" (The Strad London) and having studied the Korean language, too. 

During these 7 years I have been through phases of heavy jet lag, and I realized that my energy level became weaker - also influenced by many stimuli from a mega city such as Seoul. I realized to be a more sensitive person than one would expect, and started to compose more than ever in my new home and exile at the same time. Additionally I started to focus and withdrew from all outer influences and voluntarily became an frequent guest - next to concert stage - in the recording studio - with only one goal: getting out the best from music and each specific atmosphere, alone or with others: forever. During this years also MERS hit South Korea, and additional silence was imposed for a couple of weeks.  All in all I fell in love with South Korea and especially its traditional fascinating music - GUGAK. I´d like to share this fantastic cosmos of sounds and interesting Korean instruments with the audiences in Europe.

This was the beginning of a long story around NIKOLAI MEDTNER and UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.  

 

"American Record Guide benchmarks Viktoria´s third recording among the top 3: “Like many composers who also make music as interpreters, she has a deeper insight into music than others. Even Ysaÿe's own contrasting reverie, impulsiveness and explosiveness can be heard in her interpretation." (about "Les Furies", Hänssler Classic)

I would like to introduce you to my fourth CD recording: the debut recording of UKOREVV Universal Organic Korean Ensemble  - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V.: It includes fantastic romantic music by Russian composer Nikolai Medtner (1880-1951) as well as my own composition "Golden Sponge". This project is an homage to Medtner´s birthday on January 5th and also in 2021 to his 70th year of death. Rachmaninow said Medtner was the greatest composer of their time. I am also very happy to launch my international EurAsian ensemble UKOREVV e.V., a non-profit organization which has its main profile in the fusion of Western and East Asian music - next to excellent evergreens of the the standard repertory. This CD was recorded to be reference No 1 worldwide on the Ex-Midori/ David Guarneri del Gesù violin thanks to Florian Leonhard Fine Violins London - a super violin, fitting to my hands and character. Might I tell a little anecdote around this violin: Practicing on this instrument on the second floor - my mom furiously entered the room and asked me what I had done - my response was: "just practicing" - On the first floor in the house a painting had fallen from the wall  - because of this little magic powerful instrument and its long G string vibes... ;-) 

Thanks to UKOREVV e. V. we can contribute with this musical jewel to the musical scene - despite Corona. 

 For the finish line of this project - delivering Medtner's unique and rarely performed music to a wider audience - we kindly ask for your help! 

.

Discover more about the story behind this project & enjoy !! 

"A violinist with a questing mind - beautiful her compositions" (The Strad London)

 

Recordings of Medtner´s sonatas at Beethoven Hall Hannover with Oleg Poliansky (piano), page turner Teresa Skade (former Odipo) & Viktoria

 

Once upon a time,

In 2005, I was in Paris studying at the Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique et de Danse staying at my dear cinematographic host family during my Erasmus semester, Marc & Olivier Sandberg and Dina Sofer, a painter and psychologist. One evening they showed an old record to me with songs by Nikolaj Medtner - a name I had never heard before - , I was a youngster. I fell immediately in love with this beautiful, intense and intellectual music. So I started to study the first sonata. Step by step I had learned and performed all of his sonatas and smaller pieces for violin and piano putting my bloody heart into it. As a curious person I always wanted to know more about Medtner´s personal background next to analysis of the music to answer why it took me in such a trance. And to say a little pre-answer: 

It is indirectly connected to spirituality and "musical yoga".

Nikolai Karlovitch Medtner was born in 1880 into a Russian family of German descent, the mother was a singer, the father had worked his way up to the director of a Moscow textile factory and enabled his children to receive an upper-class, profound humanistic education. The youngest son soon became one of the best piano students at the Moscow Conservatory. At the same time he studied composition privately with Sergei Taneyev. A deep friendship connected him with his fellow student Sergei Rachmaninoff bet that character was characterized by his radical openness to musical questions, which made life difficult for him. On some musical trips, musically, he despised his contemporaries those who, from his point of view, violated the sacred rules of music theory and who tried to enforce their musical language successfully and individually, among others C. Debussy, R. Strauss and I. Strawinsky. He published his musical views in the book "The Muse and The Mode". To him, Bach and Beethoven were considered the absolute masters of the form. "No other composer has mastered the sonata form with such perfection as Medtner", notes Alexander Goldenweiser. In insider circles Medtner is regarded as romantic Russian Bach. With his oldest brother Emil, a philosopher, lawyer and closest friend of his youngest brother they experienced a complicated relationship with violinist and singer Anna Markgraf who was first engaged to Nicolai but then married Emil. After two years this marriage was divorced, Anna married Nikolai idolising him their whole life. In 1909 - aged 29 years - Medtner became a professor of piano at the Moscow Conservatory. He declined an offer for a professorship in New York as he was afraid of too many travels,  institutional business and the loss of time that arose from teaching. He preferred a life for composing in peace. The Medtners left Russia in 1921 as opponents of the October Revolution and after disappointing attempts to settle in Berlin, Paris and Florenz finally chose London as their final destination.  

Nikolai K. Medtner (1880-1951)

In 1935 Nikolai Medtner converted from Protestantism to Orthodox Christianity as his new home giving spiritual hold. He dedicated his last piece, a piano quintet: to God. Already at an advanced age and bitter in a certain way about the lack of interest in his work one day a special message reached him by Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar, South India: His Majesty, The last Maharajah of Mysore, himself amateur pianist, was overwhelmed by Medtner´s fairy tales in Berlin lying on the piano of his sister who was studying piano at the University of Arts in Berlin. The young Maharaja was so enthusiastic about Medtner´s music that he swore himself to support Nikolai Medtner as his young patron. From this point of time, in 1946, already older than 60 years  - supported by a noble man half of his age - the composer could fulfil his dream: to record his works and to compose without stress until the end of his life in 1951. As a big MERCI Medtner dedicated his third piano concerto to the Maharaja.  

https://interlude.hk/maharaja-music/

Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar, Maharaja of Mysore, South India, the young patron of Medtner

 

About Nikolai Medtner´s 2 violin sonatas 

The violin sonata number 1 Opus 21 in B minor 1910/11 pays homage to the Greek god of wine Dionysus as God's spiritual and physical intoxication. Dionysus was honored in ecstatic chants and dances which is reflected in movements like "canzona - danza and ditirambo" - an alternating song which ionizes stormy rapturous songs of praise between the choir and cantor of the Dionysia.

 

A stormy sequence on the 3rd mouvement leading into a mesmerising melodic "placido"

 

In the so-called Spring Sonata No. 2 Opus 44 in G major 1927, Medtner describes the poem  "Sturzbach im Frühling" ("spring waters") written by Fyodor Tyutchev which also inspired Rachmaninov in one of his famous songs.

This theme occurs in the final mouvement. The first mouvement is led by the motif of the muses in a tender magical side theme. The middle set of the set of variations has echoes of orthodox church music, especially in two cadenzas of the violin. The variations exude a distinctive dance-like rhythmic evolution mode and reminiscent of balalaika sounds. "This piece has everyone who got to know it enthusiastically and amazed, of course, nobody writes such pieces anymore nor could they write." (excerpt from a letter from violinist Alexander Medtner to his brother Nikolai, Moscow January 3, 1927)

 

a Golden Sponge - (Aplysina Aerophoba) 

„Golden Sponge“ – Aplysina aerophoba – „Goldschwamm“ is an underwater music about a mysterious animal without brain and bones – a sponge. Its live span covers 800-10.000 years. It received its inspiration through a report at ARTE-TV where Prof. Peter Proksch, a friend of mine from Düsseldorf University tells about the potential of sponges in the sea, especially the „Golden Sponge“: Its biochemical metabolisms and toxins can be analysed and synthetically produced as medicine as well as varnish in the ship industry as long it is ecologically compatible. The „Golden Sponge“ is often surrounded by sea horses. „Tylodina perversa“, or the „Golden Sponge Snail“, profites from the Golden Sponge through mimesis. The Golden Sponge lives alone or in colonies. Taken from water into the air it immediately shapes to blueblack colour. The piece shows the metamorphosis of this unseen animal to an important supplement for human beings. It is dedicated to Prof. Jürgen Claus - with Nora and their friends Prof. Dr. Lothar & Korinna Prox as well as sheng specialist Wu Wei. Jürgen Claus was a friend of Paik Nam June and made video diving installations underwater. The music is composed for haegum, piri, Chinese saengwhang (mouth organ), violin and specials. It bridges Seoul and Düsseldorf in the 21st century: „Fluxus“ is „Flouxus“ with the magic musical power of the vowel „o“.

On a meta level "Golden Sponge" is an apokalyptic piece about the world which was destroyed from the Western civilisations and the need to expand - in an aggressive way. This music is an indirect desperate attempt to live. The sponge is an allrounder - having lived since ten thousands of years - with a minimum of energy. Humans want to detect everything, driven by their curiosity and greed for more. In the end nature will take revenge - and it has already taken place. Now I write - thanks to Corona - from 2020 nature could recover a bit - if we assume that sustainable energies might really heal the damage . We know that the only changeable thing is our own behaviour. And it also is an homage to the violin and acoustic musical instruments  - which don't need a wire - nearly an animistic point of view next to the Eurocentric way of thinking. A Tsunami cools humans down - as a Thunbergesque prophetic musical expression.

 

The Golden Sponge metamorphises to a Golden Star - nature is manipulated by human beings -tender fragile music becomes a funky hip-hop pattern 

 

"A violinist, composer, play director and living orchestra in one person - on the highest level" (Ivry Gitlis)

 

Thanks to wonderful colleagues and people this project could happen!

Florian Leonhard gives the Ex-Midori/ David Guarneri del Gesù violin (1735) to Viktoria

At several concerts I made a questionnaire about Medtner´s music:

 

Oleg Poliansky is prize winner of many international competitions, first of all of the international Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow` (Russia) in 1998. In addition to that, he won prizes in Tokyo (Japan) in 1986, in Montreal (Canada) in 1988, at `The international Duo Competition in memoriam of Christian Ferras and  Pierre Barbìzet in Marseille (France) in 1997, at the `World Pianno Competition`in Cincinnati (USA) in 1999 as well as at `Citta di Cantu (Italy) in 1998 and 2003. In the course of his career, Mr. Poliansky has made appearance at the largest international concert arenas and given concerts as a soloist with renomated orchestras such as, e.g., The Moscow Soloists, The Moscow Sympony Orchestra, The National Symphony of Ukraine, The Novosibirsk Sympony Orchestra, the Urals Symphony Orchestra Yekaterinburg, Budapest Strings; Neue Philarmonie Westfallen, Sinfonietta Hungarica, Junge Philarmonie Köln, The National Orchestra of Malta, Orchestra Giovanile della Calabria-Italy, The KBS National Radio Orchestra of Korea, Mariinsky Theatre Symphony Orchestra, Pusan Philharmonic Orchestra and Seoul Philharmonic Orchestra with  Myung-Whun Chung .Oleg Poliansky has been living in Köln as well since 1993 and holds the academic position of Associate Professor for Major Piano at Hochschule für Musik Köln since 2007.

Hyo-young Kim (left) is a prominent professional SaengHwang performer from Korea, Hyo-young Kim has received the spotlight for the revival of this Korean traditional instrument through her creative musical pieces. She won the Women New’s 2013 Rising Female Artist Award as well as the 2015 KBS Gugak (Korean traditional music) Award in the wind instrument category. She is currently working as a guest professor at the graduate music school of arts in Sookmyung Women’s University.

Lee Seunghee (haegum, left on the foto) is one of the most aspiring artists in Korea today. Her ability to interpret a wide range of repertoires—from Korean traditional music to contemporary music from both inside and across Korea’s borders—showcase her characteristic. Next to her ensemble work she has also been a busy soloist, producing such recordings as "Seunghee Lee: Haegeum Jul-pungnyu”(2009), "Lee Seunghee: The Singing Haegeum"(2009), and a series of recordings that she began in 2018 called "The PAAN of Haegeum.” Her continuing pioneering work in this series includes singing and playing to the accompaniment of restored gramophone records. To Lee, "PAAN" [pan] means soil or sweat. She has walked the soil where “real” performances happen, and has sweated together with the people of the land upon which she walked, experiencing the power of life through those moments of connection—her creative motivation. Lee Seunghee has a Ph.D. and a BA from Seoul National University, and an MA from Korea National University of Arts. Currently, she is a professor in the Dept. of Music at Yeongnam University.

recording session of Viktoria´s piece "Golden Sponge" at Yulhaus Seoul, with Lee Seunghee and Yoo Hyo Young

 

Viktoria Elisabeth Kaunzner is a worldwide performing violin soloist, chamber musician, professor, producer and composer "with esprit ... wonderful her compositions" (The Strad). In 2019 Violeta Dinescu dedicated her violin concerto "Roman Fleuve" to her and she has premiered several pieces dedicated to her such as by F.E. Spannheimer, J. Liebrecht, D. Agazzi, JY Choi, X. Bouchaud as well as pieces by L. Streich, B. Muntendorf or J. Jamet. Viktoria´s own composition "Jasmine Rice" for violin & orchestra is published by Furore Edition Kassel, along with other works. She has performed e.g. in Berlin and Cologne Philharmonic Halls, Seoul Arts Center, Salle Pleyel, Paris Philharmonic, Teatro de la Scalao Milano, Prinzregententheater and Gasteig Munich a.m. o. From 2010 to 2018 she was the youngest professor in the history of South Korea at the German School of Music Weimar, Kangnam University. Since then she has been teaching at Victory Academy Berlin for musical excellence® and has accepted invitations from renowned faculties in Vienna, the Juilliard School N.Y., and Fundacion Barenboim-Said. In 2021 she is a guest professor at the University of the Arts Zurich,  Yasar University in Izmir and Concervatorio Superiore de Valencia. American Record Guide ranks their third CD with all of Eugène Ysaÿe's solo sonatas and one of their own works among the top 3 worldwide. Fono Fonorum states that their music fits surprisingly well as an extension to the music of Ysaÿe and Paganini. Since 2020 she has been producing her music "New Silk Road" as a functioning chocolate record single. In the same year she was hired as a Paganini virtuoso in the ARD TV crime thriller. Viktoria bridges in the performer-composer tradition a unique musical personality – from east to west – creating mesmerising sounds through a fusion of Western and Eastern instruments. She founded UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V., Berlin, an ensemble with young soloists and chamber musicians who are also composers - searching for Western and East Asian sounds as a synesthetical integral but also performing standard repertory. During the Covid 19 pandemics UKOREVV e.V. organises together with Kasseler Kulturforum e.V. the international competition for violin-flute duos "Corona Encore-Coffee Mask". Legendary violinist and intellectual Ivry Gitlis calls the Stradivari artist  - "a violinist, composer and director at the highest level". 

 

YOU can support this campaign and will receive

perks - like "symphony" or "melody". Besides the new CD you receive other musical presents related to "EurAsian Gold":

* You can book online lessons with UKOREVV e. V. in a shared Zoom meeting

*  all dear friends of "EurAsian Gold" who will donate more than 200 Euros to this campaign will be mentioned by their name or if wished as anonymous in the CD booklet

* generous donators will be dedicated a piece exclusively composed for them

* the person donating the highest amount - more or including 10.000 Euros - will additionally receive the dedication of the whole CD clearly noted in the CD booklet

* persons donating more than 5.000 Euros will be announced "honoured patron" of 

Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.

 

All fundings will support UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V. in order to have budget for new plans in 2021 and later. There are plans for a Korean strings excellence festival in cooperation with Korea Foundation Seoul . We are also in communication with Australia based composer Elena Kats-Chernin for composing an concerto as well as with Malaysian composer Kee Yong Chong.

 

The big challenge

It was a strong wish to show the beauty of Medtner´s music, the music of a forgotten composer, to a wider audience as well as EurAsian fusion. Yielding finest results - even if there were also many hurdles around organisation, travel, coordination etc.- is our only vision.

Despite Corona times foundations do not financially support CD recordings or video productions. EurAsian Gold is an exclusively produced album and the results are of superbe quality.

2020 a literal "Corona inflation" of streams started - all for free - which brings many musicians to their own ruin. Here you can read an interview with Daniel Hope who had also studied with Z. Bron saying that we need high quality technical support while recording/ video sessions to keep our ears fine tuned during and after the pandemics: https://www.abendblatt.de/podcast/erstklassisch...

The whole project - two recording sessions in five days involving at all 14 people - excellent musicians, producers, sound engineers, video artists - was an investment of more than 35.000 Euros under top conditions. One of our producers, Michael Fine, is a Grammy Award winner and a very experienced supervisor having worked as artistic advisor at major orchestras worldwide. 

 

International expert of Medtner´s music, Prof. Dr. Christoph Flamm has written the booklet notes and a recommendation letter.In order to be able to schedule new projects while the Corona pandemics and after it is tremendously important receiving sponsoring from our fans and companies. If you simply cannot contribute to this campaign please share it, make some noise about it - if it comes from your heart. UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V. Berlin wants to create more exciting concerts with the aspects of a synestheticale integrale - performed by the world's most outstanding young soloists and chamber musicians in their fields.

IAWM - International Alliance of Women in Music has just released an article about UKOREVV in its winter edition 2021:

 

 

 

Golden Sponge performances in Seoul & Berlin

 

3 CDs - 

all nominated for a Echo Klassik

 

 

Benchmarked among the top 3 Ysaye recordings world wide by

American Record Guide

"Hervorragend musiziert" / "An outstanding interpretation" (Neue Musikzeitung)

"Unbeatable" (The Absolute Sound)

"A stunning album" (American Record Guide)

 

 ​If you want to donate to non profit organisation UKOREVV-Universal Korean Organic Ensemble e.V., Berlin, please email to me, I will send you the account details and you will receive a donation receipt.  info@viktoriakaunzner.com

 

Many thanks 

to Lily & Klaus Heiliger, families Dr. Florence & Dr. Alexandre Laurent, Dr. Walter & Ulrike Kaunzner, the Board of UKOREVV with Juliane Rudloff & Robert Grabein and many other people who supported this project in private soirées thanks to their kindness and passion for music.

 

 All dear friends of "EurAsian Gold" who will donate more than 200 Euros will be mentioned in the CD booklet.

 

Thank you for listening and reading! 

You are cordially invited learning more about the amazing 

perks on the right side on top of this exclusive campaign.

 

With kind regards,

Yours

Viktoria 

&

Universal Korean Organic Ensemble -

Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.

& the Board of Directors
story_txt: EurAsian Gold  CD album  violin/ piano music by Nikolaj Medtner & EurAsian fusion by Viktoria Elisabeth Kaunznerwith Oleg Poliansky (piano) & UKOREVV:Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.   "Unique" (Fono Forum)   Dear music lovers, would you take some calm 30 minutes of your appreciated time you will learn and listen about an amazing musical topic: EurAsian Gold - a new CD coming soon in 2021.Above you find a beautiful video. ​The whole project only could happen thanks to my highly appreciated colleagues Oleg Poliansky (piano), Lee Seunghee (haegeum/ Korean violin) & Kim Hyoyoung (saengwhwang/ Chinese mouth Organ) and UKOREVV e.V. Currently we are negotiating the label contract with SONY CLASSICAL which would be fantastic to work out for this exciting programme!The year 2020 was a very hard one because of the COVID - 19 pandemic, which significantly affected the musical scene. Many concerts were cancelled on very short terms, such as an important orchestra concert at the famous Lotte Concert Hall Seoul with the plan to be broadcasted by Korean TV. Viktoria´s newly arranged piece "Lucid Dreams" was part of the program. Lotte Concert Hall Seoul Because of this disastrous Corona year many freelance musicians used the time for recording sessions and video shootings - isolated from audiences and beloved friends. It is a time when humans tend to accept a dimension of "audio-visual autism". This can last for a while but cannot replace any analogue activity or fundamentally change our behavior. Still, Germany seems to keep an exception worldwide and some of our friends perform again in South Korea - as normality.  https://www.bz-berlin.de/leute/geiger-daniel-ho...Ten years ago - in 2010 - I had been selected at the age of  28 years as the youngest Western professor of violin in the history of South Korea for the former branch of Music University Franz Liszt Weimar - the German School of Music - at Kangnam University, and stayed for 7 years. I regard this as an enormous gift to my life, having spent such a long time in this energetic country in East Asia - "A nation of winners" (The Strad London) and having studied the Korean language, too. During these 7 years I have been through phases of heavy jet lag, and I realized that my energy level became weaker - also influenced by many stimuli from a mega city such as Seoul. I realized to be a more sensitive person than one would expect, and started to compose more than ever in my new home and exile at the same time. Additionally I started to focus and withdrew from all outer influences and voluntarily became an frequent guest - next to concert stage - in the recording studio - with only one goal: getting out the best from music and each specific atmosphere, alone or with others: forever. During this years also MERS hit South Korea, and additional silence was imposed for a couple of weeks.  All in all I fell in love with South Korea and especially its traditional fascinating music - GUGAK. I´d like to share this fantastic cosmos of sounds and interesting Korean instruments with the audiences in Europe.This was the beginning of a long story around NIKOLAI MEDTNER and UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.   "American Record Guide benchmarks Viktoria´s third recording among the top 3: “Like many composers who also make music as interpreters, she has a deeper insight into music than others. Even Ysaÿe's own contrasting reverie, impulsiveness and explosiveness can be heard in her interpretation." (about "Les Furies", Hänssler Classic)I would like to introduce you to my fourth CD recording: the debut recording of UKOREVV Universal Organic Korean Ensemble  - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V.: It includes fantastic romantic music by Russian composer Nikolai Medtner (1880-1951) as well as my own composition "Golden Sponge". This project is an homage to Medtner´s birthday on January 5th and also in 2021 to his 70th year of death. Rachmaninow said Medtner was the greatest composer of their time. I am also very happy to launch my international EurAsian ensemble UKOREVV e.V., a non-profit organization which has its main profile in the fusion of Western and East Asian music - next to excellent evergreens of the the standard repertory. This CD was recorded to be reference No 1 worldwide on the Ex-Midori/ David Guarneri del Gesù violin thanks to Florian Leonhard Fine Violins London - a super violin, fitting to my hands and character. Might I tell a little anecdote around this violin: Practicing on this instrument on the second floor - my mom furiously entered the room and asked me what I had done - my response was: "just practicing" - On the first floor in the house a painting had fallen from the wall  - because of this little magic powerful instrument and its long G string vibes... ;-) Thanks to UKOREVV e. V. we can contribute with this musical jewel to the musical scene - despite Corona.  For the finish line of this project - delivering Medtner's unique and rarely performed music to a wider audience - we kindly ask for your help! .Discover more about the story behind this project & enjoy !! "A violinist with a questing mind - beautiful her compositions" (The Strad London) Recordings of Medtner´s sonatas at Beethoven Hall Hannover with Oleg Poliansky (piano), page turner Teresa Skade (former Odipo) & Viktoria Once upon a time,In 2005, I was in Paris studying at the Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique et de Danse staying at my dear cinematographic host family during my Erasmus semester, Marc & Olivier Sandberg and Dina Sofer, a painter and psychologist. One evening they showed an old record to me with songs by Nikolaj Medtner - a name I had never heard before - , I was a youngster. I fell immediately in love with this beautiful, intense and intellectual music. So I started to study the first sonata. Step by step I had learned and performed all of his sonatas and smaller pieces for violin and piano putting my bloody heart into it. As a curious person I always wanted to know more about Medtner´s personal background next to analysis of the music to answer why it took me in such a trance. And to say a little pre-answer: It is indirectly connected to spirituality and "musical yoga".Nikolai Karlovitch Medtner was born in 1880 into a Russian family of German descent, the mother was a singer, the father had worked his way up to the director of a Moscow textile factory and enabled his children to receive an upper-class, profound humanistic education. The youngest son soon became one of the best piano students at the Moscow Conservatory. At the same time he studied composition privately with Sergei Taneyev. A deep friendship connected him with his fellow student Sergei Rachmaninoff bet that character was characterized by his radical openness to musical questions, which made life difficult for him. On some musical trips, musically, he despised his contemporaries those who, from his point of view, violated the sacred rules of music theory and who tried to enforce their musical language successfully and individually, among others C. Debussy, R. Strauss and I. Strawinsky. He published his musical views in the book "The Muse and The Mode". To him, Bach and Beethoven were considered the absolute masters of the form. "No other composer has mastered the sonata form with such perfection as Medtner", notes Alexander Goldenweiser. In insider circles Medtner is regarded as romantic Russian Bach. With his oldest brother Emil, a philosopher, lawyer and closest friend of his youngest brother they experienced a complicated relationship with violinist and singer Anna Markgraf who was first engaged to Nicolai but then married Emil. After two years this marriage was divorced, Anna married Nikolai idolising him their whole life. In 1909 - aged 29 years - Medtner became a professor of piano at the Moscow Conservatory. He declined an offer for a professorship in New York as he was afraid of too many travels,  institutional business and the loss of time that arose from teaching. He preferred a life for composing in peace. The Medtners left Russia in 1921 as opponents of the October Revolution and after disappointing attempts to settle in Berlin, Paris and Florenz finally chose London as their final destination.  Nikolai K. Medtner (1880-1951)In 1935 Nikolai Medtner converted from Protestantism to Orthodox Christianity as his new home giving spiritual hold. He dedicated his last piece, a piano quintet: to God. Already at an advanced age and bitter in a certain way about the lack of interest in his work one day a special message reached him by Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar, South India: His Majesty, The last Maharajah of Mysore, himself amateur pianist, was overwhelmed by Medtner´s fairy tales in Berlin lying on the piano of his sister who was studying piano at the University of Arts in Berlin. The young Maharaja was so enthusiastic about Medtner´s music that he swore himself to support Nikolai Medtner as his young patron. From this point of time, in 1946, already older than 60 years  - supported by a noble man half of his age - the composer could fulfil his dream: to record his works and to compose without stress until the end of his life in 1951. As a big MERCI Medtner dedicated his third piano concerto to the Maharaja.  https://interlude.hk/maharaja-music/Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar, Maharaja of Mysore, South India, the young patron of Medtner About Nikolai Medtner´s 2 violin sonatas The violin sonata number 1 Opus 21 in B minor 1910/11 pays homage to the Greek god of wine Dionysus as God's spiritual and physical intoxication. Dionysus was honored in ecstatic chants and dances which is reflected in movements like "canzona - danza and ditirambo" - an alternating song which ionizes stormy rapturous songs of praise between the choir and cantor of the Dionysia. A stormy sequence on the 3rd mouvement leading into a mesmerising melodic "placido" In the so-called Spring Sonata No. 2 Opus 44 in G major 1927, Medtner describes the poem  "Sturzbach im Frühling" ("spring waters") written by Fyodor Tyutchev which also inspired Rachmaninov in one of his famous songs.This theme occurs in the final mouvement. The first mouvement is led by the motif of the muses in a tender magical side theme. The middle set of the set of variations has echoes of orthodox church music, especially in two cadenzas of the violin. The variations exude a distinctive dance-like rhythmic evolution mode and reminiscent of balalaika sounds. "This piece has everyone who got to know it enthusiastically and amazed, of course, nobody writes such pieces anymore nor could they write." (excerpt from a letter from violinist Alexander Medtner to his brother Nikolai, Moscow January 3, 1927) a Golden Sponge - (Aplysina Aerophoba) „Golden Sponge“ – Aplysina aerophoba – „Goldschwamm“ is an underwater music about a mysterious animal without brain and bones – a sponge. Its live span covers 800-10.000 years. It received its inspiration through a report at ARTE-TV where Prof. Peter Proksch, a friend of mine from Düsseldorf University tells about the potential of sponges in the sea, especially the „Golden Sponge“: Its biochemical metabolisms and toxins can be analysed and synthetically produced as medicine as well as varnish in the ship industry as long it is ecologically compatible. The „Golden Sponge“ is often surrounded by sea horses. „Tylodina perversa“, or the „Golden Sponge Snail“, profites from the Golden Sponge through mimesis. The Golden Sponge lives alone or in colonies. Taken from water into the air it immediately shapes to blueblack colour. The piece shows the metamorphosis of this unseen animal to an important supplement for human beings. It is dedicated to Prof. Jürgen Claus - with Nora and their friends Prof. Dr. Lothar & Korinna Prox as well as sheng specialist Wu Wei. Jürgen Claus was a friend of Paik Nam June and made video diving installations underwater. The music is composed for haegum, piri, Chinese saengwhang (mouth organ), violin and specials. It bridges Seoul and Düsseldorf in the 21st century: „Fluxus“ is „Flouxus“ with the magic musical power of the vowel „o“.On a meta level "Golden Sponge" is an apokalyptic piece about the world which was destroyed from the Western civilisations and the need to expand - in an aggressive way. This music is an indirect desperate attempt to live. The sponge is an allrounder - having lived since ten thousands of years - with a minimum of energy. Humans want to detect everything, driven by their curiosity and greed for more. In the end nature will take revenge - and it has already taken place. Now I write - thanks to Corona - from 2020 nature could recover a bit - if we assume that sustainable energies might really heal the damage . We know that the only changeable thing is our own behaviour. And it also is an homage to the violin and acoustic musical instruments  - which don't need a wire - nearly an animistic point of view next to the Eurocentric way of thinking. A Tsunami cools humans down - as a Thunbergesque prophetic musical expression. The Golden Sponge metamorphises to a Golden Star - nature is manipulated by human beings -tender fragile music becomes a funky hip-hop pattern  "A violinist, composer, play director and living orchestra in one person - on the highest level" (Ivry Gitlis) Thanks to wonderful colleagues and people this project could happen! piano                                    Oleg Polianksy                                                 http://www.oleg-poliansky.comhaegeum                              Lee Seungheesaengwhang                        Yoo Hyo-Youngviolin/composition/artistic director                  Viktoria                                                 http://viktoriakaunzner.com/ukorevv_about_en.html                        sound production              Michael Fine & assistant                                                http://www.finesoundproductions.com/                                               Sunghag Jung & assistantsound engineer                   Wolf-Dieter Karwatkysound edit                            Clémence Fabrefilm team/ edit                   Louis Vignat   http://louisvignat.com/film/                                                Alexis Delanoue                                               Jonas Niemann                                               Mr Sung studio rental                        Beethoven Hall, Hannover                                               Yulhouse, Seoulviolin mentoring                  Florian Leonhard Fine Violins London                                                https://www.florianleonhard.comgrande piano  service         Piano Finkenstein http://fluegelfink.depage turners                        Teresa Skade (Odipo), Dr. Stephan Schönlaumusic edit                             Dennis Schwachhofer organisation                         German School of Music (Weimar), Kangnam University                                                            Victory Academy Berlin for musical excellence                                                Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V.Florian Leonhard gives the Ex-Midori/ David Guarneri del Gesù violin (1735) to Viktoria Past concerts with this programme (selection) Seoul                        Kumho Art Hall                                  Sejong Arts Center (opening gala Medtner Society Korea                                   & Haeshin Shin)                                  Mullae Arts Center (world premiere of Golden Sponge, 2017)                                  German School SeoulBerlin                       University of the Arts (invited by Dr. Wendelin Bitzan, with PhD                                  Alexander Karpeyev, piano)                                  Atelier Andreas Kägi, violin maker                                  Pianosalon Christofori                                  Zion´s Church                                  Space Godo - Cultural Department of the Embassy of South KoreaMünchen                 Steinway-HausParis                         Studio La VerrièrePrague                     AtriumKöln                          Pianohaus Schoke                                  Musikschule PianoforteLinz                           University of MusicPilsen                       Conservatory of MusicPotsdam                  Palais LichtenauRegensburg             festival hall, OberpfalzDeggendorf             KapuzinerstadlBad Wörishofen      monasteryViechtach                 Pfarrsaal                                   City HallWalderbach             Baroque hall, monasteryAt several concerts I made a questionnaire about Medtner´s music: Oleg Poliansky is prize winner of many international competitions, first of all of the international Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow` (Russia) in 1998. In addition to that, he won prizes in Tokyo (Japan) in 1986, in Montreal (Canada) in 1988, at `The international Duo Competition in memoriam of Christian Ferras and  Pierre Barbìzet in Marseille (France) in 1997, at the `World Pianno Competition`in Cincinnati (USA) in 1999 as well as at `Citta di Cantu (Italy) in 1998 and 2003. In the course of his career, Mr. Poliansky has made appearance at the largest international concert arenas and given concerts as a soloist with renomated orchestras such as, e.g., The Moscow Soloists, The Moscow Sympony Orchestra, The National Symphony of Ukraine, The Novosibirsk Sympony Orchestra, the Urals Symphony Orchestra Yekaterinburg, Budapest Strings; Neue Philarmonie Westfallen, Sinfonietta Hungarica, Junge Philarmonie Köln, The National Orchestra of Malta, Orchestra Giovanile della Calabria-Italy, The KBS National Radio Orchestra of Korea, Mariinsky Theatre Symphony Orchestra, Pusan Philharmonic Orchestra and Seoul Philharmonic Orchestra with  Myung-Whun Chung .Oleg Poliansky has been living in Köln as well since 1993 and holds the academic position of Associate Professor for Major Piano at Hochschule für Musik Köln since 2007.Hyo-young Kim (left) is a prominent professional SaengHwang performer from Korea, Hyo-young Kim has received the spotlight for the revival of this Korean traditional instrument through her creative musical pieces. She won the Women New’s 2013 Rising Female Artist Award as well as the 2015 KBS Gugak (Korean traditional music) Award in the wind instrument category. She is currently working as a guest professor at the graduate music school of arts in Sookmyung Women’s University.Lee Seunghee (haegum, left on the foto) is one of the most aspiring artists in Korea today. Her ability to interpret a wide range of repertoires—from Korean traditional music to contemporary music from both inside and across Korea’s borders—showcase her characteristic. Next to her ensemble work she has also been a busy soloist, producing such recordings as "Seunghee Lee: Haegeum Jul-pungnyu”(2009), "Lee Seunghee: The Singing Haegeum"(2009), and a series of recordings that she began in 2018 called "The PAAN of Haegeum.” Her continuing pioneering work in this series includes singing and playing to the accompaniment of restored gramophone records. To Lee, "PAAN" [pan] means soil or sweat. She has walked the soil where “real” performances happen, and has sweated together with the people of the land upon which she walked, experiencing the power of life through those moments of connection—her creative motivation. Lee Seunghee has a Ph.D. and a BA from Seoul National University, and an MA from Korea National University of Arts. Currently, she is a professor in the Dept. of Music at Yeongnam University.recording session of Viktoria´s piece "Golden Sponge" at Yulhaus Seoul, with Lee Seunghee and Yoo Hyo Young Viktoria Elisabeth Kaunzner is a worldwide performing violin soloist, chamber musician, professor, producer and composer "with esprit ... wonderful her compositions" (The Strad). In 2019 Violeta Dinescu dedicated her violin concerto "Roman Fleuve" to her and she has premiered several pieces dedicated to her such as by F.E. Spannheimer, J. Liebrecht, D. Agazzi, JY Choi, X. Bouchaud as well as pieces by L. Streich, B. Muntendorf or J. Jamet. Viktoria´s own composition "Jasmine Rice" for violin & orchestra is published by Furore Edition Kassel, along with other works. She has performed e.g. in Berlin and Cologne Philharmonic Halls, Seoul Arts Center, Salle Pleyel, Paris Philharmonic, Teatro de la Scalao Milano, Prinzregententheater and Gasteig Munich a.m. o. From 2010 to 2018 she was the youngest professor in the history of South Korea at the German School of Music Weimar, Kangnam University. Since then she has been teaching at Victory Academy Berlin for musical excellence® and has accepted invitations from renowned faculties in Vienna, the Juilliard School N.Y., and Fundacion Barenboim-Said. In 2021 she is a guest professor at the University of the Arts Zurich,  Yasar University in Izmir and Concervatorio Superiore de Valencia. American Record Guide ranks their third CD with all of Eugène Ysaÿe's solo sonatas and one of their own works among the top 3 worldwide. Fono Fonorum states that their music fits surprisingly well as an extension to the music of Ysaÿe and Paganini. Since 2020 she has been producing her music "New Silk Road" as a functioning chocolate record single. In the same year she was hired as a Paganini virtuoso in the ARD TV crime thriller. Viktoria bridges in the performer-composer tradition a unique musical personality – from east to west – creating mesmerising sounds through a fusion of Western and Eastern instruments. She founded UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V., Berlin, an ensemble with young soloists and chamber musicians who are also composers - searching for Western and East Asian sounds as a synesthetical integral but also performing standard repertory. During the Covid 19 pandemics UKOREVV e.V. organises together with Kasseler Kulturforum e.V. the international competition for violin-flute duos "Corona Encore-Coffee Mask". Legendary violinist and intellectual Ivry Gitlis calls the Stradivari artist  - "a violinist, composer and director at the highest level".  YOU can support this campaign and will receiveperks - like "symphony" or "melody". Besides the new CD you receive other musical presents related to "EurAsian Gold":* You can book online lessons with UKOREVV e. V. in a shared Zoom meeting*  all dear friends of "EurAsian Gold" who will donate more than 200 Euros to this campaign will be mentioned by their name or if wished as anonymous in the CD booklet* generous donators will be dedicated a piece exclusively composed for them* the person donating the highest amount - more or including 10.000 Euros - will additionally receive the dedication of the whole CD clearly noted in the CD booklet* persons donating more than 5.000 Euros will be announced "honoured patron" of Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V. All fundings will support UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V. in order to have budget for new plans in 2021 and later. There are plans for a Korean strings excellence festival in cooperation with Korea Foundation Seoul . We are also in communication with Australia based composer Elena Kats-Chernin for composing an concerto as well as with Malaysian composer Kee Yong Chong. The big challengeIt was a strong wish to show the beauty of Medtner´s music, the music of a forgotten composer, to a wider audience as well as EurAsian fusion. Yielding finest results - even if there were also many hurdles around organisation, travel, coordination etc.- is our only vision.Despite Corona times foundations do not financially support CD recordings or video productions. EurAsian Gold is an exclusively produced album and the results are of superbe quality.2020 a literal "Corona inflation" of streams started - all for free - which brings many musicians to their own ruin. Here you can read an interview with Daniel Hope who had also studied with Z. Bron saying that we need high quality technical support while recording/ video sessions to keep our ears fine tuned during and after the pandemics: https://www.abendblatt.de/podcast/erstklassisch...The whole project - two recording sessions in five days involving at all 14 people - excellent musicians, producers, sound engineers, video artists - was an investment of more than 35.000 Euros under top conditions. One of our producers, Michael Fine, is a Grammy Award winner and a very experienced supervisor having worked as artistic advisor at major orchestras worldwide.  International expert of Medtner´s music, Prof. Dr. Christoph Flamm has written the booklet notes and a recommendation letter.In order to be able to schedule new projects while the Corona pandemics and after it is tremendously important receiving sponsoring from our fans and companies. If you simply cannot contribute to this campaign please share it, make some noise about it - if it comes from your heart. UKOREVV - Universal Korean Organic Ensemble - Viktoria & Virtuosi e.V. Berlin wants to create more exciting concerts with the aspects of a synestheticale integrale - performed by the world's most outstanding young soloists and chamber musicians in their fields.IAWM - International Alliance of Women in Music has just released an article about UKOREVV in its winter edition 2021:   Golden Sponge performances in Seoul & Berlin 3 CDs - all nominated for a Echo Klassik  Benchmarked among the top 3 Ysaye recordings world wide byAmerican Record Guide"Hervorragend musiziert" / "An outstanding interpretation" (Neue Musikzeitung)"Unbeatable" (The Absolute Sound)"A stunning album" (American Record Guide)  ​If you want to donate to non profit organisation UKOREVV-Universal Korean Organic Ensemble e.V., Berlin, please email to me, I will send you the account details and you will receive a donation receipt.  info@viktoriakaunzner.com Many thanks to Lily & Klaus Heiliger, families Dr. Florence & Dr. Alexandre Laurent, Dr. Walter & Ulrike Kaunzner, the Board of UKOREVV with Juliane Rudloff & Robert Grabein and many other people who supported this project in private soirées thanks to their kindness and passion for music.  All dear friends of "EurAsian Gold" who will donate more than 200 Euros will be mentioned in the CD booklet. Thank you for listening and reading! You are cordially invited learning more about the amazing perks on the right side on top of this exclusive campaign. With kind regards, YoursViktoria &Universal Korean Organic Ensemble -Viktoria & Virtuosi e. V.& the Board of Directors

story:
