Overview

Hi, we're Only Echoes Remain, a 4-piece instrumental progressive post-whatever band based in London, UK, and we're trying to raise some money to help us record our second album.

We released our debut album The Exigent in the Summer of 2017 to great reviews, and since then have enjoyed touring around the UK, played festivals such as Portals, Behave and the veritable ArcTanGent, done shows with some amazing bands, and earlier this year released a live EP recorded from our set at ATG. 

Along the way we've never stopped writing, and now we're almost ready to head into the studio and put some new songs down. Unfortunately recording and publishing music is extremely expensive though, and with us being still very DIY and with family lives to keep up, in order to make a record of the quality we'd like (and think you all deserve) we need to ask for your help.

 


Arctangent 2018
Photo Credit: Joe Singh, SnapRockPop

 

What we need

This campaign is to raise money to go towards:

  • Studio time  ~ £2000
  • Engineering & Production in the studio ~ £2000
  • Post-production (mixing and mastering) ~£1500-2000
  • Artwork ~£300
  • Pressing physical media ~£1500-2000
  • Distribution & Publishing ~£200
  • and then beyond the record, also merchandise (shirts, posters, etc), shipping and tour costs

Estimated total: ~£8,000-10,000

So as you can see, it's frightening how quickly this process adds up, and when you don't have the backing of a label behind you it's an enormous investment that many bands never even make back, let alone make money on, and is one of the most common causes of bands breaking up - so that's why we're asking for your help!

 


Tracking guitars for The Exigent in 2016

 

What you get!

First and foremost, you help us to make this record, so you have our thanks and love for supporting us and making our second album a reality.

Beyond this, we're offering a range of perks/rewards which we hope you'll enjoy, from deals on pre-ordering the album, to excellent value bundles, to some more novel and exclusive ideas.

All orders of physical media copies of the album include your name printed on the album as a thank you. 

The t-shirt offered during this campaign will be an Indiegogo exclusive.

We're also running a lottery for a pair of tickets to ArcTanGent 2020! Arran has been involved with ATG since it began, and organisers James, Goc and Simon have very kindly allowed him to offer a pair of tickets to next year's festival as his personal guests. To enter simply select any qualifying perk above £30 and your name will be entered into the lottery. 

Up for grabs are:

  • Early access ahead of release to the digital download new album
  • Access to behind-the-scenes updates and videos over the recording process
  • Physical copies of the album with your name on as thanks, including CD and 180g heavy vinyl
  • Exclusive crowdfund-only backers t-shirt
  • Drum sticks and guitar strings used during the album recording (available as add-ons at checkout)
  •  A pair of tickets to ArcTanGent Festival
  • Skype guitar or bass lessons with Ali or Simon
  • Pre-release private online guided album listening party with Q&A
  • Have us come play at your house/venue!
  • "Only Echoes Ramen" - get yourself to London and come have dinner and drinks with us!
  • Come on tour with us! We'll give you and a +1 AAA/backstage passes to every show we play in support of the new album, giving you access to soundchecks, backstage and generally just getting to hang out with us and be part of the OER tour family
  • Simon's guitar! Yes we're actually offering one of Simon's guitars, which was used recording The Exigent, and has been gigged at almost every show OER have played, as well as several of Simon's previous bands

Please note that taking multiple perks is possible, but you need to back the campaign again each time (once for each perk).

 


Behave Festival 2019
Photo Credit: Craig Taylor-Broad

 

What next?

If you're able to support us with our campaign then we owe you our deepest thanks and appreciation, but if you're unable to lend us your financial support then you can still help us tremendously by spreading the word about this! 

Please share this campaign with friends, family and across social media; the further word spreads, the greater the chance of us successfully raising the funds we need.

Thank you again for your help and support, it truly means the world to us.

 

Follow us here

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/onlyechoesremain

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/onlyechoesremain

Twitter: https://twitter.com/onlyechoesband

Bandcamp (for our previous releases and merch): https://onlyechoesremain.bandcamp.com 

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/5HoAbHszjIjO8vp...


Behave Festival 2019
Photo Credit: Craig Taylor-Broad

story:
About this Campaign:

 

"It's a folk singer's job to comfort disturbed people and to disturb comfortable people." -Woody Guthrie

 

My name is Maya McNeil. I am a folk singer and a songwriter, born in Ohlone territory, known as the Bay Area, Oakland, California. 

For me, folk music is about the experiences of people and their lives, struggles, legacies, and dreams for a better future, a better now. I have long admired and looked to visionaries like Joan Baez and Odetta as revolutionaries for social change, and as preservationists of the age old human tradition of storytelling through song. 

There’s nothing quite like music. It’s ability to narrate so much of our experience here and beyond through infinite styles and across the ages. From instrumentation to lyrical poignancy, from ambient sounds to prayer; it is a connector, a translator of complex realities. A creator of new ways of being, feeling and seeing. 

I believe in folk music's ability to create movements and creative platforms, to be utilized to connect people to each other. To connect us to what is going on in the world, and to make spaces for how people feel. 

With the recording of this album, I look forward to having a tangible offering to create more opportunity for this type of connection, collaboration, and amplification of healing and restorative work for this planet and it’s people. 

 

Waiting For The Light To Change

This album is a collection of 12 songs written over a 15 year period, from my late teens to my early 30’s. The songs for this debut album are written, complete, and ready to fly. Some have gotten very dusty waiting for the confidence in myself and the funds to record, to come together and make this music finally shareable. 

These songs are for those who have loved them over the years, and for those who have yet to hear them. They are for all generations, hurt and healing hearts; for the wanderer, the mystic, the asleep and the awakening, the down and out, the up and rising. They’re for you. They’ve come like dreams, through learning and growing at every bend, every broken bone, and through every opportunity to open just a little bit more, to all that lives and moves and breathes and grieves and is waiting to bloom within us.

 

Album fundraising goal: 

$7,500

 

This budgets for:

  • Recording
  • Editing
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Printing
  • PR
  • Coffee

 

I’ve humbly learned that recording music requires: learning how to record and how to be recorded. 

It’s been like learning a new instrument, or a few. I’ve spent a decent amount of funds and time uncomfortably and exhaustingly recording and re-recording, without immediately great results. There’s been a number of times that I’ve given up and simultaneously ran out of money and scrapped the whole thing for months, years on end.

But in the latest recording process for my highly produced, folk-synth monster of a song 'Main Stream,' I noticed growth in my relationship and ability to record. I was also very driven by the honor of having the opportunity to work with creative revolutionaries of the dance theatre company, The Embodiment Project, on a collaborative dance/music/art video, shot recently at the historically complicated and beloved Bay Area landmark known as the Albany Bulb. 

The song had to show up strong, and I had to follow through, and stay the course. All the work and uncomfortable learning has resulted in a beautiful song that I am really proud of. It is in it’s mastering phase now, and I can’t wait to share my song 'Main Stream' soon. 

With a few engineering madmen and producers, I’ve developed what has become a confident and collaborative work flow. One that I feel ready to dive fully and professionally into for the recording of this album, and am ready to call upon my community and to music lovers, to lend your support. 

 

The Songs

1. Waiting For The Light To Change

2. Cold Wind

3. Get Off The Tracks 

4. Passage Hymn 

5. Let You Go

6. The Well

7. Avalanche

8. Love You More

9. Sacramento River

10. White Whale

11. Yellow Rose

12. Heaven Is Green

 

Give, and you shall receive...

  • Well, a whole lot of gratitude to start with. Side effects may include feeling really warm and smiley, then maybe weepy, while tapping your toes and singing along. 
  • THIS ALBUM!!!!!!! Check out the various formats and packages!
  • NEW MUSIC! Those that contribute any amount to this campaign in the first 10 days will receive a  free download of my single ‘Main Stream,’ soon to be released.
  • Some other really lovely perks include a chance to win a music and massage package, handmade homegrown flower wreaths, and attendance to the Album Listening Tea Party,  catered by professional pastry chef Keelan McNeil! 

 

If you can't contribute monetarily, that's okay! I’m glad you're here. You can still help out by:

  • Sharing this campaign
  • Checking in and seeing how it’s going!
  • Amplifying kindness, doing something creative every day, and taking care of yourself, this place, and each other. 

 

A Note about Paypal:

Indiegogo only accepts credit or debit cards. If you would prefer to donate through PayPal, you may do so by using the email: mayathebee67@yahoo.com or with Venmo at @Maya-McNeil. Please mention "Waiting For The Album To Record ;)" in the note and be sure to include which perk you'd like! Once I receive your contribution, I will donate the amount to the Indiegogo, so that your contribution adds to the running campaign total and helps to put this campaign over the top!

 

Thank you with all of my heart!

With a whole lot of love, 

Maya McNeil

story:
NEW PERKS ADDED!

 

 

 

Make Flesh Roxon great again! - Let's do the impossible, together!

This is Flesh Roxon's funding campaign to help the band's brilliant continuation

What do we need and what do you get?

The overall goal of the funding campaign is to raise 25,000, which would go to the band without any intermediaries. We plan to use all the funds for a European tour launching in February 2020. Also, we will use the funds to make a new album and music video.

Through the financial campaign, we offer a variety of packages, including unique "One of a Kind" packages, from unique to various numbered Flesh Roxon products.

Why do we need your help?

The upcoming tour will allow Flesh Roxon to continue its story. The music business is difficult and requires money. Unfortunately, we don't have a big organization or a major record company in the background, but we have a very dedicated and big fan base. So, dear fans, we need your support more than ever to bring Roxon's message to the rest of Europe, to do more gigs and bring you new music.

Challenges
The campaign also poses challenges for us. Of course, we do not take it for granted that the campaign is filled with a click of your fingers.

We need the 500 most dedicated fans, friends, family members who can and want to fund the campaign for € 50.

How else can I help Flesh Roxon?
 
We hope you share the campaign on your own social media platforms
Also, remember to use Indiegogo's own split URL

Make Flesh Roxon Great Again

Make Flesh Roxon great again! - Tehdään mahdottomasta mahdollista, yhdessä!

Tämä on Flesh Roxonin rahoituskampanja, jolla mahdollistat yhtyeen loistokkaan jatkon

Mitä me tarvitsemme ja mitä sinä saat?

Rahoituskampanjan kokonaistavoitteena on kerätä 25 000 euroa, joka kulkeutuisi ilman välikäsiä bändin käyttöön. Aiomme käyttää tulevat tulot euroopan kiertueeseen joka starttaa helmikuussa 2020. Lisäksi käytämme varoja uuden levyn ja musiikkivideon tekoon.

Tarjoamme rahoituskampanjan kautta erilaisia paketteja, jotka sisältävät uniikkeja "One of a kind" -paketteja, yksityiskeikoista erilaisiin numeroituihin Flesh Roxon tuotteisiin.

Miksi tarvitsemme juuri sinun apuasi?

Tuleva kiertue mahdollistaa Flesh Roxonin tarun jatkon. Musiikkibisnens on vaikea laji ja siihen tarvitaan rahaa. Valitettavasti meillä ei ole taustalla suurta organisaatiota tai suurta levy-yhtiötä, mutta meillä on erittäin omistautunut ja suuri fanikunta. Siispä te rakkaat fanit, kaipaamme enemmän kuin koskaan teidän tukeanne, jotta voimme viedä Roxonin ilosanomaa myös muualle eruooppaan, toteuttaa enemmän keikkoja ja tuoda teille uutta musiikkia.

Haasteet

Kampanja asettaa meille myös haasteita. Emme tietenkään pidä itsestäänselvyytenä, että kampanja täyttyy sormia napsauttamalla. 

Tarvitsemme 500 parasta fania, ystävää, perheenjäsentä, jotka voivat ja haluavat rahoittaa kampanjaa 50€ edestä.

Miten muuten voin auttaa Flesh Roxonia?

 

  • Toivomme että jaatte kampanjaa omissa sosiaalisen median alustoissa
  • Muistakaa myös käyttää Indiegogon omaa jako urlia

story: I am raising funds to complete marketing and promotion of my new single "She Don't Know Love." The single is currently #1 on Independent Digital Radio, it sits at #30 on the R&B Billboard Charts and has reached Top 10 on iTunes. It is played on Radio Stations all over the country and the music video has garnered over 1 million views on YouTube. "She Don't Know Love" is an anthem that celebrates love being found again after trial and difficulty. This single has produced so much joy, love, and hope into the hearts of many. It is my goal to bring the true essence of R&B back to mainstream and continue the spread of this message through this song and video all over the world. Your contribution will go toward radio advertising, social media marketing, and promotional items such as billboards, merchandise, and other promotional items. I am under an extremely tight timeline to keep budding interest in the song and the growth of it towards the top of the charts. I am also an independent artist with my own independent label so I will continue to garner the support of those who want to see true love and true R&B back on the world stage.

story:
Short Summary

As mentioned, I have been invited to headline the Punto Space and Felix Vargas Hispanic Heritage Month Concert Event and I am ever so excited to share this moment with my fans and those who have never heard of me. For those who don't know me, my name is Lee Burgos and I am a singer-songwriter. Having been born in the Dominican Republic and growing up in NYC since the age of 4, I have been influenced by the amazing diversity found within this city which is what led me to pursue my career in music. 5 years ago, I quit my full time Director's job in order to focus on my true passion and it has been rewarding thus far. But it is time to take it to the next level. 

Having been given this opportunity by Punto Space and Felix Vargas, I will be able to truly showcase my art to a multitude of people and share an experience with them like none other. Not only am I looking to put together an amazing show filled with lighting and amazing staging, but I am looking to raise funds for Latinas & Lideres, a nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering and inspiring girls from under-resourced communities in the Dominican Republic, allowing them to obtain the tools for becoming leaders of tomorrow! This past July, L&L hosted their very first summer camp at La Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo with 30 amazing and dynamic young girls from the under-resourced communities of Villa Mella and El Guaricano, through which they offered a series of workshops and provided school and hygiene supplies all with the goal of teaching the girls the necessary skills to become leaders of themselves, their families and their communities.  L&L has already started planning for the next camp which will take place next summer!  Their goal is to return each and every year to continue to offer this much needed support to the young lideres of the Dominican Republic.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $5,000 to achieve my goal. With this, I will be able to not only fund the show but also give a nice contribution to Latinas & Lideres! 
  • Though I would love to reach my full goal of $5,000, I would still be able to use any funds raised towards the event meanwhile keeping my promise to Latinas & Lideres. 

The Impact

  • Aside from contributing to my lifelong dream of being a world renowned artist, you will be contributing to what will be my first ever headlining show of this caliber which will hopefully catch the attention of record execs and influencers alike. 
  • Though this is my first crowdfunding campaign, I am excited to share my material with you all in hopes that you will find it in you to assist me with my dream and this event. 
  • Honestly, I have been lucky enough to secure three weekly residencies in NYC but quite frankly, it is not enough to make ends meet. I hustle hard on a daily basis from working on new material, attending meetings with people who have been kind enough to offer assistance, and preparing new material for my residencies. This would absolutely help me in realizing this dream. 

Risks & Challenges

  • My biggest challenge at the moment is continuing the momentum of those who have helped along the way. I am thankful to my band mates, friends, and family whom have stuck beside me but I would like to be able to pay them back by funding and putting this show together for them to enjoy. 
  • Being able to host this show will allow me to create content to bring to record execs. Without this, I will most likely be shut down by many and will have to continue knocking on doors until someone thinks I am a viable asset to their label. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that times are hard and you may not be able to assist financially but that does not mean you cannot help! Here is what you can do:

  • Follow me on Social Media and share this campaign with your friends, family, and followers!
story_txt:
Short Summary
As mentioned, I have been invited to headline the Punto Space and Felix Vargas Hispanic Heritage Month Concert Event and I am ever so excited to share this moment with my fans and those who have never heard of me. For those who don't know me, my name is Lee Burgos and I am a singer-songwriter. Having been born in the Dominican Republic and growing up in NYC since the age of 4, I have been influenced by the amazing diversity found within this city which is what led me to pursue my career in music. 5 years ago, I quit my full time Director's job in order to focus on my true passion and it has been rewarding thus far. But it is time to take it to the next level. 
Having been given this opportunity by Punto Space and Felix Vargas, I will be able to truly showcase my art to a multitude of people and share an experience with them like none other. Not only am I looking to put together an amazing show filled with lighting and amazing staging, but I am looking to raise funds for Latinas & Lideres, a nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering and inspiring girls from under-resourced communities in the Dominican Republic, allowing them to obtain the tools for becoming leaders of tomorrow! I know that times are hard and you may not be able to assist financially but that does not mean you cannot help! Here is what you can do:
Follow me on Social Media and share this campaign with your friends, family, and followers!

Hey beautiful people

Plewto Smith has just completed production on his next record, and he needs a little help with funding it's mixing and mastering.  Plewto Smith NEEDS to raise two thousand dollars to cover the expenses that'll finish the project and its promotion. For 30 DAYS, Plewto will campaign to complete that goal. Every dollar spent will go to that cause and that cause alone. It would mean the world to Plewto if you'd donate, as he considers it to be OUR record, not just his.  So if you want to be apart of something special with Mr. Smith DONATE NOW.

#PlewtoForthe People

story:
Hi!  My name is Donna Herula and I’m a blues and folk/blues guitar player from Chicago and I’m asking for your support to join my Indiegogo campaign to pre-purchase my new album, Bang at the Door.

This is my 3rd CD and I'm excited because it's really different from the others.  I wrote 11 of the 14 songs on the album.  Songwriting was really important to me on this album and I wanted to write songs that dug deeper into human emotions and express the truth about life and its joys and hardships, frustrations and sorrow, humor and helplessness, and the strength, courage and determination to get to a better place.  

There’s a wide variety of blues styles on the album from Delta Blues, Piedmont Blues, Chicago Blues, ragtime, folk, jazz, gospel, country and even a New Orleans tune.  The songs are contemporary but they tip the hat to the tradition.  

The CD was produced by Jon Shain who was the winner of the 2019 International Blues Challenge in Memphis and was recorded and mixed at Good Luck Studio in Chapel Hill, North Carolina by FJ Ventre who also was the upright bass player on the album.  We have a lot of really great special guests like Anne Harris on fiddle, and Daryl Davis on piano and other performers like Doug Hammer on piano, Bill Newton on harmonica, Dana Thalheimer on drums, and Tony Pons on trumpet. I also wrote a duet that my husband Tony Nardiello and I sang together and he also sang lead on one of the 3 cover songs on the CD. 

The CD includes a 12-page booklet with all of the lyrics from the original songs, liner notes and pictures. 

Your contribution could really help cover the costs of the recording, mixing, CD production and promotion as well as costs to travel from Chicago to North Carolina to record the album last year.

I am offering a number of exciting incentives for those who will be pre-purchasing the CD before the release date.  Incentives like a one-hour 1:1 Q&A to talk about things like songwriting, slide guitar or the making of an independent CD.  You can get a signed lyric sheet to one of my original songs, the new CD (Bang at the Door) - or all 3 of my CDs.  

There's a package that includes online concerts or in-person concerts.  We have a super-fan package as well.

For those of you that are guitar players, you may know that I'm a guitar teacher at the Old Town School of Folk Music in Chicago.  You have your choice of attending 1, 2, 3 or all 4 of the online guitar workshops that I am teaching of my original songs.  There's a guitar workshop on blues fingerstyle, another one on Americana/folk slide, a Chicago Blues slide workshop and finally an acoustic blues instrumental slide workshop.

I'm super excited about this.  I'm super excited about sharing the music and the new songs with you!  I hope you will support my campaign.  If you can't contribute, I'm just asking if you can share this information on social media.

For more information or if you have any questions, feel free to contact me at contact@donnaherula.com or visit donnaherula.com.  Thanks so much for your support!  I really, really appreciate it!  

Donna

XOXO

story:
Holler to the Hill

"I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help. My help cometh from the Lord, which made heaven and earth." ~Psalm 121:1-2

I love My People. I grew up in McDowell County, West Virginia, Twin Branch Holler to be specific. I learned a lot from these Appalachian Mountains and even more from the people in them. My Paw Paw was one of my biggest role models. We went to churches all over “The County” and even went to tent revivals together. He loved to read his Bible and spread the gospel of Jesus. Recently, his lungs gave out because of black lung and we had to bury him. This is for Him and all of My People.  ~Sabrina Shrader

"Authentic" is a word that is used too frequently of artists who trade in roots styles. It's used so often that it has almost lost meaning. Yet I can think of no better word to describe Sabrina Shrader. That and "passionate." You haven't met someone more full of Holy Ghost fire than this daughter of the mountains. I first met Sabrina in 2017. I'd seen her story on multiple news outlets and social media and knew she was a kindred spirit. She spoke truth to power and had been a voice for Appalachians in the streets, at national conferences, and in the halls of government. When she told me she was interested in recording an album of original and traditional music, I knew I had to be part of it. She has a voice that is pure mountain soul but more importantly, she has something to say, something about her faith, her family, her ideas about life in this country, and the hills of southern West Virginia that we both call home. I hope you will support her debut album. ~Wolfman Jack, producer, Holler to the Hill

Why We Need You

It will come as no surprise that mountain soul music isn't necessarily the most attractive to large record labels and commercial music producers. Voices that not only sound different but speak hard truths can even be threatening to those who are happy with the status quo. That's where you come in.

We have set an initial goal of $5000 for the production of this album. That money will be spent professionally recording, mixing, and mastering the music. It will go toward the first CD pressing. It will help offset travel costs for Sabrina to travel to the studio. And because we believe you don't muzzle the ox while it treads out the grain, it will be used to pay the local musicians who are contributing their considerable talents and time to making the album happen.

We're happy to offer perks at various levels of support, everything from signed CDs to t-shirts to album credits! But know that whatever level you are able to give, we thank you for making this happen.

If we do not reach our goal, we will still use 100% of the funds toward production of the album -- it just will take longer and we'll be forced to cut some corners.

Why This Is Important

If you believe as we do that widely-available commercial music only represents a small sliver of the music you want to hear, then this project is for you. If you want to support Appalachian artists and musicians, this project is for you. If you love mountain or gospel music, this project is for you. If you think we need more working-class voices in the arts, this project is for you.

Challenges We Face

This project can't happen without money, and the artists and producers of the album are just regular working people like you with day jobs and families and bills to pay. Your contribution helps us work on the project without going into debt to do so.

But we are using a group of the very finest artists in West Virginia, musicians who have not only played gospel and mountain music, but country, jazz, soul, rock & roll, and even classical. They've performed for audiences big and small on stages locally and across the country. We are confident that the music we are producing will be something you'll want to listen to over and over.

If You Can't Contribute Financially

We know not everyone can give. We've got bills just like you and America in 2020 has been financially challenging for most of us. But if you can't give money, please consider sharing our campaign -- not just once, but throughout the duration. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube and encourage others to do so. And if you know someone with deeper pockets, consider asking them!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! Josefin and Samuel here, the founders and inventors of HARPAD. HARPAD is a guitar add on that will make your musical journey more creative and fun. It is a frame that st up to 6 extra strings which you put on your guitar to transform it for a while. We have a background in Engineering Physics, and we were brought up in musical families. This background gives us the perfect conditions for developing HARPAD from an idea to a physical product. It has taken a while for it to go from a thing in our heads to the stage we are at now. In 2013 we had the idea, but it was only after our second child was born that we started to write the patent and to create the first prototype. How fun to see where we started!! To check that out visit Harpadguitar at Instagram :D

After that we developed our first version of HARPD which we have shown and sold at exhibitions and on our website. We are now ready to spread the word about HARPAD around the world so that more musicians and guitarists can experience the magic!
 

What We Need & What You Get

We now need you to support us in reaching our goal of 300 sold pieces. This will help us reach out in the future and to set a better price than before. We have had to start at a relatively high price for the first batch and we now want to lower the price. That is why we're doing this campaign now and we hope that you will support us in any way!

We have a special price for the first 100 black HARPADs, another price for the next 100 and a third for the last 100. We also have a few examples with a special color, bronze!
If we get more sales, we will still have a great discount. On top of this you can choose your own package with or with a capo.

If we don't reach our goal of 300 pieces, we will do everything we can to deliver the products anyway. For us, it will only mean that we cannot continue in the phase that we are planning to. If we notice that there are some undetected problems, we will give refunds to everyone minus eventual marketing costs. 

The Impact

If you can help us in any way with our campaign, we are more than thankful because it means that more people can experience the joy and creativity of playing guitar with the HARPAD. We have gotten feedback at exhibitions and from customers that people think it is really cool and many of them want to have a HARPAD for electrical guitars as well. We hope to be able to develop this once we know that we have support from you!

Risks & Challenges

This is the first time that we invent something, start a business and do everything that comes with it. This means that there might be a risk for us (Josefin and Samuel) and for you who buy the HARPAD. We think that we have prepared us for this campaign by starting to communicate with a lot of different suppliers and shipment companies. One other risk is that if we don’t succeed we will have a problem keeping our patents and other IP, and that would be so sad for us because we want to continue this journey that we have started.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like HARPAD but maybe don't play or have the money right now, please share our campaign with your friends and others that you think may also like it. This will help us reach out and raise awareness of HARPAD, and it will be much easier for us in the future to reach out and find the right people to help us in our development.

story:
My name is Steve Scholl. I just turned 65 so I figured it was about time to make my move as singer. For the last thirty years I have served  as founding publisher of White Cloud Press, a small book publishing company that has focused on world religions, spirituality, ecology, and yoga titles.

The idea for this book and music project came to me when I first heard Dylan sing “Jokerman,” in 1983. The song begins with these lines:

Standing on the water
Casting your bread
While the eyes of the idol
With the iron head are glowing

Distant ships sailing into the mist
You were born with a snake in both of your fists
While a hurricane was blowing.

Well, those lines caught my attention. And I noted to myself that even though Dylan had frequently drawn on biblical themes from the Old and New Testaments, this lyric was straight out of the gnostic world. Gnosticism was an ancient religious tradition and countermovement to early Christianity, popular between the second and fifth centuries. The Gnostics were notorious for their disdain for hierarchy, and religious controls when it came to the spiritual lives of individuals. They didn’t think you could be saved through a sacrament delivered by a priest, but that your highest self is found within you and you have to go there and find it yourself — and when you find your higher Self what you are finding is gnosis, which means “saving knowledge.”

The Gnostics were not good at organizing themselves because they didn’t believe in organized religion. So they lost the big theological war with the Church, but their ideas permeated throughout culture. Some contemporary Gnostics are people like Carl Jung, Kathleen Raine, Rainer Maria Rilke, Martin Heidegger, Herman Hesse and Bob Dylan’s good friend Allen Ginsberg.

So now, twenty-five years after hearing “Jokerman,” I am picking up the threads and exploring gnostic themes and motifs in 13 Dylan songs in the book and then performing the songs with my band The Ghosts of Electricity.

How You Can Help

No way to get around it: I need your help. I don’t have a record label and I need to take this to the people to cover the costs of creation. Your contribution today will allow me to bring Ring Them Bells — book and album — to life. It will help me record, mix, master, and share the music of The Ghosts of Electricity, and then copy edit, design, and print the book.

With your help, I can:

  • Finish recording the songs we want on the album (see list of songs below)
  • Create transcendent and resplendent new merchandise for you including t-shirts and posters
  • Record a stellar new music video
  • Help me pay for my creative team including: musicians, producer, a publicist, videographer, and photographer.

What You’ll Get

  • With a financial contribution of at least $15, you’ll be the first to hear this new album. Once the recording process is complete, you’ll receive the digital download before the end of 2019.
  • With a financial contribution of at least $20, you’ll be the first to receive the CDs we will be producing.
  • With any contribution of above $40, you’ll receive the book and CD together
  • There are a lot of other fun perks as well including serving as a producer, hosting house concerts, and access to videos of behind the scenes footage from the filming of our second music video for the song “Shelter from the Storm.”

If you can't contribute financially:

Your support is still greatly appreciated. Sharing the news about this campaign in anyway you can is necessary for it to succeed. Whether or not you're able to give, you can help me by:

  • Sharing this campaign on social media
  • Emailing or reaching out to your friends and family on Facebook
  • Spreading the word via word-of-mouth

 

Thanks for caring and sharing.

Forever young,

Steve

www.ghostsofelectricity.com

My name is Steve Scholl. I just turned 65 so I figured it was about time to make my move as singer. For the last thirty years I have served  as founding publisher of White Cloud Press, a small book publishing company that has focused on world religions, spirituality, ecology, and yoga titles.The idea for this book and music project came to me when I first heard Dylan sing “Jokerman,” in 1983. The song begins with these lines:Standing on the waterCasting your breadWhile the eyes of the idolWith the iron head are glowingDistant ships sailing into the mistYou were born with a snake in both of your fistsWhile a hurricane was blowing.Well, those lines caught my attention. And I noted to myself that even though Dylan had frequently drawn on biblical themes from the Old and New Testaments, this lyric was straight out of the gnostic world. Gnosticism was an ancient religious tradition and countermovement to early Christianity, popular between the second and fifth centuries. The Gnostics were notorious for their disdain for hierarchy, and religious controls when it came to the spiritual lives of individuals. They didn’t think you could be saved through a sacrament delivered by a priest, but that your highest self is found within you and you have to go there and find it yourself — and when you find your higher Self what you are finding is gnosis, which means “saving knowledge.”The Gnostics were not good at organizing themselves because they didn’t believe in organized religion. So they lost the big theological war with the Church, but their ideas permeated throughout culture. Some contemporary Gnostics are people like Carl Jung, Kathleen Raine, Rainer Maria Rilke, Martin Heidegger, Herman Hesse and Bob Dylan’s good friend Allen Ginsberg.So now, twenty-five years after hearing “Jokerman,” I am picking up the threads and exploring gnostic themes and motifs in 13 Dylan songs in the book and then performing the songs with my band The Ghosts of Electricity.How You Can HelpNo way to get around it: I need your help. I don’t have a record label and I need to take this to the people to cover the costs of creation. Your contribution today will allow me to bring Ring Them Bells — book and album — to life. It will help me record, mix, master, and share the music of The Ghosts of Electricity, and then copy edit, design, and print the book.With your help, I can:
Finish recording the songs we want on the album (see list of songs below)
Create transcendent and resplendent new merchandise for you including t-shirts and posters
Record a stellar new music video
Help me pay for my creative team including: musicians, producer, a publicist, videographer, and photographer.
What You’ll Get
With a financial contribution of at least $15, you’ll be the first to hear this new album. Once the recording process is complete, you’ll receive the digital download before the end of 2019.
With a financial contribution of at least $20, you’ll be the first to receive the CDs we will be producing.
With any contribution of above $40, you’ll receive the book and CD together
There are a lot of other fun perks as well including serving as a producer, hosting house concerts, and access to videos of behind the scenes footage from the filming of our second music video for the song “Shelter from the Storm.”
If you can't contribute financially:Your support is still greatly appreciated. Sharing the news about this campaign in anyway you can is necessary for it to succeed. Whether or not you're able to give, you can help me by:
Sharing this campaign on social media
Emailing or reaching out to your friends and family on Facebook
Spreading the word via word-of-mouth
 Thanks for caring and sharing.Forever young,Stevewww.ghostsofelectricity.com

story:
Since its founding in 2010, Coney Island Reggae On The Boardwalk has become one of the highlights of summer in New York City and one of the premier vinyl reggae sound-system events in the world. This FREE community event is inclusive, welcomes to all who attend, and celebrates Jamaica's gift to the world: reggae music. There is no admission charge to Coney Island Reggae on the Boardwalk - it's a free event - so expenses have to be covered by donations and sponsorships.

This season, the series has expanded to include two events in the Bronx, six in total with four at Coney Island, but without the sponsorship that has helped cover expenses in the past.

There is nothing quite like Coney Island Reggae On The Boardwalk, and it wouldn't be possible without the generosity of individuals.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding goes toward the soundsystem, gas, transportation, parking, basic supplies, and permits.

There is no support from the Brooklyn Arts Council in 2019 and additional events were scheduled prior to notification.

Contributors receive T-shirts, CDs or vinyl records from VP/Greensleeves Records - the more you give, the more you get.

The Impact

This is the 10th season of this successful event and it's done with community support and donated services from the participants. It's a community event through and through.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign and social media promotion, and come out and enjoy the event.

story:
Who We Are

We are Dreaming Madmen, a Progressive Rock duo based in Lebanon and Austin, Texas, formed by two brothers, Mathew & Christopher. We've been playing music together for 15 years and have both toured in the Middle East and the US as part of countless projects, such as Brick Floyd (our family Pink Floyd tribute band), The Aaron Clift Experiment, Texas Pink Floyd, and more.

In the summer of 2019, we finally decided to begin recording our debut studio album, Ashes of a Diary, an album that had been in the works since 2016. Since our successful release concert in Beirut, we have started selling physical CDs in the US, Poland, Netherlands, Germany, the UK, Sweden, France, and of course, Lebanon, as well as hit over 50 thousand streams on digital platforms.

We're proud of the success this album launch has been to both of our careers, and our love for performing and writing music doesn't stop here. We want to create our sophomore album and organize a release tour to support 'Ashes of a Diary' and the upcoming album in the US and Europe.

Photo by Jamil Dally

 

What We Need & What You Get

As independent artists, we fund our projects completely on our own. And as you might know, studio hours and recording time can be incredibly and significantly costly. With your help, we can bring this project to life and share it with you all. Our funding goal is $10,000, which will cover studio sessions, CD and merch manufacturing, as well as the many rewards mentioned in our cool perks!

By contributing to our campaign, you'll get some exclusive limited rewards, including:

  • Signed CD of the upcoming album weeks before the official release
  • Signed hand-written lyrics, posters, t-shirts, and more
  • The opportunity to play on a track of our new record
  • The opportunity for us to perform on YOUR music project

In addition to recording a new album, we are planning to hit the road in Texas and tour in Summer 2020, as well as organizing European shows at later dates. However, the cost & logistics of planning these two tours can be quite high. We have been receiving constant requests to perform in countries such as Germany, the Netherlands, the UK, and Poland, and we want to make that dream come true, for our new and dedicated European fans!

Mathew Aboujaoude (guitars, keys, vocals). Photo by Layan Srour

 

The Impact

Music has been our lives ever since the ages of 7 & 9, and we don't plan on stopping anytime soon! We always want to take things to the next level, and our upcoming concept album will be even more ambitious in its scope, just as Ashes of a Diary was a concept album; a musical and lyrical journey that we really feel connects on a personal level to both us and our listeners. Our live performances are an audiovisual experience, complete with a psychedelic laser and light show! We always strive to put on a theatrical performance to complement our vast cinematic and orchestral sound, to give our fans an unforgettable concert experience!

We've also been fortunate enough to have worked and been supported by our top-tier team. Some of these members include acclaimed studio drummer Ian Geyer (Jelliflow), Andy VanDette (mastering engineer for Porcupine Tree, Deep Purple, Rush), Russell Tanner (chief engineer of Antimatter Studios).

Christopher Aboujaoude (bass, keys, vocals). Photo by Layan Srour

 

Risks & Challenges

Making records of such magnitude is always a big and challenging step; but we enjoy the rush, excitement, and difficulties that are all part of creating a great record.

We took on our first challenge with Ashes of a Diary by recording a debut album with over 90 tracks on each song, successfully. We plan to raise the bar even higher with this new upcoming album and create a longer and even more majestic record (also including some real orchestra players on some tracks)!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Not everyone can contribute, but donations aren't the only way you can help. Please share this IndieGoGo campaign on your social media accounts, and with your family, friends, and fellow music fans.

If you've made it to the bottom of this page, thank you so much for supporting independent musicians like ourselves. It means the world to us.

 

Until we meet again,

Mathew & Christopher

story:
Hi Everyone!

I'm Caroline, and thank you for visiting this page! I'm a recent grad of Marymount Manhattan College where I studied musical theatre and started producing shows for my friends and collaborators. Recently I've rediscovered a passion for writing my own music, and spurred on by the lovely artists that participate in my concert series, Siren Songs, I've decided to record it! 

I'm currently making a 5 song EP of some of my favorite originals, and I think they've got the potential to be some of your favorites too. With the help of my incredible producer, Corey Kline, we're turning the songs written on my guitar in my bedroom into certified pop bops. 

This EP will be a product I use not only to share my work with my friends and family, but also to send to industry pros, so I want it to be the best it can be- and with your help it will! 

What I Need

Ok, sharks, I'm looking for $5,000 from you to get this EP recorded, mixed, and mastered. In return you'll get to stream it on all of your favorite platforms for FREE for the rest of time. Think of any contribution you make as an homage to the ancient tradition of buying a cassette or CD. 

The Impact

For about a year I've been producing a charity concert series called Siren Songs. The profits from that go to a wonderful organization called End the Backlog which you can read about here. I want to grow this show into something really big, and putting out my own music will increase my credibility with other artists as well as venues. Not only will this help me, but survivors of sexual assault all over the country. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've gotten this far, THANK YOU AGAIN! You've already helped by investing your time in my story. If you can't contribute financially, but still want to help, you totally can! Make some noise on social media about this campaign, and maybe your random rich uncle will see and want to donate! Either way, I appreciate you :)

story:
Cambiar a Español

My name is Rebeca Vallejo and I’m a vocalist and composer from Madrid (Spain) with more than 15 years as a professional performer. Over two years ago I became the curator, host and producer of the music series and festival ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’. I’ve always believed that pushing boundaries is the essence of creative evolution (or any kind of evolution, for that matter) and through this music series we have come to create a scene where the lines between jazz, flamenco and world music meet and are blurred, pushing creative collaborations into new forms of musical expression.

After two years of great success, the project's magnitude became too large to be maintained (financially and logistically) just by myself, so this project has been forced to reduce its number of concerts and if funding is not met, we will be forced to close our doors in June :( … So we need your support!

About The Flame

At the beginning of 2014, from the seed planted by Flamenco-Jazz pianist Ariadna Castellanos bloomed the idea of ‘The Flame’. With the sponsorship of Spain Culture NY (Consulate General of Spain in New York) and Cornelia St Café, I consolidated the concert series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’. The concert series started out modestly, as a way to give a voice to musicians living in NY who mix Jazz with the sounds of flamenco.

More facts about 'The Flame' in this video :) 


The popularity of the series lead to adding a three-day festival to the monthly concert series and hence ‘The Flame Festival’ was created, becoming the very first festival in the US to solely focus on the fusion of the Jazz and Flamenco genres.

THE FLAME allows local audiences to discover and enjoy this fusion genre while building cultural bridges: through the series we have had local artists (Diego Barber, Alexis Cuadrado, Albert Alabedra…), out-of-town performers (Juanito Pascual, Nacho Arimany) AND musicians directly from Spain (Juan Antonio SImarro). The three dates we have programed so far this year include Alberto Carrion, a guitarist from Spain on his US tour and one of the main voices of Flamenco Jazz, drummer Marc Miralta who will be joining forces with NY resident but Barcelona born Albert Marqués.

The reputation of the series has reached across the ocean and I get requests from many international artists who want to want to be part of this project so , I feel like we are on the right track and we would like to continue our mission of bringing cultures together so, your contribution is CRUCIAL :)

NYC and Flamenco have had a love affair dating back a couple of centuries and there are plenty of spaces in the NYC area where one can enjoy the most traditional forms of the genre but there are no places in NY (or in the country) that showcase “what pushes beyond flamenco” and so, we feel we are on a mission to consolidate the lasting quality of this scene and to also be able to bring in the “big names of the genre”.

The followers of our series range from Spanish expats and Flamenco aficionados, to Jazz fans in search for new fusion sounds. So far, all ‘The Flame’ concerts have consistently filled the venue to its full capacity (about 65 people) and more than 1500 people, so far have been exposed to its unique musical concept.

The Flame's goals

  1. To continue the expansion of the language of jazz as a universal musical language where other musical cultures are represented.

  2. To empower and inspire future artists on how to use their cultural heritage as a tool to create musical heritage and cultural bridges.

  3. To help integrate the ever growing Spaniard artistic immigrant community with the rest of artistic communities in NY.

  4. To expose NYC  audiences to this ever growing, innovative musical concept

Why Do I need your help?

During the last two years I have single-handedly taken care of the additional finances necessary to make a monthly series/yearly festival possible (admin and  promotional  costs, mainly) Because I strongly believe that artists deserve to be paid fairly for their performances I always guarantee a fee that is mostly met through ticket sales but, in the instances where that fee is not met, I have been paying this money out of my pocket.

In order to maintain the level of quality and dedication to the curation of this series, this year we have been obliged to eliminate our November 3-day festival.

We want to keep the series in an intimate setting to provide the best experience. We also want to keep the series affordable to all audiences and at the same time ensure our artists are fairly paid. therefore, WITH THE FUNDS WE ARE REQUESTING WE WILL BE ABLE TO  COVER THE COST OF THE SERIES FOR ONE YEAR.

  1. Secure the performer’s fees.

  2. Pay the cost of all promotional materials: Graphic designer/Web designer, flier/poster printing and distributing

  3. Cover the costs of admin and promo/press personeel.

  4. Be able to help out of town artist with accommodation and travel expenses

  5. Take care of production costs: Documenting the events (photo and video), ushers, social media.

Stretch Goal

Any EXTRA FUNDS beyond the amount requested will help us BRING BACK our November three-day festival as well!!!

From the bottom of my heart, I thank you so much in advance for your support and for believing in THIS PROJECT. Let’s keep ‘The Flame’ alive :)

This project is also your project:) and I’d like to thank you for all your support by giving you some perks :) No amount is too small - although, the larger the contribution, of course, the better ;)

THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF OUR MISSION!!!


Mi nombre es Rebeca Vallejo y soy una vocalista y compositora de Madrid (España) con más de 15 años de experiencia en el campo musical. Hace dos años me convertí en la creadora, anfitriona y productora de la serie musical y festival ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’.  Siempre he pensado que ir más allá de los límites es la esencia de la evolución creativa (o de cualquier tipo de evolución) y a través de esta serie musical hemos creado una escena donde las líneas del jazz, el flamenco y las músicas del mundo se encuentran y se mezclan, transformando las colaboraciones creativas en nuevas formas de expresión musical.

Después de dos años de gran éxito, la magnitud del proyecto se convirtió en algo demasiado grande para poder mantenerlo yo sola (financiera y logísticamente) por lo que nos hemos visto obligados a reducir el número de conciertos del proyecto; si los fondos no se consiguen, nos veremos obligados a cerrar nuestras puertas en junio :(... ¡Así que necesitamos vuestro apoyo!

Sobre The Flame (La LLama)

A principios del 2014, de la semilla que plantó la pianista de flamenco-jazz Ariadna Castellanos, floreció la idea de ‘La Llama’. Con el patrocinio de Spain Culture NY (Consulado General de España en Nueva York) y Cornelia St Café, consolidé la serie de conciertos ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz'. La serie de conciertos comenzó modestamente como una manera de dar voz a los músicos que viven en Nueva York y que mezclan el jazz con los sonidos del flamenco.
Más datos sobre 'The Flame' en este video :)

La popularidad de la serie llevó a la creación de un festival de tres días (aparte de los conciertos mensuales.), y así nació "El Festival de La llama", que se convirtió en el primer festival de los Estados Unidos centrado exclusivamente en la fusión de los géneros del jazz y el flamenco.
‘La Llama’ permite al público de la zona descubrir y disfrutar de esta fusión musical mientras tiende puentes culturales: con la serie hemos traído artistas locales (Diego Barber, Alexis Cuadrado, Albert Alabedra ...), músicos de fuera de la ciudad  (Juanito Pascual, Nacho Arimany) y otros directamente de España (Juan Antonio Simarro). Las tres fechas que hemos programado hasta ahora para este año traerán a Alberto Carrión, guitarrista de España y una de las principales voces de Flamenco Jazz, que estará en gira por Estados Unidos, y el batería Marc Miralta, que tocará junto a Albert Marqués, residente de Nueva York pero nacido en Barcelona.
La reputación de la serie ha traspasado fronteras y he recibido varias solicitudes de artistas internacionales que quieren ser parte de este proyecto, por eso siento que estamos en el buen camino y nos gustaría continuar con nuestra misión de poder hermanar culturas. Vuestra contribución es CRUCIAL para lograrlo. :)

La ciudad de Nueva York y el flamenco viven una historia de amor que empezó hace un par de siglos, y hay un montón de lugares en La Gran Manzana donde se puede disfrutar de las formas más tradicionales del género, pero no existen sitios en Nueva York (o en el país) que muestren "lo que va más allá del flamenco". Por eso, sentimos que tenemos la misión de mantener la calidad de esta escena musical y poder traer a los "grandes músicos del género".
Entre los seguidores de nuestra serie hay, desde españoles y aficionados al flamenco, hasta fans del jazz en busca de una nueva fusión de sonidos. Hasta el momento, en el lugar donde se realizan todos los conciertos de ‘La Llama’ hemos tenido aforo completo (alrededor de 65 personas) y, hasta ahora, más de 1500 personas han disfrutado de este concepto musical único.

Metas de The Flame

1.  Continuar con la expansión del lenguaje del jazz como un lenguaje musical universal donde tengan cabida y representación otras culturas musicales. 

2. Impulsar e inspirar a futuros artistas a usar su patrimonio cultural como herramienta para crear patrimonio musical y tender puentes culturales.

3. Ayudar a integrar a la creciente comunidad artística inmigrante española con el resto de grupos artísticos de Nueva York.

4. Hacer partícipe al público de NYC de este creciente e innovador concepto musical.

¿Por qué necesito vuestra ayuda?

Durante los últimos dos años he cargado yo sola con los gastos adicionales necesarios para poder hacer posible la serie mensual y el festival anual (principalmente costos de administración y promoción), porque creo firmemente que los artistas merecen un pago justo, dinero que la mayoría de las veces se consigue con la venta de entradas, pero que cuando no se logra he pagado de mi propio bolsillo.

Para poder mantener el nivel de calidad y dedicación en la producción de la serie, este año hemos tenido que eliminar nuestro festival de 3 días en noviembre.

Queremos mantener la serie en un sitio íntimo para elevar la experiencia, con un precio razonable para todos los públicos y recompensado de manera justa a los artistas por lo que CON LOS FONDOS QUE QUEREMOS RECAUDAR PODREMOS CUBRIR LOS COSTES DE LA SERIE DURANTE UN AÑO

  1. Asegurar el caché de los artistas

  2. Financiar todos los materiales de promoción: diseñador gráfico/diseñador de web, imprenta y distribución de fliers/posters.

  3. Cubrir los costos del personal de administración y de promoción/prensa

  4. Ayudar a los artistas de fuera con gastos de alojamiento y/o viajes

  5. Cubrir los gastos de producción: documentación de eventos (foto y vídeo), ushers, redes sociales 

Metas más allá

¡Los fondos que superen la cantidad solicitada nos ayudarán a recuperar nuestro festival de tres días de noviembre!

Desde el fondo de mi corazón, y de antemano, os agradezco immensamente vuestro apoyo y vuestra fe en este proyecto. ¡Mantengamos ‘La Llama’ viva! :)

Recompensas

Este proyecto es también el vuestro y me gustaría agradeceros todo vuestro apoyo con unas atractivas recompensas :) Ninguna cantidad es demasiado pequeña - aunque, cuanto más grande sea la contribución, por supuesto, mejor que mejor ;)

THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF OUR MISSION!!! ¡¡GRACIAS POR FORMAR PARTE DE NUESTRA MISIÓN!!

The concert series started out modestly, as a way to give a voice to musicians living in NY who mix Jazz with the sounds of flamenco. 
More facts about 'The Flame' in this video :) 
The popularity of the series lead to adding a three-day festival to the monthly concert series and hence ‘The Flame Festival’ was created, becoming the very first festival in the US to solely focus on the fusion of the Jazz and Flamenco genres. 


THE FLAME
allows local audiences to discover and enjoy this fusion genre while building
cultural bridges: through the series we have had local artists (Diego Barber,
Alexis Cuadrado, Albert Alabedra…), out-of-town performers (Juanito Pascual,
Nacho Arimany) AND musicians directly from Spain (Juan Antonio SImarro). The
three dates we have programed so far this year include Alberto Carrion, a
guitarist from Spain on his US tour and one of the main voices of Flamenco Jazz,
drummer Marc Miralta who will be joining forces with NY resident but Barcelona
born Albert Marqués.


The reputation of the series has reached across the ocean and I get requests from many international artists who want to want to be part of this project so , I feel like we are on the right track and we would like to continue our mission of bringing cultures together so, your contribution is CRUCIAL :) 


NYC and Flamenco have had a love affair dating back a couple of centuries and there are plenty of spaces in the NYC area where one can enjoy the most traditional forms of the genre but there are no places in NY (or in the country) that showcase “what pushes beyond flamenco” and so, we feel we are on a mission to consolidate the lasting quality of this scene and to also be able to bring in the “big names of the genre”.
The followers of our series range from Spanish expats and Flamenco aficionados, to Jazz fans in search for new fusion sounds. So far, all ‘The Flame’ concerts have consistently filled the venue to its full capacity (about 65 people) and more than 1500 people, so far have been exposed to its unique musical concept.



The Flame's goals

To continue the expansion of the language of jazz as a universal musical language where other musical cultures are represented.
To empower and inspire future artists on how to use their cultural heritage as a tool to create musical heritage and cultural bridges.
To help integrate the ever growing Spaniard artistic immigrant community with the rest of artistic communities in NY.
To expose NYC  audiences to this ever growing, innovative musical concept



Why Do I need your help?  
During the last two years I have single-handedly taken care of the additional finances necessary to make a monthly series/yearly festival possible (admin and  promotional  costs, mainly) Because I strongly believe that artists deserve to be paid fairly for their performances I always guarantee a fee that is mostly met through ticket sales but, in the instances where that fee is not met, I have been paying this money out of my pocket.
In order to maintain the level of quality and dedication to the curation of this series, this year we have been obliged to eliminate our November 3-day festival. 
We want to keep the series in an intimate setting to provide the best experience. We also want to keep the series affordable to all audiences and at the same time ensure our artists are fairly paid. therefore, WITH THE FUNDS WE ARE REQUESTING WE WILL BE ABLE TO  COVER THE COST OF THE SERIES FOR ONE YEAR.

Secure the performer’s fees.
Pay the cost of all promotional materials: Graphic designer/Web designer, flier/poster printing and distributing
Cover the costs of admin and promo/press personeel.
Be able to help out of town artist with accommodation and travel expenses
Take care of production costs: Documenting the events (photo and video), ushers, social media.


Stretch Goal
Any EXTRA FUNDS beyond the amount requested will help us BRING BACK our November three-day festival as well!!!
From the bottom of my heart, I thank you so much in advance for your support and for believing in THIS PROJECT. Let’s keep ‘The Flame’ alive :)

 

This project is also your project:) and I’d like to thank you for all your support by giving you some perks :) No amount is too small - although, the larger the contribution, of course, the better ;)




THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF OUR MISSION!!!



Mi nombre es Rebeca Vallejo y soy una vocalista y compositora de Madrid (España) con más de 15 años de experiencia en el campo musical. Hace dos años me convertí en la creadora, anfitriona y productora de la serie musical y festival ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’.  Siempre he pensado que ir más allá de los límites es la esencia de la evolución creativa (o de cualquier tipo de evolución) y a través de esta serie musical hemos creado una escena donde las líneas del jazz, el flamenco y las músicas del mundo se encuentran y se mezclan, transformando las colaboraciones creativas en nuevas formas de expresión musical.
Después de dos años de gran éxito, la magnitud del proyecto se convirtió en algo demasiado grande para poder mantenerlo yo sola (financiera y logísticamente) por lo que nos hemos visto obligados a reducir el número de conciertos del proyecto; si los fondos no se consiguen, nos veremos obligados a cerrar nuestras puertas en junio :(... ¡Así que necesitamos vuestro apoyo!
Sobre The Flame (La LLama)
A principios del 2014, de la semilla que plantó la pianista de flamenco-jazz Ariadna Castellanos, floreció la idea de ‘La Llama’. Con el patrocinio de Spain Culture NY (Consulado General de España en Nueva York) y Cornelia St Café, consolidé la serie de conciertos ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz'. La serie de conciertos comenzó modestamente como una manera de dar voz a los músicos que viven en Nueva York y que mezclan el jazz con los sonidos del flamenco.


Más datos sobre 'The Flame' en este video :)


La popularidad de la serie llevó a la creación de un festival de tres días (aparte de los conciertos mensuales.), y así nació "El Festival de La llama", que se convirtió en el primer festival de los Estados Unidos centrado exclusivamente en la fusión de los géneros del jazz y el flamenco.

‘La Llama’ permite al público de la zona descubrir y disfrutar de esta fusión musical mientras tiende puentes culturales: con la serie hemos traído artistas locales (Diego Barber, Alexis Cuadrado, Albert Alabedra ...), músicos de fuera de la ciudad  (Juanito Pascual, Nacho Arimany) y otros directamente de España (Juan Antonio Simarro). Las tres fechas que hemos programado hasta ahora para este año traerán a Alberto Carrión, guitarrista de España y una de las principales voces de Flamenco Jazz, que estará en gira por Estados Unidos, y el batería Marc Miralta, que tocará junto a Albert Marqués, residente de Nueva York pero nacido en Barcelona. 

La reputación de la serie ha traspasado fronteras y he recibido varias solicitudes de artistas internacionales que quieren ser parte de este proyecto, por eso siento que estamos en el buen camino y nos gustaría continuar con nuestra misión de poder hermanar culturas. Vuestra contribución es CRUCIAL para lograrlo. :)


La ciudad de Nueva York y el flamenco viven una historia de amor que empezó hace un par de siglos, y hay un montón de lugares en La Gran Manzana donde se puede disfrutar de las formas más tradicionales del género, pero no existen sitios en Nueva York (o en el país) que muestren "lo que va más allá del flamenco". Por eso, sentimos que tenemos la misión de mantener la calidad de esta escena musical y poder traer a los "grandes músicos del género".

Entre los seguidores de nuestra serie hay, desde españoles y aficionados al flamenco, hasta fans del jazz en busca de una nueva fusión de sonidos. Hasta el momento, en el lugar donde se realizan todos los conciertos de ‘La Llama’ hemos tenido aforo completo (alrededor de 65 personas) y, hasta ahora, más de 1500 personas han disfrutado de este concepto musical único.



Metas de The Flame

1.  Continuar con la expansión del lenguaje del jazz como un lenguaje musical universal donde tengan cabida y representación otras culturas musicales. 


2. Impulsar e inspirar a futuros artistas a usar su patrimonio cultural como herramienta para crear patrimonio musical y tender puentes culturales.
3. Ayudar a integrar a la creciente comunidad artística inmigrante española con el resto de grupos artísticos de Nueva York. 
4. Hacer partícipe al público de NYC de este creciente e innovador concepto musical. 
¿Por qué necesito vuestra ayuda?

Durante los últimos dos años he cargado yo sola con los gastos adicionales necesarios para poder hacer posible la serie mensual y el festival anual (principalmente costos de administración y promoción), porque creo firmemente que los artistas merecen un pago justo, dinero que la mayoría de las veces se consigue con la venta de entradas, pero que cuando no se logra he pagado de mi propio bolsillo.
Para poder mantener el nivel de calidad y dedicación en la producción de la serie, este año hemos tenido que eliminar nuestro festival de 3 días en noviembre.
Queremos mantener la serie en un sitio íntimo para elevar la experiencia, con un precio razonable para todos los públicos y recompensado de manera justa a los artistas por lo que CON LOS FONDOS QUE QUEREMOS RECAUDAR PODREMOS CUBRIR LOS COSTES DE LA SERIE DURANTE UN AÑO


Asegurar el caché de los artistas
Financiar todos los materiales de promoción: diseñador gráfico/diseñador de web, imprenta y distribución de fliers/posters.
Cubrir los costos del personal de administración y de promoción/prensa
Ayudar a los artistas de fuera con gastos de alojamiento y/o viajes
Cubrir los gastos de producción: documentación de eventos (foto y vídeo), ushers, redes sociales 

Metas más allá
¡Los fondos que superen la cantidad solicitada nos ayudarán a recuperar nuestro festival de tres días de noviembre!


Desde el fondo de mi corazón, y de antemano, os agradezco immensamente vuestro apoyo y vuestra fe en este proyecto. ¡Mantengamos ‘La Llama’ viva! :)
RecompensasEste proyecto es también el vuestro y me gustaría agradeceros todo vuestro apoyo con unas atractivas recompensas :) Ninguna cantidad es demasiado pequeña - aunque, cuanto más grande sea la contribución, por supuesto, mejor que mejor ;)
THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF OUR MISSION!!! ¡¡GRACIAS POR FORMAR PARTE DE NUESTRA MISIÓN!!

story:
Hello Music Lovers, we are “Uncle Sid”!

Emerald Green: Vocals Frankie Scars: Guitar

Kirk October: Bass Dale Salive: Drums

Our Story

Uncle Sid is a Hard Rock'n Metal band from Western Canada. We are very passionate about creating good music, touring and playing live! We work very hard on our song writing and we feel honored to play for our fans and we're grateful for the energy we get back from them. Music is a big part of all our lives and with your help we can get the next level of touring Internationally as well as working on helping others in return.

We are here to share with you our passion for music! We are very excited about the completion of our 5th CD, self titled “Uncle Sid”. It is in it's final stages of mixing and mastering as we speak. We are gearing up to tour extensively to promote it's release. After the CD's release in early 2017 we will start with a Western Canadian Tour, followed by a 10 show tour to Japan. It is quite expensive to tour Japan and this is where we need your help. The tour is $15,000, this covers the expenses to Japan, this includes (for the 4 of us) – Flights, Food, Accommodations, Transportation, Band Equipment, Interpreter, Marketing/Promotion for the CD and Tour plus Booking Fees. This tour is so important as we've been told several times this is a very strong market for us. This Tour will build our Japanese Fan base and allow us to tour there in the future. We have been hard at work on what we feel is the most important and well done album of our career up to this point. “Code Blue” is the 1st single from it. Uncle Sid is truly committed to the craft of making music and we also share the same goals concerning touring and musical direction. With your help 2017 will get us to the next level of International touring. We are now at a point where timing is everything and all we need is your help to get us on this very important touring May. With your support, Uncle Sid vows to make and play the best music we can so we can make everyone who helped us be proud of the fact that you where a big part of team that got us there. Please help our campaign by contributing to our cause and you can receive some really awesome gifts.
Thank you so much for your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Uncle Sid is seeking 15k funding to do a 10 show tour to Japan in May 2017.
Any extra funds will go to our next tour to Europe as we are starting to get some very good opportunities from there as well.
For helping our cause we have some pretty awesome gifts we hope you will enjoy!

This is what you help us get when our goal is met:

  • 10 Show Japan Tour
  • Flights
  • Food
  • Transportation
  • Accommodations
  • Our equipment
  • Japanese interpreter
  • Marketing and Promotion of our CD
  • Booking Fees

The Impact

This tour will have a great impact on this Uncle Sid as it will show us another culture and how they react to our music. We've been told Japan will be very good for us if we go there and put on a Rockin show. That's what we intend to do! It will also help us grow our multimedia's such as Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. You will be helping us build our fan base and gain success in this Market.

Risks & Challenges

As I've said this band works very hard on our music and in return all we want is to be able to tour and make a living playing music. This Japanese tour will be the beginning of a long road of making music and touring Internationally. A lot is riding on this particular album and tour. It will determine the longevity of the band for the next several years of our careers. We've booked our own tours in Canada, the market is very small in Canada and there's a lot of miles to cover to play your next show. Japan will give us access to many people with a small amount of traveling with way more people to play for. We feel very strongly that this will be a great Market for us and get us on the road to financial freedom.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand. All we ask is that you please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

It's easy to get the word out, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

Please help us achieve our goal to tour Japan.

Thanks You Everyone!

Peace, Love and Rock'n Roll

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Jeff Ruby and I'm singer-songwriter based in Nashville, Tennessee.  I love to write and perform and will continue to do it as long as I am physically able.  It's been a couple of years since my last album release and I have some new songs I'd like to record and share with you.

This is my first attempt at crowdfunding.  I have no idea or expectation of a future result.  What I can tell you is with your help you will be the lifeblood of this project and help me reach a wider audience.  

 

Cost & Perks

Studio time, engineers, producers, musicians, and video crews all require financial resources.  I've booked studio time at La La Land in Louisville, Kentucky and will co-write and co-produce this album with an old friend, Ben Felker (The Fervor), from Louisville. 

I've put together some perks for those of you who donate to this campaign, which you can view to the right.  Each is a small token of thanks for your support.  

I'm aware that the financial goal of $7,500 may not be met.  I'll be thankful for every cent received.  If the total goal is not reached, some parts of the project may be scaled back like the music video or marketing the new album.  With this being a flexible goal, all money donated will help fund this project whether or not the total  amount.  The first priority is to get the album recorded, mixed, and mastered.  

 

The Impact

Like I stated earlier, music is what keeps me ticking.  With your support, I'll be able to create a new album, a music video, and tour in support of the new album.  After recording costs are covered, creating a music video and marketing campaign will allow me to reach a wider audience.  

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help contribute to this campaign without donating money.  Creating awareness of the campaign by sharing on social media and telling your friends would be a great way to help.

story:
Since opening in 2013, we have hosted over 1,045 events. These events have ranged from Concerts, and Comedy shows to charitable events for groups such as Brothers & Big Sisters, Boys & Girls Clubs, National Cancer Institute, local high school jazz orchestras, and much more.

We have become an important community resource. We recently started the  BBJ Youth Orchestra, which is open to young men and women, ages 11-17, every Monday after school. We provide tutors, feed them a snack and provide a safe environment for them to practice and become better musicians. 

We are striving not to raise our prices so that everyone can enjoy this valuable community resource. However, we do need to make some improvements to the venue. With your help, we can keep moving forward with our community responsibilities and keep the music alive for all to enjoy!
