story:
I know you’ve got questions. I can picture you resting your face on your palm as you look at the screen and wonder, maybe muttering aloud or wondering to yourself in David Attenborough’s voice:

If you know me, you know that I love to write songs. It’s  one of my two talents, the other being hoola-hooping. I wanted to become an absolute professional, so I set myself to the task of writing a song a day. I stuffed my computer so full of Logic sessions that I used up the entire storage on the Terabyte hard drive on my computer. (Yes I know cool kids use external hard drives but let’s face it, I am not cool.)

I picked the very best songs out of this catalog and excitedly went about recording them. My next challenge was to find a producer that was the right fit for me. I knew exactly how I wanted this record to sound and needed to find that creative soul mate who could help me execute that.

This year, with the help of some delightfully blunt comments from loved ones and emotional journaling sessions on airplanes (apologies to the people in the middle seats who were witnesses to my teary-eyed zeal), I decided to go for it  and boldly pursue the perfect collaborator for me.

Many cold emails and awkward phone calls later, I am so happy to share that I have found a producer  who is already well established within the industry and has proven his skills and taste in a variety of albums. Among these albums are some of my very favorites and ones that have been a huge influence to me.

To get this EP out of my head and into your ears, I will need a producer, a mixer, an engineer, musicians, and a masterer. Luckily for you and me, have already found the people that are perfect for these jobs. I need your help in making sure that everyone gets compensated fairly for all the hard work they’ll be doing to make this record a reality. 

 

STUDIO SERVICES $10,000

I was able to get a great deal with my producer who offers this discount package for unsigned artists. This fee includes production, mixing, AND engineering which is incredibly generous at the professional level we will be operating at.

MUSICIAN FEES $2,000

Some funds to appease the totally killing musicians who will be offering their skills to make this thing sound awesome. 

MASTERING $700

Professional post production service to make this thing sound awesome. These guys have way better ears than me and I bow down to them.

PR $4,500

See below question. 3 months of professional PR services @ $1,500 per month.

DISTRIBUTION $1000

Getting this thing out into the world and shipped to your friendly doorstep! 

 

 

An unfortunate reality in today’s music industry is that so many great records just don’t get off the ground. That’s why I have included the cost of a professional PR company in my goals. I am very confident about this EP and want to give it the best shot it can possibly have. A PR company will throw its weight behind the release and have an incredible return on investment in the form of write ups and placements that will get this EP heard and launch my career. 

 

I am so excited to be offering a fun and exciting array of rewards! My sign is Cancer which means I enjoy lavishing people with love and gratitude. Smaller level rewards include physical & digital copies of the EP—an EP which I have written with the intent of creating & spreading more joy!

I will be hosting a house concert and fiesta where we will have a reasonably good time and I will play the songs from the EP plus some others that have never been heard before! I will be baking my chocolate chip cookies. I did a full year of recipe experiments to get them tasting just right. I don’t think you want to miss them, so maybe come just for the cookies.

 

An African or a European swallow?

It’s  one of my two talents, the other being hoola-hooping. I wanted to become an absolute professional, so I set myself to the task of writing a song a day. I stuffed my computer so full of Logic sessions that I used up the entire storage on the Terabyte hard drive on my computer. (Yes I know cool kids use external hard drives but let’s face it, I am not cool.)I picked the very best songs out of this catalog and excitedly went about recording them. My next challenge was to find a producer that was the right fit for me. I knew exactly how I wanted this record to sound and needed to find that creative soul mate who could help me execute that.This year, with the help of some delightfully blunt comments from loved ones and emotional journaling sessions on airplanes (apologies to the people in the middle seats who were witnesses to my teary-eyed zeal), I decided to go for it  and boldly pursue the perfect collaborator for me.Many cold emails and awkward phone calls later, I am so happy to share that I have found a producer  who is already well established within the industry and has proven his skills and taste in a variety of albums. Among these albums are some of my very favorites and ones that have been a huge influence to me.To get this EP out of my head and into your ears, I will need a producer, a mixer, an engineer, musicians, and a masterer. Luckily for you and me, have already found the people that are perfect for these jobs. I need your help in making sure that everyone gets compensated fairly for all the hard work they’ll be doing to make this record a reality.  STUDIO SERVICES $10,000I was able to get a great deal with my producer who offers this discount package for unsigned artists. This fee includes production, mixing, AND engineering which is incredibly generous at the professional level we will be operating at.MUSICIAN FEES $2,000Some funds to appease the totally killing musicians who will be offering their skills to make this thing sound awesome. MASTERING $700Professional post production service to make this thing sound awesome. These guys have way better ears than me and I bow down to them.PR $4,500See below question. 3 months of professional PR services @ $1,500 per month.DISTRIBUTION $1000Getting this thing out into the world and shipped to your friendly doorstep!   An unfortunate reality in today’s music industry is that so many great records just don’t get off the ground. That’s why I have included the cost of a professional PR company in my goals. I am very confident about this EP and want to give it the best shot it can possibly have. A PR company will throw its weight behind the release and have an incredible return on investment in the form of write ups and placements that will get this EP heard and launch my career.  I am so excited to be offering a fun and exciting array of rewards! My sign is Cancer which means I enjoy lavishing people with love and gratitude. Smaller level rewards include physical & digital copies of the EP—an EP which I have written with the intent of creating & spreading more joy!I will be hosting a house concert and fiesta where we will have a reasonably good time and I will play the songs from the EP plus some others that have never been heard before! I will be baking my chocolate chip cookies. I did a full year of recipe experiments to get them tasting just right. I don’t think you want to miss them, so maybe come just for the cookies. An African or a European swallow?

story:
We are MRVAMPIRE, a gleefully apocalyptic rock band from Venice, California. We enjoy long walks on the beach, late night jams with friends, razor blades and explosions. 

Our patron saints are William Burroughs and Danny Devito, and we've been compared to "The Doors with Balls", "The Cramps on Acid" and "The Pixies Meet Billie Holiday".  

As we've watched the apocalypse draw closer to our tropical horizon, we've cooked some really interesting songs about our incoming robot overlords, truck-stop romance, the need for a deep breath, and how we learned to relax and love the bomb.

David Bowie called music the last surviving form of magic, because it brings about something from nothing. Well, we've risked life and limb to pick flowers from the void, and we're excited to show them to you.

The bars, living rooms and record stores of LA have seen us hone the hell out of our craft over the last 3 years. We're ready to make something shiny and new. With your donations, we'll be summoning the old gods in one of the original Los Angeles recording studios : 4th street recordings in Santa Monica. Partners Sejo and Kathleen have worked with some of the greats, and they're going to help us take something amazing and elevate it to utter bananas.

In addition, your contributions will allow us to create amazing artwork to complete the circuit, and, more importantly, help us get on the road to share our new tunes live up and down the west coast, from Tijuana to Vancouver.

We are hoping to raise $10,000. This will break down as follows: 

Recording and Production: $6,080

Mastering: $1,200

Cd's, Original Artwork, T-shirts, Hats, Buttons and Stickers for our Donors, plus mailing expenses:

~ $1,800-$2,100, depending on demand. 

Whatever the remainder, after the percentage to IndieGogo, will go to defray the costs of a Best Western Tour from Tijuana to Vancouver. 

Our backers don't just get the EP. There is also a secret backers-only track that we are recording that they will hear a full 6 months in advance of the public. Also, backers will get special editions of the album and backers-only art work. Top donors will get one of 10 signed, hand-painted concept mock-ups of the EP cover, one of which will be selected by our donors to be the official cover. 

That's not all! We will be releasing weekly content to our backers only, with a back door view of the recording process and our creative process. We will also hold live rehearsals and question-and-answer sessions so our fans old and new can let us know how we're doing, chime in, heckle us mercilessly, and order us around. You're making this happen, so we're kind of your gimps. 

In the unfortunate but possible event that we do not meet our full goal,  we will release a series of singles in place of a full EP, and/or attempt to relegate the most delicate aspects of recording (Drums and Vocals) to the full studio, and use a network of friends' home studios to get the rest recorded. No matter what, we will make sure that our backers get their money's worth.

In case you were wondering, this isn't our first rodeo. We ran a  successful Kickstarter campaign 2 years ago to fund our debut EP "MRVAMPIRE", and within a month of completion there were beautiful t-shirts, hand-painted albums and signed artwork heading all over the country (and a few across the border and ocean!).

Now, we know that we're all hustling out here. We know what it's like to sleep on couches, in cars and on futons. We know not everyone can contribute. And we love you anyway. We will be making sure that anyone who just helps spread the word or bring other people on board gets a digital taste of FANTASTICO too.

story:
Friends…

My last album, “Dare to be Your Self” was an exploration and revelation of what one path to enlightenment might look like.  That it happened to be my path was not entirely coincidental.

Dare to be Your Self turned out to be a community experiment.  It was funded by a crowd of people who believed in themselves enough to, in turn, believe in me and my work.

This got me thinking.  It’s been proposed that, beneath our apparent differences, we are the same… one heart, one soul, one mind.  Individualized expressions of the same Thing.

This new project has me really excited because it directly addresses this notion. That we, at our core, are one.  Almost every song on the album was written at the request of a minister or speaker from New Vision Center for Spiritual Living in Phoenix. 

Often, I am called upon to write a song that supports the topic that the speaker will be addressing.  I am given a short synopsis that describes in very broad strokes what will be discussed.  Then they turn me loose.

But here’s the thing.  Where do ministers and spiritual speakers get their inspiration?  How do they choose what to say and how to say it? 

I think that comes from you, from us, the people they’re talking to.  It is the collective consciousness we create as a community that generates inspiration for them.  Every speaker will tell you that there have been times when they have wound up giving an entirely different talk than the one they had planned. 

We ignite something in them.

We inspire the speaker.

The speaker inspires the song.

The song inspires the congregation.

And the cycle continues.

So maybe you can see how thrilling it is to be such a big part of this creative process. A thought inspires an action, resulting in a tangible thing. 

It is my dearest wish that you step into this amazing project with me:

Revealing

“The Power of Love!”

A CD by  Mark Arnold: for New Vision Center for Spiritual Living

You were so supportive and generous and visionary during the production of Dare to be Your Self.  I invite you to come co-create with me again!

Love Always,

Mark

story:
My Story

Let me tell you a little bit more about me. I’ve been writing songs since I was about 14 years old - almost 10 years - and as soon as I found that outlet, it sounds cheesy, but it changed my world forever. When I moved to Nashville to study music at Belmont University, I quickly realized that writing, creating and performing my songs as a career wasn’t just a pipe dream. I could really do this.

Now, 6 years later, I am ready to release my debut EP, Electric!. It’s an exploration of love, joy, passion, pain, and so much more. I’ve worked with my producer and friend griggs over the past year and a half to craft these songs. Having a constant collaborator has pushed me to be more vulnerable in my writing than I thought I could ever be, helping make these songs some of the most important ones I’ve written.

                                                  ____________________________________
 

If you can contribute to help fund this record, check out the perks listed on the right that you’ll receive as a thank you for your help and donation! And if you’re unable to give, sharing this campaign with your friends and family on social media helps me out a ton too.

Thank you so much for joining me on this journey. Making this record has truly excited me and lit my passion, and I hope it excites you too.

 

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make the best record I possibly can, I'm asking for your help.

So What Can You Get For Donating?

  • Digital Copy of the EP + Email Updates
  • Signed physical copy of the EP
  • daena t-shirt and buttons
  • A custom cassette of unreleased demos, home work tapes and voice memos of songs that didn't make the album (nowhere else on the Internet...yet)!
  • A show in your living room!

 

So Where Will Your $ Go?

  • Song Mixing / Mastering (currently in progress)
  • Promo Photos and Album Art
  • Distribution
  • Printing physical CDs
  • Creating merchandise (t-shirts, buttons, etc)
  • Song Copyrighting
  • Marketing and Promotion (advertising, music video costs, and press/publicist costs)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • When the EP is released, share it on social media!
  • Listen to daena wherever you stream or enjoy music.

story:
Short Summary

Who is NuBlvckCity?

  • NuBlvckCity is a Kansas City-based music collective that combines Soul, Hip-Hop, Jazz, and R&B with live looping, an electric performance, and storytelling. Members include (pictured above), Kartez Marcel (Vox, Keys, Sounds); Mae C (Vox); Sauce (vox), and VP3 (Sax). Their promo tour has included Chicago, IL, Omaha and Lincoln, NE, Austin, TX, Lawrence, KS, Atlanta, GA, Tulsa, OK, and more.
  • This campaign is vital to us and our mission of injecting a new sound and feeling in the music atmosphere.
  • Being a part of this is being a part of the foundation of greatness. We have all individually gained certain success in our careers but now we are on the verge of something much bigger than us. That's why we need you.

What We Need & What You Get

COSTS --->

  • We need $5000, or at least close as possible to it. Here's a breakdown of the tour and recording costs for the EP.
    • Tour: Car rental/van rental (we use Avis and the cost of 15 days worth of rental is somewhere around $1000--we will handle the insurance), car gas (at current gas prices for regular will be around $750), lodging (we will usually stay in the most affordable hotels or air bnb's with 1 or 2 room's. This figure was difficult to calculate but we will budget a nightly stay at $75. We will need overnight lodging for at least 9 of the 11 dates, equaling $675).
    • Recording Costs: Beats (we are doing a deal with one of KC's top producer's to get custom beats for our sound. We will also add our Saxophone and other instruments to the overall production. At this time, the deal is $500 for the EP). Recording (average costs for professional quality recording including mixing in Kansas City is around $40 an hour. We figure we can complete an EP, after rough draft recordings, with 10 hours. The full cost will be at least $400), Mastering (for the EP will be handled by an engineer we have a great relationship and have previously worked with on other projects. For an EP, where ours will contain 3-5 songs, costs will be around $250)
    • Distribution and duplication: Digital distribution (we will distribute through a quick and user friendly distributor like CD BABY that has more services to protect us on the back end of royalty collection. Price will be around $90), CD duplication (as CD's buying is dying, we will start off with about 200. Price will be around $500 for full packaging and duplication with shipping, etc.
    • The remaining $635 will go towards, toll fees, parking fees, any other hidden fees, last minute/extra merch costs, miscellaneous items, on the road food, and most importantly a multi-social media marketing campaign that will promote our tour dates to cities and target areas on our tour route.

PERKS --->

  • For all donations of $10, donors will get a special shout out on all NuBlvckCity (NBC) social media outlet's (including members...unless the donation is anonymous). UNLIMITED.
  • For donations of $25, donors will receive all previous perks PLUS FREE DL links to the most recent NBC member's music and social media follows form all NBC members. UNLIMITED.
  • For donations of $50, donors will receive all previous perks PLUS FREE DL of the complete NBC EP before release. UNLIMITED.
  • For donations of $75, donor's will receive all previous perks PLUS an exclusive NBC t-shirt and a button/sticker pack. LIMITED TO 20.
  • For donations of $100, donor's will receive all previous perks, PLUS a behind the scenes in-studio sessions with NBC for the upcoming EP) -- LIMITED TO 3 persons per available session.
  • For donations of $200, donor's will receive all previous perks, PLUS their name will be listed among the special thanks section of the physical album. LIMITED TO 10.
  • For donations of $500, donor's will receive all previous perks, PLUS VIP access to the release show for NBC at one of Kansas City's premier venues. This also will include dinner with NBC directly after the show. LIMITED TO 3.
  • For donations of $1000, donor's will receive all previous perks, PLUS a live in your living room concert for you and whoever you invite. This includes up to 1 hour of performance from NBC, autographed merchandise, and an exclusive interview with NBC before the show! LIMITED TO 2.

The Impact

  • This campaign is vital to us and our mission of injecting a new sound and feeling in the music atmosphere, on top of increasing the visibility to our social activities (we have all worked with youth and have done special concerts and workshops for students--included in our storytelling via our live shows).
  • Being a part of this is being a part of the foundation of greatness. We have all individually gained certain success in our careers but now we are on the verge of something much bigger than us. That's why we need you.
  • TOUR DETAILS: we will kick the tour off in Kansas City on March 8th then the schedule will be in: Topeka 3/9, St. Louis 3/10, Chicago 3/11, Austin 3/16, Minneapolis 3/22, Omaha 3/23, Omaha 3/24, Tulsa 3/29, Oklahoma City 3/30, Kansas City 4/4, Atlanta 4/5, Lawrence TBA.

Risks & Challenges

  • The only challenges will simply spring from not raising the money we need. At any rate, rather we raise $100, or $10, 000, we will continue with our plans. We have completed a previous tour of 8 dates and we are used to the hurdles that come with being on the road.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share, retweet, and send to people who may be interested. Thank you for your attention and time.

story:
Overview

My name is Eric Simonson, and I am a composer, pianist living in East-Central Illinois, USA.  I am also a professor teaching in the Liberal Arts Division of Danville Area Community College.  Though I started my musical life as a pianist, eventually my passion turned to composing.  I last had the pleasure of studying at the University of California, San Diego, where my teachers included Roger Reynolds and Brian Ferneyhough.  My chamber and electronic music has been performed in recital and at festivals and conferences in North America and Europe.  I was recently commissioned by the Danville Symphony Orchestra to compose a work for Wiimote controller, electronic sounds, and orchestra.  And since then I have written another work for orchestra, the 2 Pictures, which I now keenly desire to be performed and recorded, with your generous support!

Both of these "pictures" take as their starting point quotations of great composers of the past.  But these quotations are not of well-known passages, but of transitional music, perhaps the kind that would be known mainly by those who play and practice the music.  In fact, the first picture could be thought of as the musings over a passage from the "Hammerklavier" sonata of Beethoven, which the piano student is practicing but has taken a break from.  As he/she rests from his/her repetitive labors, the harmonic trace of the music lingers in the ear.  It seems to be transformed into the maple trees they see through a window, those ubiquitous and taken-for-granted mainstays of the Midwest.    

The second picture begins abruptly, in medias res, with an explicit quotation from Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique, the 5th movement.  As in traditional "rondo" forms, there is a central refrain, which continually spins out the quotation material.  Also, as would be expected in a traditional rondo, there are episodes which contrast both musically and emotionally.  Some of these episodes feature a quarter-tone sound world.  Since the refrain is driven to the point of exhaustion, it seemed reasonable for a comical collapse to happen at the very end, complete with vibraslap (the modern-day jawbone).

What We Need & What You Get

The services provided by PARMA Recordings will include the following:

Pre-Production (contracting hall, engineer, and PARMA production team)

Recording Session with contracted orchestra

Audio Post-Production (editing, mixing, mastering)

Design (physical and digital album, webpages, and other promotional materials)

Release Distribution (through Naxos Records)

Marketing (to garner reviews, airplay, sales, etc.)

The total budget for this will be $22,500 USD.  

My goal is to cover the significant cost through this campaign, along with other grant opportunities that have come to my attention.  The time and expense of editing and preparing the score and parts, along with the postage for sending them I will cover myself.  The end product will be the inclusion of this work on a compilation CD to be released by PARMA in late 2019.

To show appreciation for my donors, perks will be provided!

The Impact

This is music that could be programmed by adventurous orchestras alongside the iconic works of a Berlioz or a Beethoven.   It is music that is both inspired and influenced by these past masterworks; but, more than that, it seeks to build a new language out of certain overlooked details.  I believe this is what is special about it.  And, with the help of this grant, it will finally have an audience other than its composer.  As recorded media it will be available for broadcast, CD distribution, and Web sharing all over the world!

Risks and Challenges

As with many projects reliant upon funding, there is the risk that the goal of $15,000 will not be reached by the end of the campaign.  That is why flexible funding as been chosen, so that all money collected will still be applied to the project, even if its realization is delayed to 2020.  No part of the funding raised will be used to support any other project.  

Other Ways to Assist

Please remember that even the smallest of donations help.  If it is not possible for you to assist in a monetary way, please make this endeavor known to others through social media and word of mouth.  Listen to other music by the composer by visiting:

http://ericsimonson.net/

And be sure to check out Indiegogo's Share Tools as well.  If this recording project is something you'd like to support, you'll find ways there to make a valuable contribution.
story_txt:
Overview
My name is Eric Simonson, and I am a composer, pianist living in East-Central Illinois, USA.  I am also a professor teaching in the Liberal Arts Division of Danville Area Community College.  Though I started my musical life as a pianist, eventually my passion turned to composing.  I last had the pleasure of studying at the University of California, San Diego, where my teachers included Roger Reynolds and Brian Ferneyhough.  My chamber and electronic music has been performed in recital and at festivals and conferences in North America and Europe.  I was recently commissioned by the Danville Symphony Orchestra to compose a work for Wiimote controller, electronic sounds, and orchestra.  And since then I have written another work for orchestra, the 2 Pictures, which I now keenly desire to be performed and recorded, with your generous support!
Both of these "pictures" take as their starting point quotations of great composers of the past.  But these quotations are not of well-known passages, but of transitional music, perhaps the kind that would be known mainly by those who play and practice the music.  In fact, the first picture could be thought of as the musings over a passage from the "Hammerklavier" sonata of Beethoven, which the piano student is practicing but has taken a break from.  As he/she rests from his/her repetitive labors, the harmonic trace of the music lingers in the ear.  It seems to be transformed into the maple trees they see through a window, those ubiquitous and taken-for-granted mainstays of the Midwest.    
The second picture begins abruptly, in medias res, with an explicit quotation from Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique, the 5th movement.  As in traditional "rondo" forms, there is a central refrain, which continually spins out the quotation material.  Also, as would be expected in a traditional rondo, there are episodes which contrast both musically and emotionally.  Some of these episodes feature a quarter-tone sound world.  Since the refrain is driven to the point of exhaustion, it seemed reasonable for a comical collapse to happen at the very end, complete with vibraslap (the modern-day jawbone).
What We Need & What You Get

The services provided by PARMA Recordings will include the following:
Pre-Production (contracting hall, engineer, and PARMA production team)
Recording Session with contracted orchestra
Audio Post-Production (editing, mixing, mastering)
Design (physical and digital album, webpages, and other promotional materials)
Release Distribution (through Naxos Records)
Marketing (to garner reviews, airplay, sales, etc.)
The total budget for this will be $22,500 USD.  
My goal is to cover the significant cost through this campaign, along with other grant opportunities that have come to my attention.  The time and expense of editing and preparing the score and parts, along with the postage for sending them I will cover myself.  The end product will be the inclusion of this work on a compilation CD to be released by PARMA in late 2019.
To show appreciation for my donors, perks will be provided!
The Impact

This is music that could be programmed by adventurous orchestras alongside the iconic works of a Berlioz or a Beethoven.   It is music that is both inspired and influenced by these past masterworks; but, more than that, it seeks to build a new language out of certain overlooked details.  I believe this is what is special about it.  And, with the help of this grant, it will finally have an audience other than its composer.  As recorded media it will be available for broadcast, CD distribution, and Web sharing all over the world!
Risks and Challenges
As with many projects reliant upon funding, there is the risk that the goal of $15,000 will not be reached by the end of the campaign.  That is why flexible funding as been chosen, so that all money collected will still be applied to the project, even if its realization is delayed to 2020.  No part of the funding raised will be used to support any other project.  
Other Ways to Assist
Please remember that even the smallest of donations help.  If it is not possible for you to assist in a monetary way, please make this endeavor known to others through social media and word of mouth.  Listen to other music by the composer by visiting:
http://ericsimonson.net/
And be sure to check out Indiegogo's Share Tools as well.  If this recording project is something you'd like to support, you'll find ways there to make a valuable contribution.

story:
We are so excited about our new record!

We are so excited about our new record! And we are so honored that you’re reading this to find out more of the story. We are trying to do the best job possible in this new music economy to give Phil Keaggy fans a chance to celebrate this landmark recording.

The New Music Economy

Initially, we need to pay for mastering, graphics layout, video production, duplication and fulfillment of the media, and all studio and production costs. These require substantial funding, and we’re thinking $25,000 is a reasonable (but expandable!) goal.

Perks and Packages

Scroll through the perks and packages here and see if you’re inspired, just as we are, to share our music, obtain some artifacts of our journey, and perhaps become a partner and patron. 

Some of our unique perks include a Career Photo Book, a Producer Notebook (with prints of the handwritten lyrics, Nashville Number System charts, gear list, etc.), several concert packages and events, a guitar and recording workshop, previously unreleased Keaggy tunes, signed guitars, and a “Phil and Rex Produce Your Record Project” offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

And finally, it would help us immensely by using the Indiegogo posting tools to share on social media with anyone you think may be interested.

story:
Haven’t got much time? I understand! Here is a summary:

 

Who am I: I’m Marina, a singer-songwriter from Russia living in New Zealand. I create pop rock music with a fusion of country and world.

The Goal: I am creating a new album and I need your help to finish it and get it out there!

Where I am at: The album is fully written and currently being arranged and produced with some incredibly talented musicians.

Why: I am an independent musician so rely on the support of my fans to realise this music in a way that everyone can enjoy!

How: For this to happen there are three things that you can do right now:

  1. Pick a reward that appeals ((click on any package to the right to see details).
  2. Contribute (*please note: all prices are in USD).
  3. Help spread the word! Word-of-mouth, send emails, share on social media!

Thank you for your support!! It means the world to me!

I’m a mum, a singer-songwriter, a geek & lover of different cultures! I am from a small town called Sochi, Russia where I studied vocal training at the Sochi College of Arts and now live in Auckland, New Zealand. I love to perform traditional songs with my Russian choir ‘Singing Nations’ and touring with my full band of rockstars!

A career highlight has been reaching the #1 spot on the New Zealand iTunes Dance chart this year and winning a songwriting award in Los Angeles!

These songs have been crafted with the help of lyricist Michael Davis and are being lushly arranged for the album by producer & pianist Karl Benton. It is being recorded, mixed & mastered at the Sound Room with Marshall Smith & Tom Fox and Manuka Studios with Mike MacCarthy (these guys have already done a fantastic job with previous songs ‘Fragile’ and ‘The Tree’!).

The album will be released in April 2019 (but those in the All Access Pass group will get early access to some of it!). Then I will be touring the new release throughout New Zealand so you can see the songs live and I can thank you in person for supporting me!

Songs come to me as this flow of energy, and very so often I have no control how they come together, like a puzzle. I feel blessed to receive these melodies that keep sounding in my mind. My songs speak from the heart about real life experiences: love, loss, heartbreak and the human condition. I’m inspired by classic artists such as Fleetwood Mac, Dire Straits, Roxette and Adele.

(If you want to hear some of the songs before the album is released make sure you pick a Perk with the All Access Pass!)

I am looking to raise $8,870 USD to create the album, pay Indiegogo their fee and make sure you lovely people get your Perks! Professionally recorded albums do not come cheap, but I am trying wherever possible to keep costs down while never compromising on the quality of the sound. My top priority is to ensure these songs are realised to their full potential straight to your wonderful ears!

If you’re interested, here’s how the costs breakdown:



There are some wonderful Perks here, check out the full list to the right!

Possibly the best in my opinion is any Perk that includes the TEA ROSE PACKAGE!

This means you get:

  • An illustrated ‘Marina Bloom’ premium tea-towel!
  • Behind the scenes updates of the album process (All Access Pass!)
  • Studio footage
  • Photos
  • Pre-release listen streaming parties!
  • A signed copy of my album CD,
  • Digital download of the album (so you don’t have to wait for shipping to arrive to listen!)
  • Album credit
  • A personal video message to thank you!

Singing gives me so much joy, but writing music is something I started a few years ago. The emotional roller-coasters we go through in life put us in different spaces and for me it spills into my music. I believe that music can inspire people to be courageous and express their true selves – inspiring the people around them to do the same.

If it’s not possible to contribute financially I would still love it if you could help me in another way...

You can be a Marina Bloom Outreacher!

Help spread the word about this campaign by word-of-mouth, send an email out to your contacts, share on social media… anything you can do to help get this campaign out into your world would be so appreciated!

 

Thank you so incredibly much for reading to the end.

Now all you need to do is choose a perk from the column to the right!

All my love,

story:
Hello Big Band Fans,

 

My name is Frank Vardaros and I am a trumpeter and leader of the Frank Vardaros Jazz Orchestra based out of Los Angeles, California.  I have been in the music industry for many years and have performed with many of the greats including Nick Brignola, Clark Terry, Arturo Sandoval, Jon Faddis, Bill Watrous, Slide Hampton, Maynard Ferguson, Nestor Torres, George Garzone, Jerry Bergonzi, Ed Calle, Bobby Shew, Bob Mintzer, Bob McChesney, the Boston Metropolitan Orchestra, I have toured the world and have performed at such prestigious venues including the Boston Globe Jazz Festival, Newport Jazz Festival, Carnegie Hall, Saratoga Springs Jazz Festival, Boston Phoenix Jazz Festival, Scullers Jazz Club, the Regattabar, Ryles Jazz Club, and the Marbella Spain Jazz Series. Now that I reside in Los Angeles, I have been able to put together a world-class big band of some of the finest musicians.

 

Recording a project of this magnitude with some of the greatest jazz musicians around is quite a costly undertaking.   

We are raising the funds to help:
•Pay the Musicians
•Pay for the Recording Studio, Mixing, Mastering
•Pay the arrangers
•Pay for the Pressing of both the limited edition vinyl as well as the CDs
•Pay for Promotion
•We also would like to bring this music to various, elementary, middle, high school and colleges to help expose these young people to this artform, that more than likely, they will not hear.

We plan to start recording as soon as the fundraising campaign is over and plan to release sometime in September.

Please support in any way that you can, so we can help perpetuate the art of Big Band Jazz.  

We also could use your help spreading the word.  Please share this link to friends, family, coworkers and anyone who likes big band music. Also, please follow us on instagram and facebook.

Thanks so much for your support!

To get these songs I'm passionate about out to the fans it's gonna cost more than I can come up with at this point in my career to hire session musicians for a few days and record in a professional studio and have it mastered professionally.  This campaign will take it all the way to the finished product ready for you the fans to own the album!!!

I'll have some fun perks for contributors that raise certain amounts and can't wait to share this with the world

story:
THE RADIANCE New Album and Audiovisual Experience ELEMENTAL – Recorded in a 600 year old temple, with artists from across the globe.

I am excited to invite you all to take part in a unique experience - an experience that captures a time in Beijing where rare collaborations of this nature are still possible. Recorded in a 600 year old Temple in the heart of Beijing, ELEMENTAL will bring together musicians and artists from China, Europe and the US to create an album and audiovisual experience of quiet passions, fragility, strength, elegance and essence.

I have so much gratitude for the opportunity to share this artistic process with you all, and to see our collaboration come together.  From the bottom of my heart, I THANK YOU for believing in me and turning this dream into a reality.  x - Miranda, THE RADIANCE 

The music

Located inside a historical Qing Dynasty temple courtyard, The Radiance will record their new album ELEMENTAL. In a sacred space that  juxtaposes the old and new Beijing, the five elements with be born into the world and reverberate through music. 

ELEMENTAL is inspired by the traditional Chinese philosophy of the five fundamental elements - Earth, Metal, Water, Wood and Fire - that underpin our world and between which all interactions occur. As each new element is introduced from the remnants of the last,  the music will culminate in a cornerstone piece “Gold Shaded Moon”, in which all elements are present. The essence of the ancient temple space will become an integral part of the recording; a snapshot of one piece of Beijing and the moment it occupies in time.

The team

Featuring both traditional and ethnic minority Chinese instruments, The Radiance will collaborate with an international team including Grammy award-winning producer Jeff Bova (Celine Dion), Ned Douglas (Stevie Nicks, Mick Jagger) and director/VFX artist, Jeff Ranasinghe (Avengers, AntMan Vs Wasp). 

Last year, The Radiance won the AKADEMIA BEST AWARD WINNING SONG 2018 in category best Ambiental/Instrumental Music for their song Flying Kites. Please have a listen to The Radiance's first LP, Soft Machine, on Spotify. 

Beijing’s independent music scene is special, and The Radiance captures this magic through collaboration and music that transcends cultural boundaries - touching all who listen to it on an individual, yet unifying, level.

Audiovisual Installation

The centerpiece of the project is an audiovisual installation for the song “Gold Shaded Moon”; a musical work in three movements that delves into the nature of artistic creation. The added visual component will bring a new dimension to the music and allow the piece to be experienced in a different way. 

The installation will consist of four screens: north, east, west, and a central screen that metaphorically represents "the individual".  A bridge is created between the screens, from self to the collective, internal to external. A shared dream where beauty arises through the power of divergence.

Visually, the ancient and rich details of the temple will be mixed with cutting edge VFX and projection to bring the space to life in new and unexpected ways. Our talented global musicians will be recorded in the temple environment to capture its acoustic details and then mixed with modern synthesis and sampling techniques to create a sonic hybrid. 

The result will be both modern and classical. 

The work is to be exhibited in museums and galleries where it will invite people to live the music through the space; to be immersed in a performance without a performer but with an intimate relation between sound, space and visuals, dream and reality.

How your contribution will help

  • $5,250 USD AV and recording gear rental to capture the music inside the 600 year old temple
  • $5,750 USD AV and video post production
  • $3,000 USD piano and microphone hire
  • $6,000 USD for flights to China, plus visas, for the US-based production team
  • The musicians will be collaborating on this project for LOVE of music. Any additional funds raised will go towards paying them for their precious time. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Beijing can sometimes be a challenging environment for live performances, and for foreign entrepreneurs. There is a small chance of delays in recording due to rescheduling of times if negotiations need to take place.

    The Radiance will mitigate this risk by working closely with the venue management and local Chinese artists to ensure the project runs smoothly and is compliant with local authority.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't spare any money to help fund this project, please share this campaign with your friends and on your social media, and help spread our love and music!

$3,000 USD piano and microphone hire

story:
Short Summary

I am Dianna St. Hilaire a singer that goes by the name Opāru.  Opāru is an electro-pop project from Los Angeles.   The name Opāru is my birthstone Opal in Japanese.  Not to be confused with the Russian version meaning Coldsore.  LOL. 

I have been playing music for over 15 years.  I write on piano and pre-produce my music using programs like Fruity Loops & Logic.   Over the years I have worked with Kim Fowley (Joan Jett, The Runaways, Kiss), Roy Thomas Baker (Queen) and J-Swift (The Pharcyde).   

Opāru was launched in 2016 with the song "Remember Me".  It was well received by the press listed in Huffington Post and Hype Machine.   Songs were on the Billboard Music Charts, and I was on the Grammy Ballot 2 years in a row.  

REMEMBER ME LYRIC VIDEO!
 

The song "Ghost To Follow" was produced by Josh Stevens (LMFAO, Jennifer Lopez, Pit Bull) and was recorded at Studio City Sound.

As an artist I've always appreciated introspective music.  It has helped me through some of the hardest times of my life.  Internal struggles can be overbearing and seem impossible to get through sometimes. 

Music has always been a way out, an escape from the feelings of pain and suffering.  Almost like an auditory hug.  The difference is it won't judge you later or tell your neighbors or friends about what you're going through.  It is personal and deep. 

I know everyone deals with this at some point in their life and for some people like myself, it can be the difference between facing the world and curling up in a ball and dying.  

I wanted to have an opportunity to share this song with the world.    Though it has been released and you can watch the lyric video and listen to the song on Youtube, iTunes, Spotify etc.  I feel it needs a physical presence in the world to give it even more impact.  Something that visually represents the depth of the song.  It tells the story between the internal voice and the external world.  

By contributing, you are not only helping me make a beautiful music video, but you are helping others by allowing them to go deep within themselves and change their own lives.  I believe sometimes it takes that extra visual element to get people to listen.  

THE GHOST TO FOLLOW LYRIC VIDEO

 

What We Need & What You Get

This isn't my first music video rodeo.  I've produced quite a few of them already.

Your funding is going into some amazing stuff.  Normally the cost of doing an underwater music video would start out at around 25k.  I luckily have a talented group of videographers and crew that are willing to work on this project for free.  We also have a great camera to use for the shoot already.  We are going to be using the Red Gemini.  

So what we need is money for other equipment rentals and production costs.

Makeup {200}

Cables, Underwater Lighting, Monitors {1000}

Lenses {500}

Animal Masks {200}

 

I have some really unique perks for this including...  

  • Custom T-Shirts
  • Mix Tapes
  • A free personal copy of the Music Video
  • Animal Mask from the video
  • A day on the set of the video
  • Come the wrap party.
  • My entire music catalog including Versailles songs.  
  • Come have lunch with me.  Ask me anything!

 

Even if I don't make all the funds I need we will still be launching this music video. It may take more time for me to do it but it will happen regardless.  

The Impact

You may not know this already but music is so important.    Here are some of the benefits of listening to it.

  • Improves mood.  Studies show that listening to music can benefit overall well-being, help regulate emotions, and create happiness and relaxation in everyday life.
  • Reduces stress.  Listening to ‘relaxing’ music has been shown to reduce stress and anxiety in healthy people and in people undergoing medical procedures (e.g., surgery, dental, colonoscopy).
  • Lessens anxiety. In studies of people with cancer, listening to music combined with standard care reduced anxiety compared to those who received standard care alone.
  • Improves exercise. Studies suggest that music can enhance aerobic exercise, boost mental and physical stimulation, and increase overall performance.
  • Improves memory. Research has shown that the repetitive elements of rhythm and melody help our brains form patterns that enhance memory. In a study of stroke survivors, listening to music helped them experience more verbal memory, less confusion, and better-focused attention.
  • Eases pain. In studies of patients recovering from surgery, those who listened to music before, during, or after surgery had less pain and more overall satisfaction compared with patients who did not listen to music as part of their care.
  • Provides comfort. Music therapy has also been used to help enhance communication, coping, and expression of feelings such as fear, loneliness, and anger in patients who have a serious illness, and who are in end-of-life care.
  • Improves cognition. Listening to music can also help people with Alzheimer’s recall seemingly lost memories and even help maintain some mental abilities.
  • Helps children with autism spectrum disorder. Studies of children with autism spectrum disorder who received music therapy showed improvement in social responses, communication skills, and attention skills.
  • Soothes premature babies. Live music and lullabies may impact vital signs, improve feeding behaviors and sucking patterns in premature infants, and may increase prolonged periods of quiet–alert states.

In my career,  I have done around 15 music videos.   I am a great producer of music videos and I know I can make this work.    My last video "Remember Me"  has over 45K views on Youtube and 175K on Facebook.   

 

REMEMBER ME MUSIC VIDEO

 

MY CREW

Scott Hilburn (Director)

Alexander Tyson  (Underwater Camera Operator)

Francis Gonzalez (Art Department),

Kate Oja (Makeup Artist),

Marco Patino (Photography)

 

More to come!

 

Risks & Challenges

The only real challenge is that the video will be underwater.  A lot of things can go wrong and it is slightly dangerous.  There is also the challenge that someone may not show up or may not be on board at the last minute.  

If these challenges happen I will still make it work anyway.  We may have to move some stuff around but that's life and this will happen one way or another.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I want to say thanks for being in my tribe and bringing this project to life.  If for some reason you really can't donate anything at this time, all I ask is that you share this with your friends, co-workers and family.  Let them know how important it is.  

Indiegogo makes it easy to share just use the Indiegogo share features.
story_txt:
Short Summary
I am Dianna St. Hilaire a singer that goes by the name Opāru.  Opāru is an electro-pop project from Los Angeles.   The name Opāru is my birthstone Opal in Japanese.  Not to be confused with the Russian version meaning Coldsore.  LOL. 
I have been playing music for over 15 years.  I write on piano and pre-produce my music using programs like Fruity Loops & Logic.   Over the years I have worked with Kim Fowley (Joan Jett, The Runaways, Kiss), Roy Thomas Baker (Queen) and J-Swift (The Pharcyde).   
Opāru was launched in 2016 with the song "Remember Me".  It was well received by the press listed in Huffington Post and Hype Machine.   Songs were on the Billboard Music Charts, and I was on the Grammy Ballot 2 years in a row.  

REMEMBER ME LYRIC VIDEO!
 
The song "Ghost To Follow" was produced by Josh Stevens (LMFAO, Jennifer Lopez, Pit Bull) and was recorded at Studio City Sound.
As an artist I've always appreciated introspective music.  It has helped me through some of the hardest times of my life.  Internal struggles can be overbearing and seem impossible to get through sometimes. 
Music has always been a way out, an escape from the feelings of pain and suffering.  Almost like an auditory hug.  The difference is it won't judge you later or tell your neighbors or friends about what you're going through.  It is personal and deep. 
I know everyone deals with this at some point in their life and for some people like myself, it can be the difference between facing the world and curling up in a ball and dying.  
I wanted to have an opportunity to share this song with the world.    Though it has been released and you can watch the lyric video and listen to the song on Youtube, iTunes, Spotify etc.  I feel it needs a physical presence in the world to give it even more impact.  Something that visually represents the depth of the song.  It tells the story between the internal voice and the external world.  
By contributing, you are not only helping me make a beautiful music video, but you are helping others by allowing them to go deep within themselves and change their own lives.  I believe sometimes it takes that extra visual element to get people to listen.  

THE GHOST TO FOLLOW LYRIC VIDEO

story:
The Project

Everything is ready to go, and I’ve got ten good songs that I’ve written that could be classified in the Americana genre, influenced by traditional country, blues and rock n’ roll. I have the consultation and guidance of veteran Nashville professionals in the areas of production, promotion and management, as well as the opportunity to record with world class session musicians in Nashville’s legendary Hilltop Recording Studio, proven to be one of the area’s best.

BACKGROUND

The story behind this particular recording project actually began many years ago when I was a young guy working in a steel mill in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and went down to Nashville, Tennessee full of enthusiasm, hoping to get a contract with one of the big record companies. However, I was surprised to discover that I couldn’t even get past the door to any of the major labels.

Feeling pretty down, I eventually found a live music venue that was frequented by a lot of the Nashville musicians. That’s where I was fortunate to meet producer Tom Wilkerson, who at the time was a studio session drummer, as well as a touring musician with some of the biggest names in the country music scene. Tom gave me a lot of advice about what was happening there in Nashville, and he brought me to Hilltop Recording Studio, where we agreed to pull together our resources and record some of my songs.

I went back to Pittsburgh, and as young people often do, I was feeling that there was plenty of time to get that record done, so I set off rolling down that windy road playing gigs everywhere from Austin, Texas to Moscow, Russia, and eventually found myself living and performing most of my years in Finland!

Photo: Roosa Kulju

Finland has been good, and my music has brought me to many other wonderful countries to perform, but through the years I’ve always regretted not following up on the opportunities that Tom was offering in Nashville.  So I decided to do something about it, and I contacted him through the internet, asking if it would still be possible to get that record made. I was soon happy to get a positive reply, and he invited me over to Nashville to talk about it.

Well I got over there and we picked up where we left off. We made a plan, and Tom also connected me with some of his professional colleagues in the industry, including influential musician, record promoter Bill Wence, and highly accredited session musician Jerry Kroon. We decided to put together a top rate team, and get back to Hilltop Recording Studio and produce my solo album.

Action

FUNDING

With all other areas settled, now it’s time to raise the financing to cover the costs of this project. If the funding can be achieved, hopefully within about six weeks time, it could be possible to begin the recording sessions in June 2019. Expecting an effective creative process, followed by technical production, the target release date accompanied by the promotional campaign launch will be in  Autumn 2019.

The amount needed is approximately $20,000 US Dollars. Here's an estimate in rounded off figures of where the funds will be applied:

SESSION MUSICIAN FEES

  • 10 songs 5 musicians + 1 backing vocalist + arrangements/charts                            $7,000

STUDIO COSTS

  • All instrumental tracks + vocal tracks + mixing and mastering                                    $4,000

ADMINISTRATIVE + PRODUCTION COSTS

  • Including travel, hotel, meals, CD manufacturing, shipping costs of rewards, plus consideration of taxation of contributions                                                                           $5,000

PROMOTION COSTS

  • Distribution campaign for nationwide radio play                                                               $4,000

PROJECT TOTAL                                                                                                                                   $20,000

* If the minimum amount of $10,000 US Dollars is not reached, all contributions will be refunded during the last week of the campaign. If this amount is reached, the remainder needed will be raised through alternative channels, including personal earnings, loans and possible cultural grants. All contributors will be kept well informed of the progress of the campaign.

Rewards

I’m not asking for free money, and there will certainly be something in return for your contributions. Those rewards will include digital downloads and CD copies of the new record prior to release in the Autumn 2019, past published recordings from the history of my career in digital, CD and vinyl disc form, and special private performances arranged in the USA and Finland in coordination with my travel schedule.

    Coming home

    For the past forty years I’ve been on the road, all over the world, singing my songs, and other folks’ tunes as well. I’ve recorded as the singer in other people's bands, although I’ve always wanted to make my own record, and now I'm going to get it done. This will be my record and I’m coming home, with all that I’ve learned on my musical life's journey, and you can help make this happen.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you're tight on cash, and can't afford to contribute, you can still help the cause immensely by sharing my campaign with your friends on social media, sending the information out by email, and just telling people about what's happening.

      I want to thank all of you folks who have supported my music for all of these years, and also the musicians who I’ve worked with in America, Finland and Russia. What a team we've been, the musicians, and you the audiences who have kept us going. Without you there wouldn’t be a music scene anywhere in the world!

      I’d also like to send out a very special thanks to the guys in Finland who made the promotional video for this crowdfunding campaign, Simon Götz, Mikko Enqvist and Jari Sirniö.             Thank you very much gentlemen!

      https://www.facebook.com/JoeVestich/

story:
The Story So Far...

He Was Eaten By Owls are an experimental chamber ensemble from London UK, who grew out of the city's then thriving squat community. The brainchild of composer/multi-instrumentalist Kyle Owls, the group have recently completed the recording of his second full length composition 'Inchoate With The Light Go I'. 

Dealing with very personal themes of grief, guilt, mental illness and trauma - the record was funded by PRS For Music and recorded over a period of one year at the Union Chapel, the Crypt, Big Pink and Shaken Oak Studios. Accompanying the album is a 25 minute documentary by film maker Toby Bakare and a series of artworks by the composer.  

We now require a small amount of extra money to create the bespoke vinyl/cd runs and promote the album in the build up to its December release. 

That's where you come in...

Between ourselves and PRS we were able to fund the musician fees, studio costs, travel, instrument costs, rehearsals and mastering engineer fees. 

We just need to raise a further £2,500 to print up 500 cds and 500 vinyl to distribute to our labels worldwide. Each copy will come with a unique annotated photograph, and the vinyl covers will be hand created one of a kind works. 

In return we're offering a massive amount of rewards, including a digital download of the album and a music video way ahead of the release for every backer plus cds/vinyls, t-shirts, signed artworks, signed score sheets, access to the documentary ahead of release, vip tickets and more.

For more info (including hidden perks) click on the links to the right of this page. 

This record not only holds a lot of personal emotional meaning, but it's also the conceptual continuity to 2016's 'Chorus 30 From Blues For The Hitchhiking Dead', and the second instalment of the 'Inchoate Trilogy'.

C30 has nearly sold out of the vinyl/cd runs and been downloaded thousands of times, and we're just really grateful to have such a dedicated global fanbase for our work. We would love to be able to bring you our second offering in equally attractive formats (and with all the extra goodies we can).

Being D.I.Y independent artists is really important to all of us here, and as such creatures we sometimes have to rely on our community to help us keep the work coming. 

Can't spare any money? Share the campaign instead!

Money's tight these days, we know how it is.

If you can't afford to help out in a monetary sense, maybe you can utilise your popularity on facebook/insta/twitter to promote this campaign for us? You'd be surprised at how far a little 'share' can take things!

Thank you all in advance from the bottom of our collective hearts,

HWEBO x

 

STREAMING LINK:

https://soundcloud.com/hewaseatenbyowls/sets/in...

OTHER INFO:

https://inchoatewiththelightgoi.wordpress.com

story:
Our Story

Seven Times Salt has reached our fifteenth year together! To celebrate, in April 2018 we recorded one of our most beloved programs, Pilgrims’ Progress: Music of the Plimoth Colony Settlers, at the historic 1717 Meetinghouse in West Barnstable, MA. This incredible 300-year-old building has perfect acoustics for historical instruments and voices, and its walls may well have heard some of this very music. Sound engineer extraordinaire Dave Jamrog recorded us over two days, and noted viol player and musicologist Sarah Mead (a descendant of John Robinson, pastor to the original group of Pilgrims!) is our producer. The music is already recorded, and now we need your support to edit, produce, and share the CD.

The Album

Contrary to what the history books tell us, the Plimoth colonists or “Pilgrims” were a highly diverse group of Separatists and Anglicans, religious zealots and irreverent opportunists–many of whom had lived in the Netherlands prior to their emigration, and some of whom were Dutch. They brought with them experiences of music as diverse as their reasons for coming to the New World. Our program follows the settlers from their homes in England’s cities and countryside, to religious refuge in the Netherlands, and onward to their challenging, though fulfilling, life in Plimoth Colony. The settlers worked hard and worshipped in their new town, but also found time to entertain themselves with singing and games.  

The new album includes music of 1590-1650, spanning the final years of Queen Elizabeth I's reign to the early colonies of New England. You'll hear the refined music of Morley, Dowland, and van Eyck; spirited catches by Ravenscroft; selections from the Dutch ‘t Uitnemend Kabinet, stirring psalms from Sternhold & Hopkins’ Whole Booke of Psalmes, a boisterous drinking song or three, plus a variety of tunes from Playford's The English Dancing Master. You'll also hear fictional "diary entries" of our travelers read in original pronunciation. We first performed this Pilgrim program in 2004 and have been improving it ever since!

Costs

The music is already recorded, so what's left? Here's how your contribution will help:
$2300 - CD editing and mastering
$450 - graphic design  
$1800 - CD production and shipping
$200 - perk fulfilment
$250 - Indiegogo fees

If we fall short of our goal, we will complete as much editing as possible, then produce the CD when funds allow. If we surpass our goal, we'll be able to pay our musicians for rehearsals, print additional CDs, and fund more concerts - perhaps in a neighborhood near you!

Perks

We have some amazing perks in store for you, including signed copies of Pilgrims' Progress, wine tastings, gourmet dinners with music, house concerts, Feldenkrais sessions, and tickets to Seven Times Salt's 2018-19 concert season.

Your Role

We invite you to help us continue our contributions to early music and historical research. Every single gift helps, no matter the amount. Please share this with your friends and anyone else with an interest in history and culture, historical performance, and supporting the arts. Thank you!

--Karen, Dan, Matt and Josh

Costs
The music is already recorded, so what's left? Here's how your contribution will help:$2300 - CD editing and mastering$450 - graphic design  $1800 - CD production and shipping$200 - perk fulfilment$250 - Indiegogo fees
If we fall short of our goal, we will complete as much editing as possible, then produce the CD when funds allow. If we surpass our goal, we'll be able to pay our musicians for rehearsals, print additional CDs, and fund more concerts - perhaps in a neighborhood near you!
Perks
We have some amazing perks in store for you, including signed copies of Pilgrims' Progress, wine tastings, gourmet dinners with music, house concerts, Feldenkrais sessions, and tickets to Seven Times Salt's 2018-19 concert season.

Your Role
We invite you to help us continue our contributions to early music and historical research. Every single gift helps, no matter the amount. Please share this with your friends and anyone else with an interest in history and culture, historical performance, and supporting the arts. Thank you!
--Karen, Dan, Matt and Josh

story:
Short Summary

 “Music has always been a matter of Energy to me, a question of Fuel. Sentimental people call it Inspiration, but what they really mean is Fuel. I have always needed Fuel. I am a serious consumer. On some nights I still believe that a car with the gas needle on empty can run about fifty more miles if you have the right music very loud on the radio.” -Hunter S. Thompson  

With beginnings as an acoustic duo, Winter Moon has taken many shapes and forms over the years, and right now is a musical family who inspire and challenge each other in the music that we make. 

Like any good band we've had our ups and downs, but our persistence paid off and in August of 2014 we released our debut EP, 'Lucid Dreaming'. The final result was better than we could've imagined, 'Me And The Devil' eventually reaching the top of the Triple J Unearthed Rock Charts. In 2016 we released our second EP, 'Hearts and Hands', which built upon the success of the first and was enjoyed by fans around the world, receiving particular interest from our European fanbase.

This time we're going all out. We've written over twenty killer songs, which will be pared back to the best twelve or thirteen for the album. Recording once again at Head Gap studios with engineer Finn Keane means we know we'll get incredible recordings and the use of top notch studio equipment. We've got Callum Howell (Ocean Alley, Forbes St Studios) on board to mix and produce the album, the sound and success he has achieved for Ocean Alley has inspired us all and we're very excited to be working with him. We'll be utilising the talents of David Briggs (The Little River Band, The Production Workshop) to put the final polish on the master, and we'll be releasing the album on 12" Vinyl through German record label Kozmik Artifactz. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've been paying our own way, from our own pockets, and saving every penny we've earned from our shows towards this recording. We've saved the $4500 needed for six days at Head Gap, with Finn on the console, but the creation of an album doesn't end there.

We'll be forking out another $5800 for production and mixing by Callum Howell at Forbes St Studios in Sydney, and another $660 for mastering to vinyl and digital by David Briggs.

We'll be saving as much as we can before release time, but we also need to consider the expense of printing merchandise as rewards for you lovely people, which could run between $500-$1500, and are aiming to have at least $3000 to spend on professional publicity come Release Time - because, like the proverbial tree in the woods, you can make the greatest album of all time, but if there is no Publicist? Well, you get the idea.

Excitingly, we've been lucky enough to be signed by German record Label Kosmik Artifactz who will be printing and distributing the 12" vinyl copies of the album. 

The Impact

We do this because we love the music we make, and we hope to affect people in the same way the music we love has affected us throughout our lives.

With our last EP 'Hearts and Hands', we crowd-funded over $5000  with your incredible support, and produced an album of which we are exceptionally proud. Here's what just a few of our contributors had to say:

-"Step aside Blues Pills, we have a new Queen in heavy blues town. Winter Moon beams with soulfully seductive swoons and groove infused heavy, poppy blues licks. Adele wishes she had a band this cool to back her up." - Bucky- Reno, Nevada.

-"Instantly infectious and charming psych-rock with rich production, great songwriting and beautiful sounds throughout. Love it!" - Henrik Thogerson- Copenhagen, Denmark

-"Wonderful blues rock. Great release. I expected a great one and the band exceeded my expectations." - Bill Goodman- Chicago, Illinois

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Here are some other ways you can help us to get where we're going:

  • Share this campaign on your social media! The more people we reach, the more chance we have!
  • Come to a show! Your support means the world to us, and every face in the crowd is another inspiration for us to keep working hard.
  • Listen to our music! It's available on every streaming platform, or for purchase at www.wintermoonband.bandcamp.com

Love and thanks from all of us at Winter Moon. x

story:
About Helena

Helena Ward is a songwriter, singer, music producer, multi-instrumentalist and sound engineer. Her folktronica debut album ‘The Lake’ came out in 2009, and she gigged extensively in London around that time; after moving abroad for a while, and then retraining as a music therapist, she returned to her roots and now lives and works in the Suffolk countryside – the inspiration for her ambitious new album, ‘Somewhere In The Night Time’. 

The 10 songs that make up ‘Somewhere In The Night Time’ deal with loss, death, love, war, family, separation, rebirth and reconnection through nature, and feature a wider range of instrumentation and a rawer, live feel. Instead of being multi-tracked, the musicians are being recorded playing together at the same time and in the same place. It also includes ambient compositions created from nature recordings (some recorded binaurally) and found sounds which weave the tracks together. 

Helena says:

“As a sound engineer and music producer I’ve always recorded in my own studio, which meant that when I wrote my debut album ‘The Lake’ I was also able to engineer and produce it myself. But after moving onto a boat to live aboard a few years back I had to dramatically downsize my studio to the bare writing essentials. It left me hungry to make a more musically ambitious album which would require more musicians and a larger, more professional space to record..”

“Luckily, I crossed paths with local studio owner Bob Kidby who has a beautiful recording studio in a Tudor barn, deep in the Suffolk countryside, not far from where I live. We clicked immediately and decided we’d work on the new project together.”

“Being a DIY musician these days comes with its challenges as well as its rewards. One reward can be a greater sense of artistic freedom; not being bound to the expectations of a record company can free an artist to produce more radical, individual and soulful work. It’s great that many music lovers are keen to support artists directly these days by bypassing the big corporations that can have a negative impact on artistic freedom. But one of the difficulties can be resources and funding.

To fully bring the songs to life I needed to collaborate and record in a professional studio; there’s also post-production, photography, artwork, CD pressing, video production, promotion and other costs to factor in..”

“So, if you feel inspired to support my work and be a part of making my new album a reality, please consider supporting my campaign by choosing one of the many perks I have on offer. And if you could share my campaign with your friends and social networks, that in itself would be a huge support. Thank you." Helena

A little bit of history

Helena honed her skills as a sound engineer in London, working for five years alongside Andy Gill (Gang of Four) as his assistant engineer, working on recordings by artists such as The Futureheads and The Young Knives. During this time she was busy developing her own sound at the more extreme end of dance music, writing and producing for cutting-edge dance music labels Skyride and Defiant Records, and playing live electronic sets on the London club scene. 

Eventually, Helena left London and moved to Spain where she set up a makeshift recording studio in a shed on an Andalusian mountainside and began to imagine, write and record what eventually evolved into her atmospheric, dreamlike and yet vibrant debut album ‘The Lake’.

"A collection of confessional songs of raw emotion and compelling imagery moulding the delicacy and craft of folk with the grooves and atmospheres of electronica. With a captivating voice and ethereal, yet erudite words, [Helena Ward] tightrope-walks across an abyssal musical landscape of enchanting melodies, intricate guitar, and angular, lurching grooves... this is an album informed by an intimate knowledge of the far reaches of human experience".

Please visit my website to listen to my music:

https://www.helenawardmusic.com

Recording the album..

Bob's studio

Dave Jackson's lovely twirly cymbal

Me at the Joanna

Tim and Susanne in the control room

Me and Bob

The amazing Dave Jackson on drums

 

The wonderful David Battiscombe on bass

Tim at the controls

Thank you very much for reading about my campaign and giving your support. I hope you enjoy the music! Helena x

Listen to my music: https://www.helenawardmusic.com 

Video: Susanne and Jason Horncastle. 

Photography: Jason Horncastle: http://www.zamplify.co.uk

story:
These drum circles are led by professional drum circle facilitator Katy Gaughan, which means she:

·     provides drums and instruments for the community

·     offers instruction on how to play the drum

·     “conducts” the drumming to create beautiful music through rhythm and songs

·     helps participants connect to each other and build community

·     organizes the crew to offer solid support on the bass drums

To make sure these drum circles keep going this summer, we need your help to raise money to fund the drum circles!!

For every $400 raised, Katy and her crew will offer a monthly drum circle.  

Let’s pitch in and meal the goal of $2000 so we can meet once a month in May, June, July, August & September. If we raise more than $2000 …. More drum circles! 

Katy believes in the healing power of music and offers this service as a contribution to the community.  In order for the drum circles to keep going though, there are costs that must be covered.

$400/circle pays for:

·  Organization and promotional expenses 

·  Drums and instruments 

·  Professional facilitation by Katy Gaughan 

·  Crew & logistical support, including chairs

Think about it this way: how much do you pay for a yoga class?  Or a concert?  Those investments are worth your time and money, right?  Well, so is a community drum circle!  And your support pays it forward because these circles benefit the entire community!

Please pitch in whatever you can to keep the heartbeat alive and well in Takoma Park! Whether it’s $1, $5, $25 or $100 +, your support will make a difference!!! 

THANK YOU!  LET'S DRUM!!
