story:
When is the CD coming out?

Yep you guessed it, "when is the CD coming out"? is the most frequently asked question asked after EVERY show!!

While we don't have immediate plans on an entire album just yet, we do have some great news! 

We've started recording our very first collaborative studio single together, yep you've asked for it and we are happy to share this news with you.

But not only are we recording a single we are also filming our very first OFFICIAL 'Queens of Soul Jazz' Music Video!!  Now to do this the right way and deliver the quality you've come to enjoy and expect from us we are pulling out all the stops!

What also makes this so special is we get to have all the people who've shown us so much love over the years be a part of the process.  We don't know if you know this or not so we will just say it, YOU are making history with us as partners in our very first radio single AND music video as 'The Queens of Soul Jazz'!!

 

We've secured an amazing videographer, music producer, musicians, and even have some surprises for you! 

We already know we have the best fans in the world! You show us such amazing love at every show and having you take this journey with us means everything!

With each of you on board we can accomplish great things and give you an amazing product in the process!

Here’s the breakdown of where the money raised is going:

• Video Editing (including the editor and post-production supervisor) 

• Video Set Fee (having necessities on hand at every location of the shoot makes the process run smoothly) Venues and the people who are working behind the scenes on set, the extra’s, the make-up and transportation all add up pretty quickly.

• Mixing the song audio (Andrew Dorsett will be mixing this one for us)

• Mastering the song audio (Kandy Kitchen Studios)

• Coloring the raw video Footage (we want you to experience everything in perfect format. This includes colors, levels, lighting, filters and all the little things that make a great video POP) 

• Music clearance administrator (our administrator is in charge of negotiating the rights to use the song on video.) Since we did not write ‘We Are One’ we have to get proper clearance from all of the different publishers out there. Doing things the right way includes music clearance and this gets pretty expensive.

• Music SYNC Licenses (for every song used and uploaded to YouTube and other social media outlets, we have to pay a fee to use it. This can be very costly depending on who owns the song)

• Securing Music Publishing Mechanical Licenses (this is different than sync licenses)

• Artwork & Design (for both the single packaging and video design)

• Wardrobe (Now you KNOW we need to bring our best selves for this video and we want to showcase a whole new look for you!) We have some ideas for our brand-new color scheme and we know you’ll love it!

• Airfare & Lodging (since the videographer is in California we need to have Althea on location for the duration of the shoot) The shoot is two days, this will cover the length of stay and airfare from Texas to California and back.

• Marketing & Radio Promotion (Getting radio play is just the beginning of the marketing process.) There’s so much that goes into a successful marketing campaign, everything from radio to television and social media processes are lengthy and require a skilled team to make things work!   

We Are One

When we started this project the main focus was getting the message of unity and togetherness out to the world! This is so much more than a song or music video, it’s a call to action! It's why we chose the song 'We Are One' as the single whereby we will share our message.

The Queens of Soul Jazz is a different take on collaboration. We not only perform together as artist, we also share a powerful purpose. A message of unity and oneness that superseeds competition and honors individuality while celebrating a common theme. 

 

 

Another important part of our vision is to give back to the youth through various philanthropic avenues. 

 

Be it clothing, educational supplies, sponsored lessons or inspirational speaking, The Queens of Soul Jazz are so much more than either of us individually, we are a powerful message of unity strength and power! We have so much more to do and would like to give back to our youth even more in this upcoming year. 

So as you can see, this campaign is a doorway to additional resources and opportunities for us to do even bigger things in the near future!

This campaign will not only allow us the opportunity to share our purpose and passion together in our very 1st OFFICIAL Queens of Soul Jazz Video. It will also provide a platform for us to share the message we believe in so much on a global scale!

We know it’s a large task and we don’t take it lightly.  It's going to take each and everyone of us to make this campaign a success and we can’t pull this off without you. 

YOU can help contribute to this project via the many ‘Perks’ available to choose from. Starting at just $25 all the way up to $6,000 :)

And if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out.

Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and feel free to use the 'share' tools right here on the Indiegogo site. It would be so appreciated.

We love and appreciate each of you, sincerely and wonderfully!

The Queens of Soul Jazz!

story: 20 year old Ally Ahern is much more than meets the eye. An edgy, yet refined visual aesthetic perfectly matches her keen ear for melody and storytelling. Meshing her skills as a multi-instrumentalist and vocalist with modern production, the Chicago native weaves fever dream tales of love and loss over a signature alternative pop cabaret sound. Her one of a kind voice whispers and soars over a dynamic roller coaster of synths and 808 beats. Her captivating vocals range from sweet and sultry to powerhouse diva, while her commanding stage presence and charisma mesmerizes her audiences. Ahern is surely not a one trick pony, she is professionally trained in and opera, jazz, musical theatre, and has experience singing a multitude of other genres. She is currently under management with Gramophone Media’s Eshy Gazit, and is working as a songwriter and preparing for her next release.

Meshing her skills as a multi-instrumentalist and vocalist with modern production, the Chicago native weaves fever dream tales of love and loss over a signature alternative pop cabaret sound. Her one of a kind voice whispers and soars over a dynamic roller coaster of synths and 808 beats. Her captivating vocals range from sweet and sultry to powerhouse diva, while her commanding stage presence and charisma mesmerizes her audiences. Ahern is surely not a one trick pony, she is professionally trained in and opera, jazz, musical theatre, and has experience singing a multitude of other genres. She is currently under management with Gramophone Media’s Eshy Gazit, and is working as a songwriter and preparing for her next release.

story:
Silver Bells ready for Production!

It has been three months since the campaign ended in June.  The album was recorded in July 2018. Mixing and Mastering are now completed and we are on track to send the master copy for production and replication in a few days!! Lord willing, the CDs will be ready for distribution in November 2018 instead of December, and downloads available shortly thereafter. I'll be performing songs from "Silver Bells" Songs of Christmas JOY! at the CD release concert in the St. Louis area in November, and also at a Christmas concert in Lexington, KY. I'm excited! to say the least. 

Inspiration

A few years ago, I created Christmas videos that I shared with my family and friends. That was my inspiration to record an official full-length Christmas album that I could share with more people. Since then I have been dreaming and praying for the chance to record and produce my first Christmas album.

My faith in God kept my dream alive as I moved around for work as Technology Consultant and Contractor. Then in 2015, I decided to accept a 3-month contract working in St. Louis. and I've been living and singing in the St. Louis area ever since. I didn't know then, but I now believe that divine intervention brought me back to St. Louis to fulfill my dream.

Why This Recording

My goal is to share my musical gift with you and the next generation, especially now when our world needs to hear songs that encourage, lift our spirits, and give us hope. 

Listeners have said that my singing voice inspires them through clear tones, authenticity, and warmth. One listener said my singing voice is “refreshing and uplifting”. You're welcome to read testimonials of my work by scrolling down to the Album Notes of my debut CD "Simple Song" at - https://cdbaby.com/cd/aguhob

This album will be a compilation of popular holiday songs and Christmas ballads, carols, classical, sacred, and gospel Christmas songs. These songs will warm your heart and set your spirit right to celebrate the Joy of Christmas!

Your Partnership

I'm happy to announce that partial funding of this project has been provided by an Artist Grant from the Regional Arts Commission of St. Louis. Being a recipient of this award encouraged me to make this musical project dream a reality! 

I'm inviting you to partner with me to raise the remainder of the project cost. The campaign goal will cover the cost of mixing & mastering of the album, as well as CD replication and distribution. Listed below are ways you can partner with me on this campaign and gifts (perks) that come with your partnership.

Become a partner - $75, $150, $450 - by May 20th and I will gift wrap your CDs with a note saying "A musical gift to you from [partner name]. Enjoy!"

Project Partners $25

  • A hard copy (CD) of the album and Digital download of the ENTIRE ALBUM (Download code emailed to you).

CD Pre-Release Partners $75

  • Three (3) autographed hard copies (CD). 
  • Digital download of the ENTIRE ALBUM before the album is released to the world. (Download code emailed to you).

Encouraging Partners $150
CHRISTMAS PACKAGE: 

  • Personal THANK YOU in the CD liner notes. 
  • Six (6) autographed hard copies (CD) of the album. 
  • Digital download of the album before it’s released to the world. (Download code emailed to you).

Silver Bells Partners $450

GUEST ARTIST PACKAGE:

  • I will be a Guest Artist at your Church or Corporate Event (within 50-mile radius) and sing four (4) songs during your event. Valid within one (1) year of the "Silver Bells - Songs of Christmas JOY!" release date.
  • Personal THANK YOU in the CD liner notes. 
  • Six (6) autographed hard copies (CD) of the album. 
  • Digital download of the album before it’s released to the world. (Download code emailed to you).

CHRISTMAS PACKAGE II: 

  • Personal THANK YOU in the CD liner notes. 
  • Twenty (20) autographed hard copies (CD) of the album. 
  • Digital download of the album before it’s released to the world. (Download code emailed to you).

Your Impact

Thank you for taking time to learn more about my dream. This is an opportunity for you to partner in a musical project that we all can be proud of and share with others who enjoy music and listening to the Joy of Christmas. With your partnership, "Silver Bells - Songs of Christmas JOY!" will be available to the whole world in December 2018.

If the goal is exceeded, then CD replication and distribution of my album will increase. But if the campaign goal is not met, then I will use more of my personal funds to make-up the difference, so that this musical project is produced but with limited CD copies available and primarily digital download and distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

I joyfully welcome your help by spreading the word about this campaign and the release of "Silver Bells - Songs of Christmas JOY!" on December 2018. The exact release date and concert event will be announced on Thanksgiving Eve 2018!

story:
The Space Chums are an Intergalactic, Totally Rocktastic, ElectroFun Pop Band for Kids and their Groovy Grownups.  

The Chums are raring to get started on their next album, "Calling All Space Cadets!" after the staggering success of their break-out album,"Blast Off".

Unfortunately the outrageous fortunes they've amassed from selling-out planet-wide mega gigs across the galaxy don't get a great exchange rate on your planet... Their net worth of $8.9 zillion GalactoBucks works out to roughly $13.62 Earth Dollars...

But is that going to stop the Space Chums? Zoiks, no! They're going to MAKE this album with the help of all their Earthling Pals, and they're going to have a ridiculous amount of fun along the way! Not only can you pre-order your advance signed copy of the new album, you'll also get exclusive, mind-boggling, mega-fan perks and experiences!

We're super excited to be recording the album on your beautiful planet of Earth! We have enlisted extra-talented humanoids Mitch Girio at The Slow Cooker Studios in the Scarborough Quadrant of Earth and James “Jimmy Jumps” Moore in the Ireland Quadrant of Euro-Earth to help with producing and mixing and other wizardry.

While we’re on the planet, we’re looking forward to hanging out with our Earthling Fans and getting into some serious shenanigans! Always wanted to be in a Space Chums Video? Write a song with us? Go the the POOP CAFÉ with us?! Well, Space Cadet, NOW IS YOUR CHANCE!

And don't dare miss our exclusive Album Release Party just for you, our Indiegogo backers, at the Drake Underground in Toronto on May 27th!

So check at all our great perks, order your album and get ready to have a blast with everyone's favourite Extra-terrestrial Rock Stars,

THE SPAAAAACE CHUUUUUUMS!!!!!!!

story:
L'album / The album

Alchime Accidentelle - C'est un album qui demeure fidèle au son du Paysagiste, c'est-à-dire des mélodies accrocheuses et des textes émouvants, Mais c'est un album de transition aussi, qui a été enregistré à différents moments, dans différents studios, avec différents musiciens. J'en suis extrèmement fièr, et j'ai hâte de le partager avec vous!

 

Accidental alchemy - It's an album that remains faithfull to the Paysagiste sound, strong melodies with emotionally provacative lyrics. But it's also an album of transitions, which was recorded at different periods, in different studios and with different collaborators. I'm extremely proud of it and can't wait to share it with you!

story:
Hi, friends!  Here is a little bit about me, my story and how LIGHTNING came to be:

My name is Lexi Adams, I'm from a small town located in Southwest Michigan called Plainwell.  I moved to Nashville Tennesee shortly after graduating high school to pursue a career in songwriting and music.  Once I graduated college, I attended  ministry school through my church in Nashville; there I learned how to hear God's voice, experience His heart for me, while gaining so many other invaluable tools to add to my "tool-belt" for my walk with God and life.  After 3 years of ministry school, I decided it was time to start taking my music career a bit more seriously-- cowrites, songwriters rounds and house shows were great!  but I decided it was time for more.  That "deciding" turned into an audition to be a part of the Saints and Sinners tour, which led me to meet Mitch Parks who believed in me as an artist &  enjoyed the songs I wrote, which then led to the recording of 5 original songs for my EP titled, "Lightning."

Two months after finishing the recording process, I got really sick-- so sick, to the point I couldn't leave my house for over two weeks!  During that time, I knew something needed to change and well, lets just say after that I packed up all my stuff and moved back home to Michigan after having lived in Nashville for over 8 years.  It was a bit of an adjustment at first but, here I am living back in my hometown, playing music around town (more than I ever was in Nashville) and loving every moment of it!

So what's next?

It's time to finally RELEASE "Lightning," it's been a 2 year process and I'm ready for Lightning to get out for the world to hear, BUT! I can't do it without YOU!  The plan is to go back down to Nashville and FILM a live performance of my entire EP (with a band, in a studio). Once the film has been edited, the songs mix and mastered, I'd then release one video of a song, per week a month before the record release. This will not only help promote the EP, but it will also generate a buzz for the release of the record, as well as build visual content for people to see who I am!  Essentially, you would help me make these videos for the world to see Lexi Adams, as well as hear Lightning. 

Now that LIGHTNING has been recorded what will your contributions help me achieve?

Working with the best musicians, producers, videographers, and studios comes at a high price!  But SO worth it.  Your donations will go toward:

1) Hiring a professional videographer who will film the live performance of Lightning  

2) Hiring studio musicians 

3) Mixing and mastering fees for each live recorded song.

4)  Studio fees

Anything left over will go toward expenses for merchandise, CD’s and touring.

But where//to whom exactly is the money going?

The goal is to raise $5,000!  Yikes, that is a scary number to ask for, but I'm going for it, folks!  This is where the money will be going: 

-Videography= $2,500

-Musicians=$500 each (there are 3 of them)

-Mix//Mastering and Studio fees= $1,000

If you decide to contribute, here are your perks:

1) $10+ a hand-written letter, expressing my gratitude and appreciation, as well as a link to download my song, "Lightning."

2) $25+ all the above, plus a signed CD of my EP, as well as a digital download of the EP. 

3) $50+ all the above, plus a poster of my face-- you know you want that!

3) $100+ all the above, plus a song written, just for YOU.

4) $150+ all the above, plus a shoutout on my instgram and facebook, as well as a "Lexi Adams" mug.

5) $200+ all the above, plus a notebook and a (my favorite kind) pen, with a handwritten, encouraging note, just for you.

6) $300+ all the above, plus a Lexi AdamsT-shirt, and a video posted of the song I wrote for you posted on my music facebook page, for all the people that follow me to hear!

6) $500+ all of the above, plus all the swag you could think of! Guest lists and backstage passes to the album release show.

7) $750+ all of the above, plus a free concert at your house or wherever you choose to have me! (within 50 mile radius).

Than YOU for helping me make my dream a reality! You are the reason why I am able to DO THIS!  Wow, YOU my friend, are amazing!!

Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal:

If I don't reach my goal, I will use the bit of money I have made through this campaign and put it towards my record and the release of it:  merchandise, finding//hiring a band, promoting the EP by doing a small tour, etc. 

A little more of my (real//raw) heart for the project:

It's hard to ask for money, in fact, I hate it.  I think most people could probably agree with me here.  I have found that I am at constant war with myself as I've contemplated starting an Indiegogo Campaign.  1) As I already said, I don't like asking for money. 2) What if I don't raise a single dollar?!  It's a tad vulnerable. 3) The weird stigma with artists//musicians doing Crowdfunding campaigns. Yet, it's all a risk I'm willing to take!

So, with the little bit of courage I can muster here I'm going to (try) put these insecurities to rest as I choose to trust the journey. It's scary, fun, exhilarating, lots of questions and doubts, BUT I'm going to hold on to the fun and exhilarating part of it as I continue to say, "YES" to this wild ride.  So what do you think?  Think you might wanna come with? 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to give financially, that is OKAY!  I would greatly appreciate if  you sharing this campaign, as well as promoting Lightning through different social media outlets:  facebook, Instagram, twitter, snapchat, and any others that I don't know about:)

You guys mean the world to me!  I cannot thank you enough for believing in me, championing me, cheering me on, and always encouraging me.  It's time to take things to the next level in my music career! It's GO TIME!

story:
about shiren ho

shiren ho started writing songs with humming and no knowledge in music theory (other than what she learnt and forgot in music classes). she picked up an ukulele and boldly made her debut album "sh. listen." in 2011.  she has been exploring her journey in songwriting since... 

www.facebook.com/shirenho/

 

why?

music is not a currency, but a craft.  in the commercialized music landscape, it is sometimes hard to trace back to that purity and freedom of creating music.  this album embraces that freedom by sharing these authentic heart-warming moments with its listeners.

 

target : USD 12,000

tracking, mixing, mastering  - 65%
album design and printing - 10%
promotion - 5%
launch gig production cost  - 12%
administrative fee - 8%

 

perks preview

(feel free to get multiple!)

 

songs

1. the painter
2. treehouse
3. moments with you
4. ephesians 3
5. tim
6. petals
7. when you came around
8. mercy oceans deep
9. sunday

 

credits

songs: shiren ho, [lyrics of mercy] sharon chu
arrangement: marienne felisilda, major chan, shiren ho
recording & mixing: major chan
mastering: joão fonseca
vocals: shiren ho
supporting vocals: shiren ho, marienne felisilda
guitar: major chan, philip lee
keys & effects: marienne felisilda
drums: dean li
bass: hin leung
project management: fanny ng
album design: candy chu @ edited
photography: jonathan lau @ lauhaus.co


all original songs produced by shiren ho. all rights reserved.

story:
HELP CHESS COUNTESS

Hi! I'm Chess Countess and I'm a Pop artist from New Zealand.

Let's be honest, it's been a while since I've recorded and released any of my music. The reason for this? A lack of funds. Yep, it's very expensive to get music recorded to a high enough standard for release, let alone filming music videos, booking gig venues...and don't even get me started on tours!

This is where you come in! My truly awesome and supportive Chess Club. I have exciting new music to share with you and I've decided to start by recording two initial singles, before hopefully gaining the attention of the likes of New Zealand On Air to record more for an eventual EP. Your donation to this cause - no matter how small - will help me achieve my goals of finally transferring these songs from inside my head to audio files that you can play on repeat to your heart's content. You'll even get to watch my wonderland come alive in a couple of music videos, too!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Two tracks at $1,150NZD each = $2,300NZD TOTAL
  • Two music videos at approx. $6,000NZD each = approx. $12,000NZD TOTAL

What you'll get:

  • Donate $10: 1x Free digital copy of each track
  • Donate $20 or more: 1x Free digital copy of each track + signed CC poster
  • All donors will be credited so please leave your names!

If we don't meet our goal, we'll still be putting what money we receive towards the creation of these singles and videos, so every little bit really does count!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know money doesn't grow on trees and, for some of you, donating just isn't an option. But you can still help!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
"What is this?"

We are Buddhist rock band darshan Pulse (dP), a band born in the musically rich community of Missoula, Montana, in the heart of the Rocky Mountains. After publishing our debut concept album in the spring of 2010, we've worked continuously on our second concept album: Olive Moksha (OM). This ambitious project was crafted with the intention of guiding the listener on a wordless journey, which tells a timeless story of three monks as they navigate life, death, and rebirth. The story takes us from dukkha (worldly suffering) to anatta (the doctrine of non-self).

We think about cycles so much that we also produce all kinds of other art related to our continuous contemplation of cycles, much of which is inexorably tied to this album. After 8 years of blood, sweat and tears, every aspect of the entire project is finally complete. The proprietary theory is invented and fleshed out, the songs are written and recorded, the performances are mixed and mastered, the art is drawn and colored; the story is almost complete. Now it's time to make some copies, and share our truth with fellow seekers! 

Listen Now!

Want to listen to the entire album right now, to make sure it's worth your hard-earned coin? Digital download of the album is available on our Bandcamp page for just $10, and listening is always free! See what we're all about while helping us realize this dream:

https://darshanpulse.bandcamp.com/releases

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to get Olive Moksha printed, published and promoted. Our goal is to press 2,000 CDs and send half to a promoter, with the intention of getting this music into the playlists of as many College and Non-Profit Radio stations as possible. Our total aspiration of $9,905 breaks down like this:

  • CDs will be printed on 6-Panel digipack, just like the first album. Oasis Disk Manufacturing has quoted the cost of printing at approximately $3,005.22.
  • Oasis quotes 200 double-disc LPs (so 4 LP sides per set), at $5,200.34. High quality vinyl prints will last longer than CDs and include enlarged album art. Unlike the rest of our perks, vinyl is highly contingent upon successfully meeting the total goal - 6/7/18 Update: based on response so far, we are not pursuing vinyl reproduction at this time. Can't win if you don't play ;) 
  • Additionally, we intend to hire a promoter to help us spread the love to College Radio stations around the country, estimated at around $1,200.
  • We owe our film guy $400 dollars for his outstanding work on our video.
  • We'll need $100 minimum to print posters. We can't know this number for sure until we know how many posters to print. That number will remain unknown until the campaign's conclusion.

You can also get your hands on  prints with exclusive hand-drawn album art. Four detailed and meditative art prints available to contributors: Water Snake Mandala (13'' x 19''), Golden Rabbit Mandala (13'' x 19''), Gabriowl (18'' x 24''), Stovehenge (24'' x 24''), and the Universal Calendar (24'' x 24''). See images below! 

Impact

We have found time and time again that music can produce dramatic alterations in consciousness; we wonder to what extent music can change the world for the better. It seems that producing this album transformed the lives of everyone involved with it, in ways simple and complex. To what extent might these melodies change your own life for the greatest good?

We successfully printed our last project in the same way we're printing this one, but we never made an effort to get it heard outside of our city. We feel that our intentions behind this project reflect a maturation of aesthetic expression. May the inspiration and joy of these transcendent melodies brighten days, ease spirits and inspire thoughts!

Risks & Challenges

Assuming we don't meet our goal, our priorities are organized thus:

-Print at least 500 copies of the CD, print our art and stickers to order, and get those copies to our contributors.

-With the leftover copies, get at least 50% to online reviewers and college radio stations that play progressive and indy rock.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise by sharing this page, our video and our message.
  • Visit and share our regularly updated website at https://darshanpulse.com/ to learn more about the theory and practice behind this music. 

Background: The Story

Dukkha, the state of suffering and want, begins our tale. Upon this background the curtains rise on three monks, performing their daily duties at a nameless monastery. They cut wood, carry water, tell stories (Vihara Devoir).

On the monastery grounds there is an olive orchard, where the monks work and meditate . One night, while the monks are meditating under an ancient olive tree, Avalokiteshvara, an enlightened being, appears to them in a vision. He tells them to leave the orchard and become bodhisattvas to wander the earth spreading good works. They immediately depart, giving their lives over to public service, each having a grand adventure and struggle greater than the next (Wandering Bhikkhu). By and by, they live out their lives, gradually winding down, passing peaceably into the spirit world without malice or despair. Their bodies are sent back to the monastery for burial (Request to Laura).

Upon death, each of them sees for the first time the transient nature of all things -- a movement of lightness and air enters them. They pass through the bardos between death and rebirth, first re-experiencing their lightest thoughts and moments of fleeting grace (Pala Moksha), followed swiftly by a re-telling of their darkest, most selfish thoughts, and moments of weakness (Sidpa Bardo). Unable to remain coalesced into a separate Will, facing an unknowable choice between rebirth and nirvana, each monk's selfhood is torn apart in the transition (Tulku Bhava).

Years pass, and three children are born, each somewhere in the first world (Ici Avant). They come of age in an ailing society, overfull with violence and thoughtlessness, and struggle with the desire to take the right action instead of the easiest action. Desperate for an answer to the deepest questions that plague them, they each search for their own Truth, wherever it may lead (Quarry Unhewn). By and by, through hill and vale, the children find themselves at the doors of an ancient monastery. The scent of fruit oil and brine fills the air with peace and sweetness.

The abbot of the monastery meets with each child. It is clear from their meeting that this is not the first time they have met. The children know too much at too young an age. The children and the abbot talk long into the night, contrasting stories of a bygone time of a natural rise and fall with those of woes of present unmet wants. Exhausted from the revelation, the children stay the night at the orchard, sleeping under an old half-dead tree (Padme in the Orchard).

During the night, the children are visited by Avalokiteshvara in a shared dream. They see that their seemingly separate personalities are actually three emanations of a singular presence as their consciousnesses merge with that of the transcendent being. They awaken at once to the brightness of the full moon, she having suddenly slipped off her blanket of cloud. Having momentarily stepped into a larger world, they are struck still by the realization of Anatta, or no-self; that there is no difference between themselves, the old monks, and the Bodhisattva nature of all sentient beings. They rise with the Knowledge, the Sight, and the Truth. Whether they live long and well, it is not for us to say. But having experienced Moksha, they are free.

Background: The Theory

Disclaimer: This part is really only for the musicians, mathematicians, or other insufferable know-it-alls -- other people too, of course, but generally ones adept in their nature.  ;)  

The basic idea/assumption that generated the music theory and musical forms that underlie Olive Moksha is this: that the scale a melody is played in has a reliable emotional affect. Usually this is limited, in most music, to major (a happy, uplifting, simple-sounding scale) and minor (an introspective, darker, complex-sounding scale). Our composer realized that major and minor are simply permutations of the same underlying circular sequence, only starting in different locations.

For those that know the Do-Re-Mi song from The Sound of Music: Major starts its scale on the Do, but minor starts its scale on the La. (If you imagine singing La Ti Do Re Mi Fa So La, for example, that's a minor scale). Thus it's a clear logical extension to consider the other scales as well - the unnamed ones that end on Re, Mi, Fa, So, and Ti. 

Turns out, surprising no one, these scales have been around since the time of the Greeks, and got the names we know them by in the 1200s - they are called Ionian, Dorian, Phrygian, Lydian, Aeolian and Locrian - and they have the ability to paint melodies in more subtle shades of emotion than just Happy and Sad. But it goes much deeper.

Those that have some experience with concert band or private musical lessons will also be familiar with the scales of Harmonic Minor and Melodic Minor - these scales mostly came about because composers wanted to have the satisfying linear harmonic motion they get so easily in a V-I major cadence, but transposed into minor. Crucially, these scales don't overlap with the major/minor sequence - they are wholly new seven-note sequences, each with their own unique Do, Re, Mi, etc., on which new scales of a more exotic nature are revealed. 

By way of example, one scale we employ, which we gave the moniker of "Romantic", has a sweetly sour nostalgic warmth to it. It's also the fifth mode of the Melodic Minor scale, starting on the relevant So. In C, meaning all the white keys, it would be C major with a B flat instead of a B and an Ab flat instead of an A; in A, the same scale would be A minor with a C sharp. This means, in terms of Romantic's emotional qualities, it lies two steps away from Major, and one step away from Minor. The fact that this scale has the emotional quality that it does  -- lying closer to minor than major on the emotional axis -- is not coincidence.

Of course, every theory has its limits. Even though we find a total of 28 potential scales, derived from 4 unique seven-note sequences, a sizable minority of them are unsuitable for practical reasons. (The main problem is that 3 of these scales have an unstable augmented chord as their Do, or root note, and 7 have a diminished chord. No good -- they are just too far from major and minor, harmonically, to make sense to our Western ears, music appreciation being a subjective and fickle cultural beast.) Thus we are left with 18 scales on which to base our emotional narrative: four scales each from Melodic Minor, Harmonic Minor, and Harmonic Major; and six scales from the Major sequence, the original Sound-of-Music Do-Re-Mi. 

This explanation really only scratches the surface of a three dimensional musical solid, so go listen to the Bandcamp if you're still interested after all this. If the tunes appeal to you, and you want to know more, please contact us! And buy a track or two. :) (There's a related music theory perk for the truly hardcore.)

Here's an early-adolescent version of the main part of the theory, in case you're interested. (The fully fleshed-out version remains behind closed doors, for now.) https://zarvoc.wordpress.com/2009/05/29/the-circle-of-melodic-dissonance/#more-42 

Background: The Universal Calendar

Clocks are circular, and depict time, which certainly varies regularly, in predictable cycles. In the modern world, we track days with a sweeping hand, tracing out the same daily patterns and routines. However, our post-industrial monitoring of weeks and months is linear, tracing a straight line towards the unknown. We imagine ourselves standing on an infinite sidewalk down a main thoroughfare, with the unknowable future blocks ahead and the forgotten past blocks behind. 

Other cultures don't necessarily share this linear fascination; the Zodiac contains one cycle of time, the Hindu Yugas a second, the Mayans a third. Even the sky itself spins slowly in its own lazy circle. Each foretells rises and falls. Thus our artist and illustrator was inspired to design a Universal Calendar for the album's cover, depicting several cycles simultaneously. On the outermost rim, the I Ching awaits us, followed by the Hindu Yugas, the Mayan Ha'ab and Tzolkin calendars, and the Western Zodiac, all held together by the nine-triangled Sri Yantra. The combined wisdom of these otherwise disparate calendar systems allows for the realization that while we might each focus on different bits of the pattern, we are all watching the same fireworks show.

If you're dP af, ever more meticulous explanations and unnecessary details can be found here: https://darshanpulse.com/theory/

Background: The Personnel

Without the serendipity and solitude of Montana, this project would not have coalesced into being. Without the caring and trust of the community of Missoula, this project would not have been completed. Thanks to all our supporters and creators!

 

Core Musicians:

Stephanie Mansfield – Electric Bass

Sean McChesney -- Electric and Acoustic Guitars, Keys

RemBrandt Miller -- Electric and Acoustic Guitars

Graham Woolley -- Percussion, Supplemental Guitars and Keys


 

Session Musicians:

Megan Makeever Ali -- Flute

Adam Peele -- Trumpet

Justine Flynn – Harp, French Horn

Jessica Catron -- Cello

Brandon Zimmer -- Hand Percussion

Gabriel Vasicheck -- Throat Singing

 

Recording and Production:

Brandon Zimmer -- Recording Engineer, Producer

RemBrandt Miller -- Editing Junkie

Graham Woolley -- Session Engineer, Field Recordings

Jason Hicks – Mastering Engineer

 

Inventors:

RemBrandt Miller -- Album Artwork, Story

Danicka Bright – Album Artwork

Graham Woolley -- Chief Composer, Secondary Improviser, Story

Sean McChesney -- Chief Improviser, Secondary Composer,

Ken Grinde -- Indiegogo video Director and Producer

 

Final Thoughts

Obviously, the members of darshan Pulse are amendable to Buddhist doctrine in one form or other. We aren't Bodhisattvas, but we hold those that are in the highest regard, and aspire to do better. We believe that the highest cause is to work in the service of the cessation of others' suffering.

We are drops of dew on a web, interconnected and interdependent, awaiting the Light that will vanquish us to the dawn sky until the moon but rise again.

Ken Grinde -- Indiegogo video Director and Producer
 
Final Thoughts
Obviously, the members of darshan Pulse are amendable to Buddhist doctrine in one form or other. We aren't Bodhisattvas, but we hold those that are in the highest regard, and aspire to do better. We believe that the highest cause is to work in the service of the cessation of others' suffering.
We are drops of dew on a web, interconnected and interdependent, awaiting the Light that will vanquish us to the dawn sky until the moon but rise again.

story:
//WHO WE ARE//

We are, a family of worshipping musicians and singers from Kingdom Life Church in Oakland, Maine. We desire that from our home in New England, to the nations of the earth, that extravagant worship would rise to Jesus, our beautiful King.

Since in 2005 we have strived to create a worship culture that carries the authenticity to move the heart of God and the authority to bring heaven to earth. We long to use our song and our sound to create a resting place for God; to sit at His feet and fill the room with the fragrance of our adoration. 

//WHY MAKE AN ALBUM//

These songs have their origin in real moments of worship from the the last 10 years that have marked our lives, and the life of our church. We believe they will do the same for you as they stir up fresh worship in your heart and launch you into encountering Jesus over and over again. 

//WHERE WILL MY MONEY GO//

There is a lot that goes into creating a beautiful high quality album. Here is where our money is going.

  • Pre-Production (booking time in a professional studio and working with producers to help craft and arrange these songs)
  • Live Engineering (capturing the sounds the night they happen...a difficult task!)
  • Post Production (the mixing and mastering of the songs that have already been recorded)
  • Album Design and Distribution (we want the art around the album to be just as worshipful as the songs themselves!)

//OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP//

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our campaign! Help us get the word out to as many people as possible! 
  • While we are asking people to help fund this album we are putting all our eggs in the basket of God's provision. So please agree with us in prayer to see Gods funding of this album released!

 

We can't wait to sing these songs with you! Bless you!

story:
Flatpack Opera

We are Flatpack Opera,  a group of young musicians based in Aberdeen who studied at or are still studying in the Music Department at the University of Aberdeen. 

We are seeking funds to help produce three short operas for children which will be performed in schools in Aberdeen in February 2019. The project is managed by composer Joe Stollery and librettist Ruth Rose - we worked together in 2017 on the Silver City Stories project in Aberdeen. Inspired by our experiences, and the appeal of the format of “pop-up” operas, we are creating three new operas that are specifically designed for children; they are portable and can be bundled into a car to travel around performing to various school groups in Aberdeen, with workshops attached to the performances to engage children in the whole experience of opera.

We need to raise another £2040 for production costs to along with the money we have been awarded by Aberdeen City Council through the 2018 Year of Young People Creative Funding process.

You can pledge as much as you like, but we've added some perks as follows:

  • £20 gets you a copy of the musical score of one of the operas, signed by the creators Ruth Rose and Joe Stollery.
  • £50 gets you a signed copy of the music and one of the stars of Arloe the Anteater (Arloe,  Llama, Whale or Sloth).
  • £500 gets you a signed copy of the music, all the stars of the opera and your own private performance by arrangement  somewhere in Aberdeen on Friday 22nd February 2019.

Ruth says: "The main idea behind this project is to make opera more accessible. The words and music are specifically designed to be family-oriented with topics that are interesting to children. The three operas are much shorter than normal operas at around 10-15 minutes each. The cast for each opera is made up of three singers accompanied by violin and cello. I've always had a passion for opera and I know that it can sometimes appear daunting, but we're hoping that these new operas will help change the perspectives of the next generation of opera-goers."

Joe says, "I’ve composed four short operas over the past few years, including The Maiden Stone which was performed on the slopes of Bennachie in Aberdeenshire and which involved schoolchildren from 5 local primary schools.  I met Ruth when we were working on the Encouraging New Opera project run by Aberdeen University and Scottish Opera and I am looking forward to working with her again on these operas! It's really important that young people get access to something as powerful as opera so creating these short pieces will hopefully be a way into it for people who wouldn't normally go to hear one."

Please help our cause of you are able to and please also share this project with others who you think might be interested. Your support is very much appreciated!

Thanks!

Ruth and Joe - Flatpack Opera

story:
I am a rock singer and songwriter from Deep River, Canada. I’m the first Canadian-born generation to immigrant parents from Trinidad & Tobago (#jumpup), with ancestral roots originating in India (#zen).

My musical style is best described as a unique marriage of symphonic rock with the melodies and instruments of the east weaved. Imagine heavy guitars, soaring orchestras, killer drums all balanced with the delicate instruments of India such as sitar, sarangi, tabla and santoor. These instruments aren’t just an accent or a hook, they inform the song from the moment I first put pen to paper and often, the rock elements are built around the Indian ones. On my last record “Samsara”, I had twelve (!) musicians directly contribute to my project and true to form, this new EP will have a similar scale.

It’s been two years since the release of “Samsara” and I’m hungry again to return to the studio. Featuring all, new, original material, this EP will be the fourth major project I’ve released since 2009 (never mind the few singles and collaborations that exist out there on the interweb). This time around, the legendary Joost Van Den Broek is sitting in the producer’s chair and I’ve got a team of amazing collaborators around the world ready to help breathe life into this project.

 

“Rani Chatoorgoon is unknown to me but what a discovery I have just made. Her voice is beautiful sometimes it’s like an angel sings and it goes well with the musical style.” ~ Louis Hamel (full review here)

Since 2009 I’ve been releasing music independently, traveling and living around the world to better refine my sound. I’ve been influenced by a wide range of artists including Within Temptation, Evanescence, Sarah McLachlan, Loreena McKennit, The Cranberries and A.R. Rahman.

I always try to tell a story through my music. A story rooted in the truths as I’ve come to know them. Whether that story is one I’ve experienced or one I’ve observed, I write about people, their light and dark sides, about events in this world and their consequences so that collectively, my songs become a diary of the life I’ve led. My last record was warmly embraced by critics around the world who opened their minds to an unfamiliar style and credited the scale of the production and uniqueness of the music (read more reviews here).

Check out some of my music videos.

               
 

 

Funding productions on this scale is challenging and as a solo, unsigned artist, that challenge falls solely to me. But if you’re still reading this, then now’s the time to explain how your support of this project will be invested.

Here's how the budget breaks down:

Stretch Goal:

If the campaign reaches the stretch goal of $15,000, I will be investing the incremental $3,000 in producing a professional music video for the lead single.

 

There are a variety of perks and rewards available as an exclusive thank you for supporting my project – perks I hope will sweeten the appeal.

THE EP!

Of course the music is the point of it all, so naturally, this is included in the perks, in both digital and physical formats.

TSHIRTS!

Everyone loves a nice t-shirt and I’ve got one up for grabs in an exclusive perk, available only through this campaign. Designed and drawn by moi, snag it in your size and style!

UNIQUE DRAWINGS!

This was a very popular perk the last time I crowdfunded. Secure this perk for a one-of-a-kind art piece, similar to the ones below, hand-drawn by me.

LIVE WEB PERFORMANCE

You, me, a little chai, a little chat and an acoustic sing a-long, thanks to technology. Skype, Facetime, iMessenger – grab this perk and let’s meet ‘face to face’.

Explore the full list of perks available on the right side of this campaign page.

 

Every dollar counts. For everyone. I know you’ve got priorities to manage in your own life, so if you’re unable to contribute to the campaign financially, your help would be most valued in the following ways:

SHARE this campaign via the indiegogo tools to spread the word to as many people as possible, all around the world!

TALK about this project with your parents, your grandparents, your siblings, your kids, the annoying office co-worker, the cool office co-worker, your dentist, your doctor, your neighbour, your flatmate – tell the person you’ve been flirting with on the subway every day.

JOIN my global community on Facebook and Instagram for updates and previews!

It’s a cliché because it’s true but sharing IS caring (#kindergartenlifelessons).

story:
We are The Village Bicycle, a feminist psych rock band from Cleveland, Ohio. Because we are brave and hardy warriors, we are putting our lives in a van for two weeks, inside which we will travel to exotic locales outside of Cleveland to do our favorite things: bring people together and make noise in anticipation of our new album Terraforma, to be released in early 2018, We're happy to have partnered with Sony's The Orchard, who will make the album available to stream digitally before it's officially released.

If you are interested in being a part of our story by donating to our tour fund, your contribution will help us with important expenses such as: a trailer rental and trailer hitch, gas for the van, food and sundries, vehicle repair, and any emergency expenses that arise while on the road such as lodging and instrument repair. 

What We Need & What You Get

When we break down the expenses, it looks approximately like this:

Trailer hitch and trailer rental: $500

Gas (mpg 19 city/28 highway): $300

Tolls: $50

Food, sundries, misc: $560 ($10 per person per day)

That brings us to $1,410, which, if we reach our $2000 goal, leaves $590 for unplanned expenses and emergencies. We will be putting our show earnings directly into the above categories as well. Should there be money leftover, every cent will be invested directly back into the band in the form of merchandise, which will be distributed to you as a thankyougoddessblessyou for your donation. 

Impact

This unique opportunity to go into the world and sing about what we're passionate about and yell about what we're pissed about was borne of a lot of time and hard work and dedication - not for money or fame, but for love.  The artists of the world show us the center of balance between the tips of our noses and the looming gray nothing, and our hope is to contribute to this human effort of reminding people that we're alive. It's being said a lot these days, but we as a society need art and music and color now more than ever. 

Risks & Challenges

The Village Bicycle leaves for tour on November 8th, so time is of the essence! This indiegogo will be up for 44 days before we hit the road, so if you choose to donate, please do so at your earliest convenience. We understand the financial struggle, and appreciate any amount you choose to contribute, large or small or none at all. 

We have an awesome list of stuff to give to you at every donation level, and we'll be sending all the prize packages (including the new album!) to production as soon as we get back from traveling. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you enjoy the music of The Village Bicycle or enjoy us as people (or even both!) please let your friends know that we're coming to their city. We want to meet all the people, we're very friendly and enjoy good company and good beer. We will be posting tour dates on this page, as well as our Facebook page, so stay tuned for updates. 

We - Liz, Devin, Karah and Ty of The Village Bicycle - thank you from the bottoms of our hearts for taking the time to read this, and for your love and support. As you stare into the gaping mouth of the void, contemplating the eternal Human quest for meaning, remember that there is no beginning and no end. The sun comes up every day, as far as I can see.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About IMUNURI

We're a collection of musicians based in Brooklyn, NY and Bloomington, IN. We began as strangers, each desperate for a new music project, who found each other on Craigslist. But we soon became close friends and have now been making music together for over two and a half years, even despite job relocations! We call our music “eclectic rock” because it’s sort of a smorgasbord of different genres from rock, to funk, to reggae, with a smattering of social angst. We released our debut EP, Euphoric State, in March of 2016, and thanks to the continued support of our friends, family, and fans, we are now finally ready to release our first full-length album – Elephant Shaped Trees.

 

About Elephant Shaped Trees

We've been hard at work on this album for over a year and a half, in three different states, at five different recording studios, and with the help of eight guest musicians! The project began when we were invited to come record at Karl Latham’s Firefly Recording Studio in upstate New York. We recorded a bunch of songs in one day just for fun, mostly with just one or two takes.

But when we opened the sessions months later, we discovered that we had the skeleton of what could become our first full-length album! So, from Brooklyn to Bloomington, we spent a whole year adding more layers: vocals, strings, horns, flute, organ, grand piano, synths, more guitars, percussion, etc.

Next, we journeyed to Nashville to team up with mixing engineer Brett Ryan Stewart at The Sound Shelter who helped make it nice and shiny.

Then it was back to New York to have the record mastered at Turtletone Records, and finally, Elephant Shaped Trees was born! We are so happy with how this record turned out – it’s definitely the best music that all of us have ever made – and we can’t wait to share it with you!

So, now we are asking for your help in order to do just that! The money raised in this campaign will go towards paying for all the guest musicians we hired, the mixing and mastering costs, CD-production costs, and promotion for the record. And we have a variety of special perks that you can get with your contributions, including a pre-ordered copy of the record, exclusive bonus tracks, limited edition lyric sheets and posters of the album art, a birthday serenade, and even a cover song of your choice! For example, we made this reggae-disco cover of "Sweet Dreams" by the Eurythmics for a contributor to our last crowd-funding campaign for our debut EP:

We hope that you’ll take a look at our perks and find one that suits you! We're extremely thankful and appreciative for any contribution that you can make to this project. Without you, we would not be able to do what we love more than anything in the world, and for that we are eternally grateful!

We also hope to see you on Saturday, February 3, 2018 when we headline The Knitting Factory in Brooklyn for the album release party!  Get Tickets

And now we'll leave you with our first official video for the single "Are You Listening?" off the new album:

The project began when we were invited to come record at Karl Latham’s Firefly Recording Studio in upstate New York. We recorded a bunch of songs in one day just for fun, mostly with just one or two takes.But when we opened the sessions months later, we discovered that we had the skeleton of what could become our first full-length album! So, from Brooklyn to Bloomington, we spent a whole year adding more layers: vocals, strings, horns, flute, organ, grand piano, synths, more guitars, percussion, etc.Next, we journeyed to Nashville to team up with mixing engineer Brett Ryan Stewart at The Sound Shelter who helped make it nice and shiny.Then it was back to New York to have the record mastered at Turtletone Records, and finally, Elephant Shaped Trees was born! We are so happy with how this record turned out – it’s definitely the best music that all of us have ever made – and we can’t wait to share it with you!So, now we are asking for your help in order to do just that! The money raised in this campaign will go towards paying for all the guest musicians we hired, the mixing and mastering costs, CD-production costs, and promotion for the record. And we have a variety of special perks that you can get with your contributions, including a pre-ordered copy of the record, exclusive bonus tracks, limited edition lyric sheets and posters of the album art, a birthday serenade, and even a cover song of your choice! For example, we made this reggae-disco cover of "Sweet Dreams" by the Eurythmics for a contributor to our last crowd-funding campaign for our debut EP:We hope that you’ll take a look at our perks and find one that suits you! We're extremely thankful and appreciative for any contribution that you can make to this project. Without you, we would not be able to do what we love more than anything in the world, and for that we are eternally grateful!We also hope to see you on Saturday, February 3, 2018 when we headline The Knitting Factory in Brooklyn for the album release party!  Get TicketsAnd now we'll leave you with our first official video for the single "Are You Listening?" off the new album:

story:
32 contemporary piano pieces…

were composed by 32 composers as a birthday gift for their colleague Daniel Matej from Slovakia. We recorded them on the new CD and we called it Fifty. If you want to hear how contemporary music sounds like today around the world, this is a good choice. 

We are keen to do this project, because we all know Daniel Matej personally. He is our teacher, our friend and a precious colleague. And he is an extraordinary composer and musician as well. 

For all his life, he's been promoting the new music, mainly the music of other composers and thus contributing to the musical life of our country. He educated dozens of young composers, professional musicians and music teachers. It is difficult for us to express our gratitude in words. 

Authors and compositions

Daniel Matej: (When I’m) FIFTY for piano (Lullaby) / Louis Andriessen: Two way ticket / Hauke Harder: 9/3/19/63 / Milan Adamčiak: Sonatura / Boris Lenko: take off / Andrea Beier Lenko: Simplicity / Balázs Horváth: 482 or 483 notes for your 50th birthday – Don’t ask, why! / Marián Lejava: blank page/hidden soul / Peter Graham: One Page / Elliott Sharp: And many more / Tomáš Boroš: Pre Daniela / David Dramm: Pavane / Egidija Medekšaitė: for Daniel Matej / Christopher Fox: Daniel’s Fifty / Boudewijn Buckinx: For Daniel Matej: for 50 and many more / Chris Newman: 5 – C / Peter Machajdík: Fifty seconds for Daniel / Owen Underhill: Bagatelle / Jon Rose: Happy Birthday Daniel / Clarence Barlow: song of danieL / Robert Kolář: In the Midst of Life… / Juraj Vajó: Part III. Theme / Frédéric Iñigo: Bon anniversaire, Daniel / Philip Corner: Homo Ignorans / Martin Burlas: Valčík úľavy venovaný Danielovi Matejovi / Michael Blake: The hymns of Ntsikana Gaba into 50 seconds / Fero Király: Deus ex Machina / Ivan Šiller: for Daniel / Piet-Jan van Rossum: Z Hlávkova mostu / Daniel Matej: FRAGILE

We need some help, but you'll have some great music

To release Fifty we need to raise at least 3.000 Euros. This goes for:

  • copyright fees
  • fundraising
  • release costs
  • sheet music publishing 

For just a couple of bugs you can have excellent collection of contemporary piano music.

What happens when you contribute?

Remember, if you buy your copy of Fifty or contribute to the release, you're supporting a young composer at the outset of his / her professional life who will receive a commission to compose a new piece as a kick-starter of his career.

What if you can't buy or contribute to Fifty?

Share it! E-mail it to your friends, your music teacher or your cousin who plays piano. Or just have a look at our projects at www.in-music.sk.

We are full of thanks.

Guys from InMusic, Slovakia.

 

Cover photo: Ľubomír Baran

story:
Daniellehicks.com

About Us

I entered my first singing competition when I was 7 years old. It was the Young Talent Contest at Georgia’s Big Pig Jig, which stands proud as the oldest barbecue cooking contest in Georgia. The category was ages 5-15 and I was the youngest contestant. My toughest competitor was a 15 year old girl, wearing black spandex, singing Madonna’s “Like A Virgin”. I remember, looking down at my old-fashioned, grandma-made, floral dress, with puffed sleeves, and thinking: this is not fair….

That day my father’s band, Mood Doc, took home the Battle of the Bands prize, and I won 1st place! I suppose the judges of a southern BBQ cook-off may have been more warmed by Peggy Lee than Madonna.

My reason for sharing this early memory is this:

I have been singing for as long as I remember wanting to do anything. At 17, I turned down a full scholarship to UGA and moved to Manhattan to study acting, singing, and dancing at AMDA. Right out of college I linked up with a band of pro players and began performing regularly around the city. I honed in my sound while performing with players such as guitarist, Gus Fafalios (Deep Purple, Alice Cooper), Keith Christopher (Georgia Satellites, Kenny Wayne Shepherd) on bass, and drummer Aaron A. Brooks (Moby’s Little Death, Lana Del Ray).

After a decade of living in the concrete jungle, I relocated to Savannah, GA and began networking to find musicians for a new group. Thus began The Resistance! I have been blessed with tons of love and work in this region. Speaking of blessings, these are the wonderfully talented men that form The Resistance:

Ben Keiser - Guitar

Ryan Kelly - Bass

Ira Miller / Matt Fallin - Drums

Honey is a dream come true for me. Before working with Jim Scott, I spent a lot of money recording at another studio, but I was never quite satisfied with the quality of the production. Now, I have a record that I am truly proud of, and that is priceless to me.

“Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.”-Robert Green Ingersoll

Setting Goals: Risks & Challenges

Setting goals is an important aspect of a productive life. My goal of $20k is crucial for my success at this point. The goal is not the total of what was spent on the project. My fiancé and I spent an overwhelming amount for two independent artists. This is simply what we need to recover in order to complete the production of the record and pay on the credit card(s) we maxed out during the process. It feels reminiscent of jumping off a cliff, but we view this album as an investment in the future. Now that Honey is done, the work has just begun to get it out there and I need your help!

“To get profit without risk, experience without danger, and reward without work, is as impossible as it is to live without being born.” -A.P. Gouthey

Your Impact

There is no reward in life without risk, but I have the advantage of having YOU in my corner! When you purchase Honey, and any of the available Perks, you will be directly influencing my career. Every album sold is one step closer to:

  • Playing at my favorite festival, Wanee, and other music festivals across the country
  • Being interviewed by my favorite music Podcasts (Song Exploder, All Songs Considered, Sodajerker On Songwriting)
  • Being recognized by Music Publications
  • Online Publications on New Albums
  • Radio Play
  • Being listed on Album Charts

For me to make these goals happen, I need to sell a whole LOT of albums, and that takes a whole lot of wonderful, receptive people!!  

Your backing will help to cover these expenses:

  • 10 Days of Studio Time At Plyrz
  • World Class Session Musicians
  • Production by Jim Scott
  • Airfare to & from LA
  • Airbnb in LA
  • Mastering by Richard Dodd
  • CD & Vinyl Production
  • Marketing Expenses

The only thing left to finish is the album artwork. As soon as that's done the digital album download will be sent to those who purchase the perk and the physical products will follow. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help me get the word out about the campaign. Every Share opens up new, precious opportunities, and that is a Huge help!
  • Download the Free Single and play it for your friends! I'd be honored, and grateful, if you like 'Something New' share it with all your peeps! (Visit daniellehicks.com)

Album Credits

Producer & Mixing:

~ Jim Scott (Red Hot Chili Peppers, Dixie Chicks, Tom Petty, Styx)

Engineer:

~ Kevin Dean (Sunset Records, Plyrz Studio)

Guitar:

~ Neal Casal (Chris Robinson Brotherhood, Hardworking Americans, Ryan Adams)

~ Ben Keiser (Danielle Hicks and The Resistance, BKB Band)

Bass:

~ Jesse Ingalls (Ben Harper, Charlie Musselwhite, Taj Mahal)

Drums:

~ Jimmy Paxson (Stevie Nicks, The Dixie Chicks, Beyoncé, Sheryl Crow)

~ Alan Hertz (Garaj Mahal, Eric McFadden)

Keys:

~ John Ginty (Allman Brothers, Widespread Panic, Santana, Dixie Chicks)

~ Chris Joyner (Heart, Amos Lee)

Mastering Engineer:

~ Richard Dodd (Robert Plant, Delbert McClinton, Green Day, Tom Petty)

Please let us know if you have any question about the perks.

Thank y'all so much!!

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Alex, I’m from Milan - Italy -  and I’m an independent electro pop singer and songwriter. I ‘ve start dancing when I was 6 and at 15 I’ve start to record my first songs. Thanks to internet activity and youtube videos, I’ve took part in some tv shows and reality shows that help my music to grow up. However, I refuse contract with big labels  and try to do everything by myself. It’s really hard to do it, but I just wanna express my self as better  and be honest with people who choose to follow me and my music ! I’ve made many videoclips, many tour around Italy and from two year I’m touring around Europe (live in London , Copenhagen, Duisseldorf, Munich, Barcelona, Warsaw, Wien expecially in LGBT pride events).

 In 2015 , after few singles, I’ve realize my first studio album “Uncensored”.  In this LP I’ve work with many different people all over the Europe, Like Jandy Prudnikov (Ukraine), Tim Bergholm  (Sweeden) and italian producer  like Luca Sala. They helped me to make beats and arrangement for my own songs, I’ve wrote the lyrics (it’s so important to me write about what I live and what goes around in my life) and the album came alive.

You can search my name on Google and see how music takes  100% of my life. I plan  everything  by myself, every tour I made, every show I create, every videoclip or interview/tv show. I take also care about social media, website, and any kind of promotion. Tenacy and determination helped me to go on, without any manager or press agency. Just picking up the phone and finding  ways to promote my songs. Now I think it’s time to ask for a helping hand: I’m going to release my second studio album and I would like to grow up and take my music to an higher level and spread this new songs  around, more than what I’ve done until now. But this won’t be possible without your help… so let’s do it together !

My Campaign

I’ve plane a crowdfunding for the first time because I’m going to release my second studio album, there are many expenses to afford and I really need your help. This will be not just my new album, but OUR album and we can make it together! I would like to release the first preview single in October, related videoclip in November and , thanks to your important contribute, all the entire album in January 2018. It will be a fresh electro pop album , with some ballads and some up tempo hits! Many people are working on the project, from many different countries from Sweden to Ucraine and, of couse Italy. To create an album of songs of high quality, studio time costs add up quickly. This campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:

Pre production : all songs are written by me, but I have to make arrangement and this task is expensive. Quality usually cost, but with your help I can bring many composer from many different countries and put together many different ideas and sounds.

Recording session/mixing and mastering: here is where all my lyrics and music become one thing and songs comes alive. Recording session and mastering ask for a sound engineer and for many hour of work.

Videoclip productions: it’s one of the most important part of production. The videoclip is the image, the face of the single and it give you the possibility to reach more people than ever. My videoclips usually ask for many people including staff, technicians, dancers and director. And of course a Location where to record it. The result will be an HQ video inspired to the biggest popstars!

Promotion costs: Sometimes you can do the best album ever, but without a good advertising campaign , it will not be listened to people. This Crowdfunding will help me to reach a  lot’s of new fans all over the world and make Our project knowed everywhere !

Some special gifts for you!

I am so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign, from the smaller to the biggest one! Every donation will be important to me. In exchange for your generosity, I've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

So take a look at the full list to the right!

Other Ways You Can Help

If You think You won't be able to help me with this Campaign, don't worry! I'm so happy You read about my story and my project, and I hope You would like to start follow me from this moment!

Down below  some links to don't lose any news!

www.alexpalmieriofficial.com

My social:

www.facebook.com/alex.palmieridue/

www.instagram.com/alexpalmieriofficial

Spotify

Before You go! :) 

 if you think my project it's good and my determination should have to be rewarded, please send this page to every friends, parents, lovers, social contact, whatsapp group, ...everywhere you can! 

Help me to spread the voice around!
