story:
Our Story

Hi! I am Mayteana Morales and with David Bailis, we are Walk Talk. Creating music is one of the best feelings we know. It's up there with being in love. It's both exhilarating and frustrating but unbelievably rewarding. You can have a blank canvas and throw all kinds of colors on it and there are so many rules to be broken!

I have been a performer alI my life. From my beginnings as a child actor in a series called Ghostwriter on PBS to performing all over the world as a singer/percussionist with the Pimps of Joytime.

After touring for years supporting other musicians' visions, I'm ready to share some new sounds that me and my buddy, David Bailis, have concocted! He is an incredible guitar and bass player and writer/arranger, if ya don't know! He's also one of the most driven, disciplined, positive people I know. After meeting in 2007 at the amazing scene of Rose Live music in Brooklyn, Dave and I started playing together in the Pimps of Joytime (PJT). Performing together with the PJT and countless other projects that we’ve been a part of has given us the opportunity to build our musical foundation and trust.

Earlier this year that I finally got up the nerve to share some demos with Dave. We worked hard to build those demos into more developed songs and when we began performing this music live, the connection we made with the audience was inspiring. That led us to start this original music project, Walk Talk.

Your support will help us make the album that we know we can deliver. We are blessed to have such a great community around us and we need your help to make this a successful record and also a full-on love crusade! Music heals. It uplifts us in dark times and emphasizes the good moments. Join us as we launch our mission!  <3 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $27,750. Here is the full breakdown of where the money is going:

Target 1

 $3,600 - STUDIO TIME - We will be recording at Vibromonk studios in Bushwick. http://www.vibromonk.com/ We’ve budgeted for 3 days. It is $1200/day.

 $3,350 - POST-PRODUCTION - This will cover both Mixing and Mastering

 $2,500 - MUSICIANS - These will be approximately 8 hour days.

 $2,000 - VINYL PRESSING - 500 copies

 $2,000 - MERCHANDISE - T-shirts, stickers, buttons, shakers, lyric booklets, posters, tote bags and postcards.

 $1,250 - ORIGINAL ARTWORK - Album, poster and postcard artwork, website design, logo for branding and all merchandise.

 $1,000 - CD PRINTING - 1,000 copies

 $800 - HORNS

 $750 - SHIPPING COSTS FOR PERKS

 $500 - GUEST MUSICIANS

Target 2

 $5,000 - PROMOTION - A publicist will be hired to get the album out to as many platforms as possible.

 $5,000 - VISUAL CONTENT - Video and Photo shoots

TOTAL = $27,750

 

And perks?!

Who doesn't love em! There are personal touches to the perks and if you've wanted to pick up an instrument you can get a customized Walk Talk egg shaker. We highly encourage you to take up rhythm. It really ties the song together.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help out financially at this time, that's totally ok! We love you for even reading this far!! If you have a moment, please share on your social media platforms by using the Indiegogo share links (located at the top of this page, just below our goal ). They make it super easy to link this page to yours. And voilà! You will have helped us out a great deal!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story and for helping us. We really appreciate it and we love you! :)))) xoxoxo

Walk Talk
story_txt:
Our Story
Hi! I am Mayteana Morales and with David Bailis, we are Walk Talk. Creating music is one of the best feelings we know. It's up there with being in love. It's both exhilarating and frustrating but unbelievably rewarding. You can have a blank canvas and throw all kinds of colors on it and there are so many rules to be broken!
I have been a performer alI my life. From my beginnings as a child actor in a series called Ghostwriter on PBS to performing all over the world as a singer/percussionist with the Pimps of Joytime.
After touring for years supporting other musicians' visions, I'm ready to share some new sounds that me and my buddy, David Bailis, have concocted! He is an incredible guitar and bass player and writer/arranger, if ya don't know! He's also one of the most driven, disciplined, positive people I know. After meeting in 2007 at the amazing scene of Rose Live music in Brooklyn, Dave and I started playing together in the Pimps of Joytime (PJT). Performing together with the PJT and countless other projects that we’ve been a part of has given us the opportunity to build our musical foundation and trust.
Earlier this year that I finally got up the nerve to share some demos with Dave. We worked hard to build those demos into more developed songs and when we began performing this music live, the connection we made with the audience was inspiring. That led us to start this original music project, Walk Talk.
Your support will help us make the album that we know we can deliver. We are blessed to have such a great community around us and we need your help to make this a successful record and also a full-on love crusade! Music heals. It uplifts us in dark times and emphasizes the good moments. Join us as we launch our mission!  <3 
 
What We Need & What You Get
We are asking for $27,750. Here is the full breakdown of where the money is going:

Target 1
 $3,600 - STUDIO TIME - We will be recording at Vibromonk studios in Bushwick. http://www.vibromonk.com/ We’ve budgeted for 3 days. It is $1200/day.
 $3,350 - POST-PRODUCTION - This will cover both Mixing and Mastering
 $2,500 - MUSICIANS - These will be approximately 8 hour days.
 $2,000 - VINYL PRESSING - 500 copies
 $2,000 - MERCHANDISE - T-shirts, stickers, buttons, shakers, lyric booklets, posters, tote bags and postcards.
 $1,250 - ORIGINAL ARTWORK - Album, poster and postcard artwork, website design, logo for branding and all merchandise.
 $1,000 - CD PRINTING - 1,000 copies
 $800 - HORNS
 $750 - SHIPPING COSTS FOR PERKS
 $500 - GUEST MUSICIANS
Target 2
 $5,000 - PROMOTION - A publicist will be hired to get the album out to as many platforms as possible.
 $5,000 - VISUAL CONTENT - Video and Photo shoots
TOTAL = $27,750
 
And perks?!
Who doesn't love em! There are personal touches to the perks and if you've wanted to pick up an instrument you can get a customized Walk Talk egg shaker. We highly encourage you to take up rhythm. It really ties the song together.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help out financially at this time, that's totally ok! We love you for even reading this far!! If you have a moment, please share on your social media platforms by using the Indiegogo share links (located at the top of this page, just below our goal ). They make it super easy to link this page to yours. And voilà! You will have helped us out a great deal!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story and for helping us. We really appreciate it and we love you! :)))) xoxoxo
Walk Talk

story:
Who Is The Trash Family?
 



Trash Family is a record label and a multidisciplinary production team based in Montreal. The organization bring together several partners and artists having the same goal: Ensure the development of the ‘Trash’ music scene by promoting contents locally and internationally. The company consists of three divisions: event planning, record label and artist agency. The platform is completed with our website and blog to spread the culture.

The family is always growing up! From artists to promoters, from partners to fan, everybody can get involved in the Trash Culture. We are a self sufficient organization constantly moving forward. Today, we can count with us 6 local DJs and 5 music producers around the world plus the direction and promoters. Meeting people from around the globe with Internet is so much easier and that's why we think this indiegogo campaign can help us more! 

Why Do We Need Your Help
 

Since we are an independent company, our main sources of income are the events we plan or collaborate in, our merchandise and people like you encouraging us. Even the smallest amount can help us reach our goal! This campaign will help us developing our website/blog, bringing family's artists and partners from around the world, developing the artists’ universe (videoclips, graphics, management) and organizing our 2017 Summer Tour! This is why we are asking you to help us reach our 5000$ objective! We’ve carefully created our perks and included some exclusive material that will only be available through this campaign.

 

A Bit Of History
 

Trash Family has already made its place over Canadian East Coast and its artists played at festivals like Just for Laugh, Igloofest, Piknic Electronic, Valhalla and Future Forest. They gathers local and international talents that are specialized in their own style. Many of them have won remix contests, Djing competitions and perform live acts that are known worldwide. Some artists are involved in the local underground music scene by contributing in events, raves, bars, school parties and even house parties. We were able to include several pioneer artists as guests in our events such as REZZ, Attlas, Kill The Noize, Zeds Dead, SBCR (Bloody Beetroots), Feed Me, Eptic, Skism, Must Die, Figure, Botnek, Torro Torro, Cyberpunkers, Designer Drugs and more. Working with artists from France, Italia, Austria and the US, our vision of expanding the Family internationally has come to a reality. Our 8 producers are now working under the Trash Family label with people around the world to keep the culture alive, discover new artists and make them join the Family. Don’t forget to take a look at our social media pages where you can find fresh sounds from our record label.
 

Making a difference
 

By helping us, you also encourage diversity in the music culture. The electronic music scene is always expanding and that's why the Electro-Trash culture deserves a place and a platform in this world. This project was only a dream 3 years ago and now it has become a reality that you can support. Looking back at the past years is a reminder of all the success we've had and the expansion still ahead of us. This trustworthy Family can guide you through the Electro-Trash music scene with the experience acquired. Everyone who joined our team has brought a new perspective to the project and that's why we believe that you can help us reach the next step. We want you to be part of our future projects!

 



Perks And Timeline

 

Visit the Perks section for all details about our offers! Exclusive content from the Trash Family and from our partners Earpeace, Nationhats, MTL Affichage and more! Get a sweet gift for your trash friend or represent the family around your community. Electro will never die!



 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help the family in many other ways!

  • Join the team by sending us a message at booking@trashfamily.com
  • Share the artists content and download the music
  • Join the newsletter
  • Reach us on our social medias and invite your friends to the campaign

www.trashfamily.com

Thanks to our partners Nationhats, Montreal Affichage and Earpeace! Special mention to MANNY and Xavier MC! Big love.

story:
IBIZA *Waves of Love*

My name is Ilona Pantel-Ayal and I have had the pleasure and good fortune to live on the beautiful island of Ibiza for over 30 years.

I am thankful every day for this island, which so many of you know so well, where magic lives in the Mediterranean breeze and among the almond and carob trees, where peacefulness spreads through the forests and fields, and where gentle waves and beautiful waters hold beautiful souls in a loving embrace inviting us to relax, breathe and just simply be.

My lifetime love affair with all kinds of music and the island recently inspired a vision to create a compilation of original music by Ibiza’s dear family circle shaped by our years of light work.

The project is underway and I am inviting you to bring this Ibiza magic into existence, into your life and to help us all complete the project with your funding.
Let's make magic together!!

At the same time you will be directly supporting a good cause on the island with all the proceedings of the album sales ( once the costs have been covered) going to the Ibiza Preservation Fund (which funds local ecological and sustainable projects).

You will support this following project here on Ibiza: http://www.losalmendrosdeibiza.com/espanol/#hom... ; the information about this project is available in various languages with this link.


You can help manifest a dream and capture the essence of the beauty this island has nurtured for so many years. And in doing so, spread peacefulness, harmony, joy, hope, gratitude, laughter, reflectiveness and Ibiza’s unique alegria.

Sending many waves of love to all of you ¡

Much light Ilona

FUNDING AND REALISATION
 To realise this dream requires 16,000 Euros. The money will pay for:
·       recordings and musical production (Duncan Bridgeman)
·       the mastering of the CD
·       graphic design (Manola Garcia

.      pictures and images Morten Keller
·      videos (Danny Barak and Duncan Bridgeman)
·      production of the CD done by Sarbide Music


MUSICIANS AND PLAYERS 
We are so privileged to be compiling the intentions, music and beauty from so many incredible local musicans.

GRATITUDE AND DREAMS
I am so thankful for all the inspired beautiful people who have come to Ibiza and carried its magic in their hearts and voices, and in doing so inspired this album. I am sincerely grateful to all the individuals directly involved with its creation. And of course to my husband Arik and sons Josh and Marlon for creating the space to allow this musical flower to blossom.

I now invite us all to come together and make this dream a reality! Please contribute financially, share to your friends, sing from your heart and spread the word and the love!!!

Feel free to contact me with any information or questions regarding the campaign :

ilonanana@icloud.com

story:
Summary

Hey! Wes here. I'd like to introduce you to my crew - Suit Up, Soldier - and give you the scoop on the cause.  Ever since I picked up that old, beat-up, acoustic guitar at the age of 17, I have longed to release a full-length record.  I have let the opportunity slip by time and time again.  Band after band, we would draw the crowds and eventually move on to other life endeavors.  I'm coming up on 28 and I've grown anxious of watching people much younger than me live their dreams.  I decided I could sit on the sidelines no longer.  My wife patiently stood by me this year as I battled between a high-paying job offer and the chance to pursue music.  Can you guess what she told me?  That's right, "I think you should do music".   Since then, she's taken up a second job to support us while still doing school full-time.  Yeah, she's the best.

That brings us to Suit Up, Soldier. Some of us are college students; some are newly married and starting families of our own. Our beginnings are humble, but music is the path we've chosen and what kind of path would that be if we couldn't share it with others? We created this campaign so you could follow us every step and become a pioneer in the process. 

SUS played it's first full show back Nov. 2014.  I was auditioning for the Commercial Music Program at BYU and had written enough songs to perform a set with a band.  Old and new friends hopped on board and a collaborative effort was born.  It began as a hobby among 4 college students, but we slowly recruited Parker (guitar) and Josh (keys/synth) who became more long-term members.  Fresh commitment has driven us to finally live the childhood dream of recording a full-length album.

We’re at a point now where a professional album is the next step in advancing our musical careers. Recorded music gives us huge networking potential. It puts our music in a format that’s easier to share with others. It gives us credibility as professional musicians.

The problem, of course, is the cost. A typical, professionally produced album can cost tens of thousands of dollars. We have plenty of production ability ourselves but we just need a real studio to record some of the more acoustically complex instruments like drums.

There’s this thing we need to tell you. We’ve already booked the studio time.  This is happening, whether we reach our funding goal or not. So the real question to ask yourself is, are you going to join us on our incredible journey, to the ends of the earth, to the farthest horizons of the *galaxy and back?

*Note: space travel not guaranteed

What we need and what you get

Our goal is to raise at least $4,000.  We’ve booked June Audio for 24+ hours of studio time at $95 an hour. We estimate will cost about $2,300. This does not include any editing for the music, mastering, videography, additional recording, publishing fees, etc.  We will do our very best to budget our time and money.  The rest will go towards product/merchandise costs for perks, and Indiegogo’s fees.

If we don’t hit our goal, we’ll have to find alternatives for gathering the rest of funds . This is why we're doing a "flexible funding campaign" rather than "fixed funding."  That way you get your perk no matter what!

We have a lot of stellar perks in return for your contributions.  For more details, check out the individual perk descriptions.

Risks and challenges

The obvious risk is if we don’t meet our goal, this will come out of the pockets of starving musicians.  As mentioned earlier, we’re doing a flexible funding campaign, which means there’s no risk to our backers. That’s how passionate we are. If we can’t come up with the money through Indiegogo, we’ll still find a way...probably bussing tables, ya know, something ethical. It’s the decision every artist has to make – choosing art over guaranteed income.

Other ways you can help

There’s more you can do than just donate; please SHARE our campaign with others. Like our page on Facebook, follow us on Instagram, share our music with your friends and family. Any help you offer will be recorded in our diaries, just one small gesture to show how much we appreciate you.

Band members

Wesley: front man and lead singer, Wes manages and directs the band.

Parker: kills us with his beautiful, electric guitar solos.

Josh: plays keys and synthesizer, and backs up Wes on the vocals.

Frequently Asked Questions

How will I receive the download for the single?

You will receive a personalized email from us with the MP3 attached. Indiegogo provides us with the email address associated with your Facebook account or whatever account you used to login. If you would like it sent to a different email, shoot us an email at SuitUpSoldier@gmail.com.

story:
My Background

Hello,

The name's Timothy Ferguson. My story began in the small town of Nashville, Ga. I'm the son of a pastor, musician, and teaching father, and a loving teaching mother. Music has been apart of my life sense I can remember. At the age of three a started playing drums and eventually would pick up saxophone and piano. My love for creating music would progress into something major. My father instilled in me a love for God and for humanity, and the belief that I can do anything I set my mind too. I want to share the gifts that God gave and my father cultivated with the world.

This project means a great deal because it's music that represents my life. It represents my thoughts expressed through music, my passion, my pain, my personality, my creativity, and my goals. It's also a springboard into mentorship and further creative endeavors. These endeavors include public speaking, the creation of a production company called HOA, and an arts school that tailors curriculum to the student and cultivates creativity, morality, and spirituality. 

.No goal is out of reach. especially when done in the context of community. This is why I need your help. To reach a goal that will span the lifetimes of our children's children and beyond. My goals are lofty but God given. That being said I know that it will happen. We're stronger together and I need your help.

So far I've established my self as a saxophonist and am at the threshold of finishing my B.A. degree in music. I've played with Grammy winning artist and opened for big names in the blues(Bobby Rush) and R&B(Betty Wright) world.  I've decided that it is time to take my career to a different level. I've gained knowledge from some of the industries top producers and musicians as-well-as top tier sound engineers. They believe in what I'm doing and support my music.  

What We Need

The Goal is to raise $5000. 

What the $5000 is for.

  • Studio Time
    • $750.00 per day for three days: $2,250
  • Mixing and Mastering
    • $900.00 for 10 tracks
  • Room and Board for Band
    • $210.00 for 3 rooms
    • $500 for band provisions
      • $100 per person for 5 people
  • Band Transportation for Equipment and Members
    • $398.00 for three days
  • Copyright Application
    • $35.00
  • CD Manufacturing
    • 472.71 for 100 CDs
    • Includes Album Art, Bio, and Online Distribution
  • Flyers and Posters
    • $100 for 50 professionally printed flyers and posters
  • Video recording for promoting the album and band to venues, and possible sponsors
  • $400 for 2hrs

The Risk

There are risks involved with every investment. Music is a high risk occupation that requires constant upkeep. The major risks and solutions are:

  1. Album Sales:
    1. Make a reasonable amount of albums and push the product.
    2. Good products sale themselves
      1. My product will be quality which insures that the listener will buy my product.
    3. Gig:
      1. This is a big part of selling merchandise. It's one of the best ways to build a following and make a profit off album sales.
    4. Word of Mouth:
      1. A huge part of gathering and creating a fan base of people who will like and buy our music is hitting the scene and spreading the word. This goes hand in hand with Gigging.
  2. Capitalizing on the Investment:
    1. As I stated above the biggest risks are taken care of by I and my team doing our part by spreading the word and putting our very best foot forward.
    2. The same mechanics apply to selling music online. It's about making an effort to get music out and having a great product. 
      1. Presentation of the product.
      2. Making the product something fans can relate too.
      3. Making lasting relationships with those who help with our cause.
    3. Constantly looking for new opportunities.
      1. Making new connections
      2. Finding new venues
  3. Not reaching the $5000 mark
    1. If we do not reach the mark money will be appropriated to the recording, mixing, and distribution of the album.
      1. Recording time will be cut back to 1 to 2 days depending on budget.
  4. The Perks
    1. For $5
      1. Everyone who contributes will receive a copy of the Album and written letter of appreciation for the contribution.
    2. For $15
      1. bumper sticker.

Other ways to help:

We know everyone may not be able to contribute to the campaign. So if you cannot please

 

Thanks again... Lets do this!

Hello,
The name's Timothy Ferguson. My story began in the small town of Nashville, Ga. I'm the son of a pastor, musician, and teaching father, and a loving teaching mother. Music has been apart of my life sense I can remember. At the age of three a started playing drums and eventually would pick up saxophone and piano. My love for creating music would progress into something major. My father instilled in me a love for God and for humanity, and the belief that I can do anything I set my mind too. I want to share the gifts that God gave and my father cultivated with the world.
This project means a great deal because it's music that represents my life. It represents my thoughts expressed through music, my passion, my pain, my personality, my creativity, and my goals. It's also a springboard into mentorship and further creative endeavors. These endeavors include public speaking, the creation of a production company called HOA, and an arts school that tailors curriculum to the student and cultivates creativity, morality, and spirituality. 
.No goal is out of reach. especially when done in the context of community. This is why I need your help. To reach a goal that will span the lifetimes of our children's children and beyond. My goals are lofty but God given. That being said I know that it will happen. We're stronger together and I need your help.
So far I've established my self as a saxophonist and am at the threshold of finishing my B.A. degree in music. I've played with Grammy winning artist and opened for big names in the blues(Bobby Rush) and R&B(Betty Wright) world.  I've decided that it is time to take my career to a different level. I've gained knowledge from some of the industries top producers and musicians as-well-as top tier sound engineers. They believe in what I'm doing and support my music.  
What We Need
The Goal is to raise $5000. 
What the $5000 is for.


Studio Time$750.00 per day for three days: $2,250


Mixing and Mastering$900.00 for 10 tracks


Room and Board for Band
$210.00 for 3 rooms

$500 for band provisions$100 per person for 5 people




Band Transportation for Equipment and Members$398.00 for three days


Copyright Application$35.00


CD Manufacturing

472.71 for 100 CDs

Includes Album Art, Bio, and Online Distribution



Flyers and Posters$100 for 50 professionally printed flyers and posters

Video recording for promoting the album and band to venues, and possible sponsors
$400 for 2hrs

The Risk
There are risks involved with every investment. Music is a high risk occupation that requires constant upkeep. The major risks and solutions are:


Album Sales:
Make a reasonable amount of albums and push the product.

Good products sale themselvesMy product will be quality which insures that the listener will buy my product.


Gig:This is a big part of selling merchandise. It's one of the best ways to build a following and make a profit off album sales.


Word of Mouth:A huge part of gathering and creating a fan base of people who will like and buy our music is hitting the scene and spreading the word. This goes hand in hand with Gigging.




Capitalizing on the Investment:
As I stated above the biggest risks are taken care of by I and my team doing our part by spreading the word and putting our very best foot forward.

The same mechanics apply to selling music online. It's about making an effort to get music out and having a great product. 
Presentation of the product.
Making the product something fans can relate too.
Making lasting relationships with those who help with our cause.



Constantly looking for new opportunities.
Making new connections
Finding new venues





Not reaching the $5000 mark
If we do not reach the mark money will be appropriated to the recording, mixing, and distribution of the album.Recording time will be cut back to 1 to 2 days depending on budget.



The Perks

For $5Everyone who contributes will receive a copy of the Album and written letter of appreciation for the contribution.


For $15 bumper sticker.




Other ways to help:
We know everyone may not be able to contribute to the campaign. So if you cannot please 
 
Thanks again... Lets do this!

story:
WHO IS THELONIOUS MONK?

Thelonious Sphere Monk (what a name!) was born October 10, 1917, in Rocky Mount, North Carolina, and died February 17, 1982 in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey. He is the second-most recorded composer in the history of jazz, after Duke Ellington—an achievement that becomes more remarkable when you know that Ellington wrote or cowrote about 1000 compositions, while Monk is only credited with 70. 

But what compositions they are! The more popular ones are "'Round Midnight", "Straight, No Chaser", "Blue Monk", "Ruby, My Dear", "In Walked Bud", and "Well, You Needn't". Monk was equally admired for his compositions and his playing style. Monk's playing was rooted in the tradition of stride piano, but he was also a key figure in the bop revolution, and his style contains elements of both. His compositions were derived from his piano stylings, which had surprising syncopations and combinations of notes that some new listeners assumed were mistakes, until they heard enough of them to realize the method behind his madness. His music was playful but also challenging.  He remained a best-kept secret in American jazz throughout the first half of his career, inspiring contemporaries—some of whom treated him as a mentor—but never quite breaking through to a wider audience. 

This changed for Monk starting in the mid-1950s. The first thing that happened was that Monk got a new manager, Harry Columby, a schoolteacher who recognized his genius. Columby was instrumental in getting Monk a contract with Riverside Records after a long spell with Prestige, which didn't know how to sell him; Riverside believed in Monk so strongly that they bought out his contract with his old label. Columby also helped Monk get his cabaret card back so that he could play in clubs again. Monk had lost his cabaret card in a heroin bust; the heroin belonged to Monk's colleague, Bud Powell, but Monk took the rap because he didn't want to rat on his friend. 

Monk's first gig after getting his cabaret card back was at the Five Spot, with a gifted young saxophonist named John Coltrane. His career picked up: he put out three albums on Riverside that year—Brilliant Corners, Monk's Music and Thelonious Himself—and started to become a jazz celebrity, to the extent that such a thing existed in a postwar United States infatuated with rock 'n' roll. Monk's career had his ups and downs after that, but professionally it was mostly up. He was productive as both a composer and live performer. In 1962, he was featured on the cover of Time Magazine, one of a handful of American jazz players to be so honored.

Unfortunately, Monk's health started deteriorating in the late 1960s. It had never been all that good: he had suffered throughout his life from what his family later described as mental illness, though doctors never figured out what kind. He would spin in circles, fidget endlessly. There were times when he'd take off and go wandering around for days. He was hospitalized many times. Doctors prescribed electroshock treatment, but his wife Nellie wouldn't allow it. He took lithium and antipsychotics. It has been speculated that incorrect prescriptions damaged Monk's brain further, but this has never been proven.  Monk's live performing tapered off in the late 1970s. He died in 1982 at the home of his most devoted patron, Baroness Pannonica de Koenigswarter, who also supported Charlie Parker.  

Monk's work lives on for its boldness, originality, meticulous construction, and endless sense of play. "The clarity and logic of his work might have been compared with the craft of an architect," wrote Mimi Clare of The Los Angeles Times, "each phrase, each fragment, each plump chord had its exact place in his musical structure." 

Monk and Me: A Statement by Dave Zoller

“The Piano Ain’t Got No Wrong Notes!” – Thelonious Monk

I was 17 when I was first introduced to Monk’s music by two friends from Columbus, OH. They loaned me LPs of Monk’s Music and Art Blakey’s Jazz Messengers with Thelonious Monk, which I taped and gave back to them. At first I was intrigued; I’d read about Monk before. But once I began listening I was hooked! A month or two later I taught myself to play “Blue Monk,” complete with Monk’s piano solo on the Blakey/Messengers record. 

A few years later while I was in the Army at Ft. Jackson, SC I played a few times with the great saxophonist Lew Tabackin. We played nothing but Monk and Coltrane songs. About the same time I read in Downbeat about a group with Steve Lacy on soprano sax and Roswell Rudd on trombone. They played nothing but Monk songs! For me, at that time, that was too hip—and the seed was planted! 

As the years went by I learned more of Monk’s music and wrote arrangements of it. We even played a few Monk songs while I was touring with Al Hirt (at his request!). When I was writing charts of Monk songs, bits and pieces of me began to seep into what I was writing. A few live gigs happened where we could actually play this music. Over the last three decades, I've put out five albums of my own material on CD (you can view a complete list here) 

Then, in 2009, we formed the group Evidence and managed to some get club gigs and a few concerts in Dallas and Ft. Worth. Finally, in 2012, we recorded a CD’s worth of material. Then, when our original saxophonist Pete Gallio suddenly moved to Seattle, Woody Berner and I decided to form another Evidence group and record more music.

A series of medical issues (specifically three strokes) held me back. But when we learned of Monk’s upcoming 100th birthday (October 10, 1917) we decided to hurry and finish the project and issue the project in three different formats: as a download, a double CD, and as a set of three vinyl records. We're also making the album cover, featuring a painting by Junko Otsu and design by Peter Howell of London-based Howell Creative, as a t-shirt, a poster, and a set of coasters (which will allow you to have a drink with Monk, as it were). 

My son Matt Zoller Seitz, TV critic for New York magazine and editor-in-chief of Roger Ebert.com, is also contributing perks to the fundraising campaign, in the form of signed copies of his books: The Wes Anderson Collection, The Wes Anderson Collection: Grand Budapest Hotel, TV (The Book), The Oliver Stone Experience, and Mad Men Carousel.

Evidence is the culmination of nearly six decades of listening, studying, performing and loving the works of a great American pianist and composer. We hope you enjoy it. —Dave Zoller

Thanks for your support!  

Making Evidence

Recording Evidence took a total of five days spread out over five years, in 2012 and 2017 (as mentioned earlier, a series of strokes got in the way of finishing it the first time around!). The cost of studio time, all told, was $3500. My sidemen deferred their payments because they're friends, but of course it's good karma to pay the band. $2400 is what it would've cost to hire these guys if they didn't know me.

Now that Evidence is finished and properly mastered, we want to print 500 double-CDs with gatefold cardboard sleeves ($1500), plus 200 copies of the vinyl triple-album ($4200, including the cost of printing a gatefold cover and record labels and paying for sleeves).

The total cost of licensing Monk's music in all formats, including CD, vinyl and downloads, comes to $3300. That's a big piece of the total, but also necessary because we want Monk's estate to be compensated: it's his music.  

Design of the cover and other items that showcase it (including t-shirts, the poster and the coasters) cost $1000. We also hired a researcher to create a list of jazz radio stations, web sites, jazz critics and aficionados all over the world, then contact them to try to stimulate interest in listening to Evidence when it comes out. Total hourly cost of this effort was $800.

All put together, to create Evidence, make it available in different formats and promote it will cost $15,700.  

What Do I Get Out of This?

Glad you asked! Bare minimum ($20), you get an official download of Evidence and a thank you from me. Moving up incrementally, you might get a copy of the double-CD ($25) or the vinyl three-record set ($75). 

If you're not a jazz fan, but want to support this quest, you could choose one of the perks that features the album cover: a set of coasters ($25), or a poster version ($50). Or you can order one of Matt Zoller Seitz's books, signed by the author.

We also offer various levels of support that include one, two, three or more of the items listed here (see "Perks" for details).

 

What We're Up Against

There was never a good time to decide to be a jazz musician. Even when jazz was at its peak as an art form and an object of intense public fascination, the percentage of music fans worldwide who were into it was never enormous.  It's harder to be a working jazz musician now than ever before, partly because public taste in music has shifted pretty decisively to other genres, but also because the infrastructure that used to give it some semblance of support has faded. Major cities that might've hosted a dozen jazz clubs in the 1950s or '60s might have three or four now, if that. The number of radio stations devoted to jazz, old or new, has shrunk. Newspapers and magazines used to cover jazz regularly, along with literature, film, TV, opera, painting and other art forms; a lot of these outlets even had critics on staff who concentrated on their own area of expertise, and filed stories regularly to tell the public what they should seek out or avoid.  

That's not the case anymore. A lot of times, the only way people hear about a notable new jazz record is if another fan tells them about it. It's become much more of a word-of-mouth thing, and while social media tools like Facebook and Twitter help somewhat, it's still an uphill battle to make something like this, then get the word out and let people know that it exists.

This is all a long way of saying that releasing an enormous collection of new arrangements of work by a jazz master who died in 1982, and who was never a household name to start with, is not what you'd call a sure thing. In fact, we have it on good authority that it's crazy and ridiculous to even think about doing something like this.

But hey! We're doing this for the love of it. And we want to share what we've done with the world—in a handsomely designed, professionally engineered format that can sit comfortably alongside works by past masters, because it was created in the same loving spirit.

We've thought about Evidence not just as a collection of recordings but as an object: something you can hold in your hands while reading the liner notes, admiring the artwork and graphics on the packaging, smelling the ink on the paper, maybe even holding the CD or vinyl record up and admiring the way light plays across its surface.

It's an old-school labor of love. 

It's also a vote of encouragement for a musician who's been around for a while, and put everything he knows about music into a passion project.

story:
When I was 18, I moved to NYC to "make-it" in the music business.  It didn't take long to realize the business was not what I expected it to be.  Up until that point, my music was an authentic expression of my true unique self, but I quickly began to see that the music business was about creating a product, not about nurturing an artist and their unique expression.  I was coached to sing a certain way, write a certain way, play a certain way, look a certain way, all in hopes of landing a record deal.  I was taught that in order to succeed I needed to be what the record label wanted me to be, NOT to be myself.  I recorded several EPs and played the NYC singer-songwriter circuit, and tried for many years to be what I thought I was supposed to be. 

As I reached my thirties, and became a mother, I felt my dream of bringing music to the world had been lost.  I followed many other paths in hopes of fulfillment.  Along the way I became a certified yoga instructor, a certified health coach, founded a food-rescue non-profit, and became a Shamanic Reiki master practitioner.  Each journey brought me closer to my true self.  My Soul was aching and I was searching for healing.  Then while at Mary Ellen O'Brien's retreat house in Cold Spring, NY, I journeyed back to a time in my life when I felt totally connected to the Universe.  I remembered walking home from high school on a crisp autumn day.  I was writing melodies and lyrics in my head, as was the norm.  The line "The Sun, The Moon, And The Stars, Are All Inside Of You" dropped in.  As I heard this, I looked down, and there lying in the colored leaves was a gold sun.  A lost jewel.  It was synchronistic confirmation.  In that moment everything was perfect.  I was aware of our innate connection to all that is.  And in remembering that moment, I remembered my true purpose. 

A couple days later I was speaking with my friend Ivey about the nonprofit I was developing.  She asked if I had followed through on some leads she had given me.  My response was, "I just don't know when I'm ever going to do my music."  She said, "What music?"  (She had no idea that I was a musician.)  And the Universe began to speak to me, through her, about giving my all to my dream, without distraction, to eat, sleep and breathe it.  That as a wife and mother, I only have so much energy left to give, so it better be given to my true passion.  It was in that moment that I decided it wasn't too late to give my gifts to the world.

I then began to change my life and to make music my focus again. 

With the love and support of my husband, I set up my home studio and began recording.  I began to rediscover my authentic voice, and my own unique sound.  The song, 'We Are The Ones" was born.  Now, almost a year later, I've connected with world-class musicians and recording engineers that have taken my music to the next level. I am in the process of recording my first full length album and I am ready to release this project to the world -  a world of music beyond record labels,  

I believe in the power of music.  I believe music can heal the world.  It is my mission with this project to inspire YOU to live your Soul Self, to know that the power is within you, and that We Are The Ones we've been waiting for!

What We Need and What You Get

$4,000 Recording of 6 Songs and Mixing of the Entire Album

Having already recorded 4 songs, this portion of funds will go to the amazing world-class musicians that are a part of this project as well as to pay for time in the recording studio.  Tracks will be recorded at Rich Sound Studios in NYC.  Sessions will be facilitated by recording engineer extraordinaire, Rich Gaglia.

$1,500 Mastering of 10 Songs

The process of mastering is what creates a polished, professional, finished product.  Ensuring the highest quality of sound in all areas, mastering creates a unified sound and maintains consistency across an album.

$1,500 CD Manufacturing 

$500 Visionary Cover Art

$500 Marketing and Fulfillment  

If the entire goal amount is not reached funds will be distributed as needed in each of these important areas.

I invite you to help spread the word by sharing this campaign on your favorite social media platform.

Thank You For Your Support! ~ Alison

is.  And in remembering that moment, I remembered my true purpose. A couple days later I was speaking with my friend Ivey about the nonprofit I was developing.  She asked if I had followed through on some leads she had given me.  My response was, "I just don't know when I'm ever going to do my music."  She said, "What music?"  (She had no idea that I was a musician.)  And the Universe began to speak to me, through her, about giving my all to my dream, without distraction, to eat, sleep and breathe it.  That as a wife and mother, I only have so much energy left to give, so it better be given to my true passion.  It was in that moment that I decided it wasn't too late to give my gifts to the world.I then began to change my life and to make music my focus again. With the love and support of my husband, I set up my home studio and began recording.  I began to rediscover my authentic voice, and my own unique sound.  The song, 'We Are The Ones" was born.  Now, almost a year later, I've connected with world-class musicians and recording engineers that have taken my music to the next level. I am in the process of recording my first full length album and I am ready to release this project to the world -  a world of music beyond record labels,  I believe in the power of music.  I believe music can heal the world.  It is my mission with this project to inspire YOU to live your Soul Self, to know that the power is within you, and that We Are The Ones we've been waiting for!What We Need and What You Get$4,000 Recording of 6 Songs and Mixing of the Entire AlbumHaving already recorded 4 songs, this portion of funds will go to the amazing world-class musicians that are a part of this project as well as to pay for time in the recording studio.  Tracks will be recorded at Rich Sound Studios in NYC.  Sessions will be facilitated by recording engineer extraordinaire, Rich Gaglia.$1,500 Mastering of 10 SongsThe process of mastering is what creates a polished, professional, finished product.  Ensuring the highest quality of sound in all areas, mastering creates a unified sound and maintains consistency across an album.$1,500 CD Manufacturing $500 Visionary Cover Art$500 Marketing and Fulfillment  If the entire goal amount is not reached funds will be distributed as needed in each of these important areas.I invite you to help spread the word by sharing this campaign on your favorite social media platform.Thank You For Your Support! ~ Alison

story:
Letter from Garrett:

I don't really know how to fully explain what these songs mean to me, but at risk of sounding melodramatic, each track feels like a rest stop on the way from my family's recovery from grief and loss to a place of celebration and appreciation of what it means to love and be loved by each other.

Additionally, I’m excited that this album reflects on the significant roles a lot of you have had on that journey. I hope you find a piece of yourself in it, and I hope it let’s you know how much I've cherished our friendships and relationships. -GG

 

Ok so, here's what's going on:

  • We're getting close to finishing the album!
  • But- now we have a time restraint because the studio may shut down. :(
  • I can't do this alone, but with your help I can finish it up before it does.

 

What's needed to finish the album?

Here's the breakdown:

Recording: each song is about 50-60% done on average, with two songs and a transition yet to be recorded. $2465

 

Editing: making the whole record cohesive together with all it's moving parts once we're done recording. $900

 

Mixing: making it sound sonically pleasing and professional. $1,050

 

Mastering: This is the final touch, the important step that makes it all sound full and radio ready. This is the only part of the album we can't do ourselves, thankfully it'll be in amazing hands with Emily Lazar (Noah And The Whale, Vampire Weekend, Sia, Etc.). $2700

 

The Album: $7,115

+

Small buffer (incase something takes longer than anticipated)

Indiegogo Rewards (I tried to keep them all meaningful while still resourceful)

Indiegogo Fee, they take a small percentage of everything

 

The Total: $7780

 

What's the album like so far? 

It's a sentimental blend of old world jazz elements and modern songwriting.

We've woven muted trumpets, large string arrangements, and warm piano over an anthemic indie-pop base, thankfully with the help of some incredible world-class musicians (whose performances I personally think make the album what it is). All of this is brought together by my amazing producer, Darren Rayl. I think might of had just as much fun hanging out with him as I have making the record.

The album so far:

  • 9 full songs, 3 transitions that bring the stories together
  • Called "You & Yours"
  • 12 Total Tracks

Other Ways You Can Help

**If you share this on social media and tag me, you get the first single for free when it comes out!**

 

Risks & Challenges

The studio has the potential to shut down due to heavy construction while they widen on the road it's on. Seeing as that will take a while, the studio may shut down and move to another location, which would most likely be a smaller setup without our needed tracking capabilities. We've recorded so many large elements within this room and, even if we moved to another studio with our needs, the album would no longer be cohesive and could most likely be much more expensive.

 

Thank you everyone, I am so grateful for this potential opportunity, I can't do this without you all and I hope we get to make this together. <3

All the best,

GG

story:
Hi everybody! This moment feels very surreal. First of all, thank you to my Mom - Julia - and my Dad - Pierre - for always having my back and for being the backbone behind this monumental project! And most importantly, thank you to all my friends, family, and fans who have always supported me, my creative process, and my music. Thank YOU for becoming a part of this journey and joining my campaign. I have dreamed about this moment for so long! I chose to wait to share my music with you until it was fully done because I wanted to make everything perfect for your listening experience. I wanted to make something profound that will hold its value over time - I think I have accomplished that with this project. Now the CD is almost done and I just need your help to finish realizing my dream! This project has been my heart and soul - my life's work - and has been the culmination of everything I have learned thus far in my schooling publicly and personally. It was difficult to trust in my ability to create, but when I learned to be honest with myself, I was surprised  by what I discovered. Check out my website and my Soundcloud to hear the previews for The Play and support your local artist today! 

Sincerely,

-Andrés Garreaud

 

Andrés Garreaud is an alternative music artist based out of Durham, North Carolina. His songs have a special narrative quality to them that are accompanied by rich melodies and chord progressions that take his listeners on a reflective journey. Andrés has many musical influences, ranging from rock classics like Led Zeppelin and Bob Dylan to modern artists like John Mayer and Dave Matthews Band. Currently, Andrés is recording his first full length CD titled The Play which is in the post-production process. It is set to release this Spring 2018 upon his graduation from Elon University. Outlined below, you can find details regarding the expenses for this project!

Mastering - One connection in Los Angeles, Paul Dugre, will be mastering the CD upon the completion of mixing. He will be charging $60 per song to master the project. There is only one more song that needs to get mastered! It will take him about one to two weeks to complete the mastering. I would estimate this being complete by mid February.

Duplication - Using Diskmakers online, I would like to manufacture 1,000 CDs. Each CD would have a 6 panel tri-fold case with an 8 page liner inside. In addition to the CD’s, I would like to produce 100 full color 11” x 17” posters. The total cost for 1,000 CDs with cases and 100 posters would cost $2,229. They estimate orders will take up to two weeks to process. If I buy the order in March, I would expect to receive the CD’s and posters by mid March/April.

Music Video - To accompany the CD release, I have plans to film a music video for one of my songs called “The Play.” I would like to film myself playing with the backing band, getting live shots that could be turned into a video. I would also like to have shots of myself singing and playing the guitar, and include drone shots to capture the landscape of my city. The song is a metaphor for the game that is life, and how we can get caught up in it or can remove ourselves and observe it from a distance. We live in a world that is constantly changing at such a fast pace, but do we ever really live in the present moment and enjoy the journey we are on?

Merchandise - I would like to produce 100 T-Shirts, equaling 50 men’s and 50 women’s shirts. The men’s shirts would cost $242 for 50 shirts while the women’s shirts would cost $432 for 50 shirts. Vistaprint would be able to turn around the order in about two weeks. I would also like to order 250 sticker decals which can purchased through Bands on a Budget. It would cost $210 for 250 sticker decals, and the turnaround rate is 9-12 days. If I order the T-Shirts and stickers at the same time, they should each arrive around mid April.

Paying the Band - To accompany the release of my CD, I would like to hire a backing band and perform the album live from top to bottom. To make this performance sound great, I would need a drummer, bassist, and lead guitarist. For some songs, I would also need background singers and a mandolin player. I have spent the last few weeks creating musical charts for my songs, but musicians should get paid for their practice! I would like to raise $750 for 10 rehearsals, which could be distributed accordingly. At the end of rehearsing, the band and I could perform the CD release show and any additional paid gigs.

 

Expenses:

  • Mastering - $60 to master 1 more song for CD
  • Album artwork - $300
  • Copyright - $55
  • ISRC Codes - $100
  • CD Duplication - $2,229 for 1000 CDs & 100 11”x17” Full color posters
  • Website Domain - $20
  • Men’s T’s - $242 for 50 shirts (black, white, grey)
  • Women’s T’s - $432 50 shirts (black, white, grey)
  • Stickers - $210 for 250 sticker decals
  • Professional Music Video - $5,000
  • Marketing Publisher for four months - $2,000
  • 10 Paid Rehearsals for the backing band - $750
  • Indiegogo fee 5% of total funding = $584.90
  • Extra shipping costs - $300 to mail rewards to donors
  • Total = $12,300

 

Production Schedule - Timeline:

  • Launch Indiegogo Campaign January 2018
  • Finish Mastering Stage by February 15th, 2018
  • Send masters for duplication and processing March 2018
  • Early Singles Release March 2018
  • Early Access to Digital Copy of CD March 2018
  • Regular Singles Release April 2018
  • Submit order for t-shirts and stickers by April 1st
  • Receive hard copies of CD by April 2018
  • Receive tour merchandise by April 2018
  • Distribute gifts to campaign donors by April 25th
  • Official CD Release May 4th, 2018
  • Music Video Release June 2018

story:
PROJECT UPDATE DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS SITUATION

Due to recent world health developments, New Life Fine Arts has postponed the April 2020 production and cast recording of “Esther: For Such a Time as This” until further notice. We are grateful to you—our NLFA family—for your support and prayers during this unique time in world history. While it's still uncertain when we'll be able to bring "Esther" to the stage again, we are hopeful to resume recording and make the cast album available as soon as possible. You can still partner with us on this project here, which will help ensure that we can pick up when the time is right without delay. THANK YOU!

 

What Is This Project All About?                          

The scroll of Esther is one of the most archeologically verified books of the Old Testament. It recounts an epic story of faith and miraculous timing, causing the reader to wrestle with difficult subjects such as class struggle, social norms, anti-Semitism and even the threat of genocide. Yet deliverance seems to come through an unlikely savior in the young Jewish orphan girl who ascends to a position of royalty while her true identity remains hidden. Only in the end can we see God’s hand in all that takes place, revealing Him to be the true Savior of all.

Playwright David MacAdam worked on Esther for nearly 15 years until conditions seemed right to finally bring the story to the stage. In David’s own words, “It just couldn’t have been completed until this time. God brought all the right people at the appointed time in order to bring this production to fruition. Clearly, it was meant ‘for such a time as this.’”


PHOTO BY PETER VANTINE

In September of 2019, New Life Fine Arts premiered their original musical stage production of Esther: For Such a Time as This at the Groton-Dunstable Performing Arts Center with over 4500 people attending across 8 performances. Rave reviews and an eager cast have inspired the idea to bring the powerfully orchestrated music from this incredible story to CD and digital format in the premiere cast recording!

The recording will be made available to the public when the encore theatrical performance of Esther is re-scheduled (hopefully in 2020). It will serve as a way for audiences to carry the story and music of Esther with them after the show, to be used to invite others to hear the incredible truth of God’s purpose and provision, and to support NLFA’s future endeavors in bringing “theater you can believe in” to a wider audience.


PHOTO BY JOSHUA ELZEY


What Is New Life Fine Arts All About?

"Theater you can believe in"

New Life Fine Arts is a non-profit theater and arts organization composed of a wide variety of team-players from the greater Boston area. We subscribe to the “classic” or “biblical” worldview that as human beings we are made in the image of God and are therefore accountable to Someone higher than ourselves. The same God who made us, loves us and seeks to salvage us from our lostness and restore us to Himself.


PHOTO BY TARA KASEY

Our commitment is to consistently provide high-quality entertainment and works of art that reflect the truth of the gospel; promote and encourage God-glorifying artistic endeavors through education, exhibitions, and community networking so creative gifts can be developed and exercised for the benefit of others; partner with Christian individuals and groups to reach out to their communities through the performing and visual arts; and present impactful stories that in some way reflect the timeless truth of Who God is and what He has done in the person of His Son.

NLFA is the arts ministry arm of New Life Community Church, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in Concord, MA. Your donation above the cost of merchandise received through this campaign is tax-deductible.

 

Who Is David MacAdam?

David MacAdam is the founding pastor of New Life Community Church in Concord, Massachusetts. He and his wife, Mary Ellen, have been active in church planting, evangelism and discipleship on both sides of the Atlantic for 45 years. David has ministered the gospel in more than 20 countries and has pastored churches in England and the United States. After ten years in Europe, he served as Minister of Missions, Discipleship and Evangelism at Grace Chapel in Lexington, Massachusetts. In 1986 he planted New Life Community Church in Concord with a vision to build contagious Christ-centered communities in the greater Boston area through small LIFE groups and ministry teams.

In addition to a teaching ministry, David is a writer, playwright, composer and producing director. In 1987 he founded New Life Drama Company (now New Life Fine Arts) which serves as a means of introducing unchurched audiences to the life-transforming message of the gospel by bringing redemptive Christ-centered musical dramas to the stage. David and Mary Ellen have three grown children, Jonathan, Heather and Ben, and eleven grandchildren.

 

How Will The Money Be Used?

The money raised here will go directly to producing (recording, mixing and mastering) the 20 selections to be included on the cast recording, as well as covering costs for CD duplication, packaging design, fulfilling “rewards” through this campaign, and administrative costs to run the campaign. Any additional money raised beyond the project budget will go toward supporting future New Life Fine Arts performances and projects.


How Soon Are Funds Needed?

Our goal is to reach full funding for this project by April 1, 2020 so that we can have CDs available at the upcoming encore performances of Esther: For Such a Time as This. This also aligns with our live performance rehearsal schedule so that we can rehearse the cast for both recorded and live productions at the same time. We will begin recording before reaching full funding as we are stepping out in faith and trusting that God will help bring this work to completion.


PHOTO BY JOSHUA ELZEY

Why Is This Important?

The premiere performances of Esther: For Such a Time as This received rave reviews and countless blessings of people being touched by this timeless story. Many audience members asked when we’d be performing the show again AND when a cast recording of the show available. We want to provide a way for those who enjoy the show to extend their experience and perhaps share the message of Christ with others through this recording. We believe strongly in making an investment in this generation through the high impact medium of theater arts, and you can partner with us on this unique mission!

Our vision is to one day provide a full season of high-quality dramatic events on a resident stage in our proposed New Life Ministry Center: home of New Life Community Church and New Life Fine Arts. From this base we would create educational programs in the arts and send out traveling performing and teaching teams who would take the message where the people are. We are funded entirely by partners like you and the organization is primarily run by volunteers. By God’s grace, this album will also help us to raise future funds to support our vision and one day see it become reality.


PHOTO BY JOSHUA ELZEY

Thank You From David, Cast & Crew

David and the cast of Esther would like to thank you for taking the time to look through this material and learn more about New Life Fine Arts. We hope you will prayerfully consider supporting this project and partnering with us in shining the spotlight on Christ through music and theater. Your generosity and encouragement fuel our passion to see this project fully realized. We couldn’t do it without you! Thank you!

This also aligns with our live performance rehearsal schedule so that we can rehearse the cast for both recorded and live productions at the same time. We will begin recording before reaching full funding as we are stepping out in faith and trusting that God will help bring this work to completion.PHOTO BY JOSHUA ELZEYWhy Is This Important?The premiere performances of Esther: For Such a Time as This received rave reviews and countless blessings of people being touched by this timeless story. Many audience members asked when we’d be performing the show again AND when a cast recording of the show available. We want to provide a way for those who enjoy the show to extend their experience and perhaps share the message of Christ with others through this recording. We believe strongly in making an investment in this generation through the high impact medium of theater arts, and you can partner with us on this unique mission!Our vision is to one day provide a full season of high-quality dramatic events on a resident stage in our proposed New Life Ministry Center: home of New Life Community Church and New Life Fine Arts. From this base we would create educational programs in the arts and send out traveling performing and teaching teams who would take the message where the people are. We are funded entirely by partners like you and the organization is primarily run by volunteers. By God’s grace, this album will also help us to raise future funds to support our vision and one day see it become reality.PHOTO BY JOSHUA ELZEYThank You From David, Cast & CrewDavid and the cast of Esther would like to thank you for taking the time to look through this material and learn more about New Life Fine Arts. We hope you will prayerfully consider supporting this project and partnering with us in shining the spotlight on Christ through music and theater. Your generosity and encouragement fuel our passion to see this project fully realized. We couldn’t do it without you! Thank you!

story:
The Summary

Hey it's me Trent Thompson and I am almost ready to give you some new music...but I need your help first! 

I have an extremely clear vision for this release.  This was the song that lead to writing and releasing the other singles you have heard.  This song set me on my journey to be a solo artist, and I want to make sure this release is done RIGHT!

When you give it is going directly into making a music video happen, photography, marketing materials and the album artwork.  YOU CAN MAKE THAT HAPPEN!! 

What We Need 

We are raising $1,500 to make this happen.

This money goes directly into the making of this music video, the photography and the marketing of this release. 

The Impact

I have had some incredible feedback from my music.  Meaning people have connected to it, they have seen themselves within the story of the song, and maybe you have as well.  

I believe this song packs an incredible punch and is even more relevant now than ever.

The chorus says this: "I'm just going to say it, I'll say it.  This isn't what we wanted, we never thought that it would come to this."

 

Challenges

I understand how difficult the timing of this is for so many of us, myself included.  This year has been...well, a mess to put it generously. 

If you find yourself in a position where you cannot give I absolutely understand and appreciate you listening and sharing! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share! 

This is going to help someone in their journey to speak up, to speak out, and to live a bold life. 

Lets do this!!!

story:
How did it start?

Life has been quite a journey. After growing up surrounded by the beautiful Latvian country side, filled with wild days in the mesmerizing nature, I quickly realized, that everything I wish for in the life is connected with music. A bunch of songs and music projects later, after having great times in Jazz and cover bands, I started to perform my own music. Played shows in the bars, cafés and on folk festivals, and then eventually moved to Innsbruck. Here I work in die Bäckerei Kulturbackstube,  a local culture centre, where I organize concerts and open stage events for local musicians and artists. 

About the project:

After releasing my debut album ''These Storms'' on 2017,  for the past few years I have been exploring electronic pop music and have gotten interested in music production. The result is a collection of 8 tracks, which I have either completely produced myself or produced together with the amazing local Austrian producer CHRS (Christoph Holzknecht). Big parts of the album are recorded at my home. I am extremely excited to bring out this record, as it goes in the musical direction, that is interesting and challenging for me at the moment. Moving away from the melancholic singer songwriter corner into the depths of electronic pop music. Move upbeat, more powerful, more experimental.

 
My big dream was to be able to perform my solo program alone, showing also an inspiring example to other young ladies out there, who are missing the courage to get into music production and performance side of the music. It has been such an empowering journey and enormous joy to look back and to realize, that even though I started from a scratch, without any knowledge about music production, in these few years, although, the music production is a never-ending process and I am just at the very beginning, I have been able to create and also to perform completely on my own.

What I need the financial support for:

To release this album I still need a little bit of financial support to cover the final costs of the mixing and mastering, pressing of the CDs, to cover the costs for the cover art and promotional costs. In case there is some money left in the pot, it will be invested in a music video.

The album is already in the finish line and was originally planned to be released without a crowdfunding campaign. However, as many artists out there, the Corona times has hit me pretty hard & I have decided to reach out to the community to cover the last costs of the production. Help me to bring this record into the day light!

About the perks:

To be able to focus more on the music, for this campaign, I decided to keep the perks rather simple:

  • You can purchase a digital download of my album
  • You can purchase a CD
  • You can buy a ticket to a supporter concert in Innsbruck, Austria, where I will perform my solo electro set and share the stage with wonderful artists from my community
  • You can order a song written specially for you. This is also a wonderful original gift for a friend
  • You can order a house concert. This one I can only carry out in Tirol. Having a birthday? Just want to have a cool summer garden concert? This one is for you then. I really love performing, btw.

Other Ways You Can Help:

I know, that many people of my community are having the same financial struggles, so I am kindly asking for contributions just from the people who can afford and wish to support me. There are also some other ways, how you can always support me, even if in your wallet is the same empty as mine:

  • Share the campaign with your friends and community. Maybe I have some hidden fans there!
  • Come to my concerts, I am always happy to have a beer after the show as well
  • Follow me on the social media & share it with your friends:
    • https://www.facebook.com/baibamusic/
    • https://www.instagram.com/baiba_music/
    • https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClMTBmVX4yC65E...
    • https://open.spotify.com/artist/77PF1nfgZDwWdkk...

THANK YOUs

  • To all of you for listening to my music, coming to my concerts, sharing content and this campaign
  • To Benjamin Leingartner from Super Plus Records for standing by my side and believing in my music through thick and thin. https://superplusrecords.com
  • To Christoph Holzknect (CHRS) for being my producer and my biggest teacher and creative advisor. https://www.christophholzknecht.com
  • To Yvonne Neyer for making all the wonderful single and album cover and helping me with overall design tasks. 
  • To Robert Puteanu for making this wonderful crowdfunding video for me. https://www.facebook.com/robertpphoto/
  • To Christoph Stickl for such high quality music mastering. https://csmastering.de

story:
Behind the EP:

”Moira of Arcadia” is a 3 track Gothic Fantasy EP written and recorded entirely on the Celtic Harp using effects and soundboard percussion to add an extra layer of nuance and depth. Inspired by Dark Fantasy artwork, books and stories of elves, lost cities and crumbling kingdoms. Each track takes you further into a land of shadowy corridors, vines covered ruins and mysterious figures. Immersing you into a land all your own.

Each EP comes packaged in an ecofriendly recycled cardboard jacket with minimal plastic waste

 

The songs:

In The Beginning... 

Moira of Arcadia 

Eclipse of the Sun (Eventide)

 

Limited Edition Artwork and Exclusives to this campaign:

I have 4 packages available to make it easy and affordable for you to choose what best fits your budget and interests. But best of all, the EP you order here comes signed and has limited edition artwork designed by me for the tracklist and CD itself which will vary slightly once the EP officially releases on streaming platforms and is available for physical sale on my online store once its live.

FUNDING:

Funding goes towards:

Printing/Duplication/Distribution of the physical EP through CDBaby

Distribution onto Streaming sites such as Spotify and Apple Music through CDBaby

A unique UPC code for the EP 

Recouping funds that went into making the EP

CDBaby requires a minimum of 50 CDs to be ordered and our funding goal is based off of the overall price for printing and distribution services of the EPs and Posters which will be sent out. If our goal isn't met this EP in physical form will be postponed and if streaming services were to go away tomorrow, I would have a much harder time sharing what I love to do with others.

Funding from this campaign also goes towards future projects and releases which will allow me to create more music to provide for free and on streaming sites.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Sharing the campaign link helps wonders and I greatly appreciate support in all forms. Also making sure to join my email list or follow me on social media for all future updates, live streams and posts where my music will be available for free.

story:
What is The American Mythology?

The same Donnie who brought us the timeless classic, The Colored Section, returns. Delivering a herculean fanfare of sonic proportions – his highly anticipated album, The American Mythology. It’s soul music like you’ve never experienced it before.

The American Mythology unveils an epic musical narrative inspired by the structural archetype of the classic myth. The epic narrative begins with "The Book of Oblivion”, a sacred scripture beheld by a cult of faithful followers. Conducting their worship in a temple made of radio waves known as "The Invisible Institution”, a building not made by hand. 

Their sacred scripture tells the story of the American experience. Through the use of musical metaphor and artistic allegory as modes of expression, these “scriptures" craft an unforgettable story. Rich in meaning, yet woven together with childlike simplicity. 

Donnie's music has always spoken to the hearts of people and the truths of time. However, critics praise, The American Mythology as a symbolic masterpiece, the most powerful Donnie yet.

Become a part of this beautifully written cult classic and experience your place within the story of The American Mythology. This, this is for you America.  

 

The Impact

Healing, hope, perspective and freedom are just a few of the deeply rooted themes in the new epic musical narrative The American Mythology.  

Donnie initially started this project as a therapeutic and artistic means of expression to break free of the bondage of certain religion. Recognizing that while he himself was seeking to heal, many others were seeking the same freedom. 

Donnie notes, "Our parents teach us what they believe because it’s what they know. However, more often than not, that doesn't always agree with our personal purpose and calling. I’ve found this to be especially true as an artist."

In the musical narrative, a lively ensemble invites the listener to step into a personally individualized place that openly practices the power of religious freedom. It is a celebration of healing and rediscovery through song. Centered around the archetype of the classic myth, Donnie takes the listener on a soulful journey of epic musical proportions. His artistic dialogue encourages the listener to abandon all societal expectation.  In turn, asking the people of America to be "born again”, taking on a new perspective of America. 

The singers on the project are Llewon Felder, Rahbi Hines, Heston Francis and Rolynne Anderson. They not only bring the characters to life, but an array color to the story. 

Although monies are needed to make this vision a reality, part of your financial gift will be donated to breast cancer awareness. Join Donnie and help to bring this project to life!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many challenges that arise during any project, but those that we can foresee are:

1. Having the ability to finish compiling, mixing, and mastering the musical portion of the project

2.  Having the capital to craft an equally stunning and visually compelling theatrical stage experience.

3. Completing the project by the end of 2020.  

Although we are working diligently to put the right people and supplementary support in place to see the project through on a smaller scale, we would lengthen the timeline by another year or two, in order to bring the project to fruition.

There is an immediate need to pay the following:  Live recording artists, voice actors, musicians, producers, recording and sound engineers/designers, writers, audio mixing, mastering, distribution, marketing, management, production, filming, and all live event production costs related to the project.

We have solid milestone goals to get us there in either situation, but the quickest route there is with your support. We are excited to partner with you to bring this project to life. Not only for the people of Atlanta but the people of America.  Atlanta is simply where the journey begins.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! You can: 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Reminder: Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it! THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everybody,

Katre is a four piece instrumental rock band based in Berlin. We are looking for your support to produce and distribute an instrumental conceptual album about the refugee crisis.

Due to civil wars, global warming, political persecution and starvation, the number of people looking for security is increasing day by day.

We want to raise awareness about the refugee crisis and hopefully contribute to the world peace.

You can read the complete story here song by song.

Thank you!

Katre

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to use the funding as follows.

  • First and foremost, to make a decent sounding album by acquiring the best possible mixing and mastering service,
  • Second, to launch a series of successful PR campaigns.
  • Third, to shoot a 50-minutes (total playing time of the album) film/documentary/video clip that tells the whole story.

There is often discussion about whether refugees are more of an opportunity for Europe or more of a threat to European culture and society. Usually, the debate is focused around how the refugees can be successfully integrated in the economy. The humanitarian aspects are being neglected.

We think everybody should get a chance to change the direction of this discussion and finally make the decision makers understand that it is about human lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help does not have to be monetary. May be you can

  • connect us with the parties (record companies, PR organizations, tour manager, influencers in digital media etc.), which might have an interest in our campaign.
  • be a multiplier, i.e. just get the word out and make some noise about us and
  • share your experiences from similar projects/ campaigns.
