story:
Hi, and welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign!

My name is Elliott Novak. I'm a songwriter currently living in San Francisco. 

The one thing that has been consistent about my life is songwriting. I've slept on the floor's of homeless shelters and worked for an investment bank. I spent nearly five years working for a project management firm that oversaw the green refurbishment of half a dozen historical properties in the SF Bay Area - a very rewarding job! Then, like a nightmare, I lost everything and spent a year in physical therapy learning to walk again (I did it!)...   Through all of it, I've never given up because I've always written songs.

I'm here to raise funds to record and promote a two-track single (single +B-side). My goal is to get my name out there as a serious presence in the songwriting community. I know I can do it! As seen above from my history, anything is possible. The song above, (A DIFFERENT SONG) is an example of the kinds of songs I write. Emotional, piano driven songs that resonate with the listener's heart. (Working with Chloé from StudioPros on A DIFFERENT SONG made it all that more powerful. She and I have forged a magical connection.) If you like what you hear, please contribute. The songs I want to release are the best work of my life.

Sometimes it seems as if the songs come from somewhere else and I just happen to be at the piano when they're ready to reveal themselves. Sounds crazy, but it's true.

Obviously, if successful, and I can get my music heard, this has the potential to change my life. Since the health problems that nearly ruined me, I've been living like a pauper. A life change will be very welcome. The best thing about helping someone change their life is they (me) turn around and help change someone else's life. 

I'm seeking $3500 (USD) to record two songs, each with a budget of $1200. The remaining $1100 will be for a promotional package that gets me a press release into several of the high-end music blogs, a sponsored post, and my single will be placed in the new music playlists. If I don't reach my $3500 goal, any funds received will still be used toward this project. I will find a way and will make sure my contributors know what I'm doing every step of the way.

Thank you for reading. If you want to help, but cannot contribute, helping to spread the word about my campaign would be greatly appreciated! Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools! :)

Best, 

Elliott N.

As seen above from my history, anything is possible. The song above, (A DIFFERENT SONG) is an example of the kinds of songs I write. Emotional, piano driven songs that resonate with the listener's heart. (Working with Chloé from StudioPros on A DIFFERENT SONG made it all that more powerful. She and I have forged a magical connection.) If you like what you hear, please contribute. The songs I want to release are the best work of my life.
Sometimes it seems as if the songs come from somewhere else and I just happen to be at the piano when they're ready to reveal themselves. Sounds crazy, but it's true.
Obviously, if successful, and I can get my music heard, this has the potential to change my life. Since the health problems that nearly ruined me, I've been living like a pauper. A life change will be very welcome. The best thing about helping someone change their life is they (me) turn around and help change someone else's life. 
I'm seeking $3500 (USD) to record two songs, each with a budget of $1200. The remaining $1100 will be for a promotional package that gets me a press release into several of the high-end music blogs, a sponsored post, and my single will be placed in the new music playlists. If I don't reach my $3500 goal, any funds received will still be used toward this project. I will find a way and will make sure my contributors know what I'm doing every step of the way.
Thank you for reading. If you want to help, but cannot contribute, helping to spread the word about my campaign would be greatly appreciated! Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools! :)
Best, 
Elliott N.

story:
Hi guys and welcome to the crowdfunding campaign for my brand new album! 

The global pandemic has put a spanner in the works for all means of financing the next album so I'm having to reach out to YOU to make this album still possible! As you already know, times are tough enough for musicians with the price of music being so low and now that touring is out of the question too, the cost of making and releasing an album has become almost impossible to cover. Outside of studio costs, mixing & mastering, there is CD pressing, artwork designers, merch, promotion, video production, photo shoots and equipment - so it's  a huge outlay before the thing is even pressed. I thought I had it kinda covered but then Covid hit and now everything has changed!

I'm still determined to get this album out on time though and to make it even bigger & better than the last one! My last album 'Home' was 100% crowdfunded and would never have been possible of it wasn't for the incredible support of you guys. So I'm reaching out once again to see if we can still make this happen! I know times are tough and uncertain for all of us right now and I've done everything I can to keep the costs for this to an absolute minimum. I've also put together a list of pledge rewards that are low on cost & high on awesomeness! Stuff you won't get at the merch stand, like : 

1) Custom recorded live video performances of your favourite cover songs

2) A concert at your house (when we're allowed!)

3) An hour long one-to-one video chat

4) Signed CD's - get the album before it hits the stores!

5) Tour Merch, signed photo's, handwritten lyrics & more!

Oh and that's not to mention that I've written what I think is one of my best albums yet! I've really gone to town on it and I'm so excited to get this album out so you can hear it! If all goes well, that won't be too long! 

So if you can contribute, it would be a massive help and every little, really does make a huge difference in making this possible. I don't make anything from this, every last penny will go towards covering the costs outlined above. So thanks in advance and if you have any questions at all, just let me know! 

Thanks again for all of you incredible support, I hope you're all safe & well & I hope to see you all again real soon! 

James

story:
What on Earth are We Doing?

After 17 years together in various formations, Tyra Penn and Her Army of Snakes are recording their first album! As a band with such a long lifespan, many, many outstanding New England jazz musicians have been among our intrepid reptiles. Joining me on the record will be an A-list ensemble, who happen to be some of my favorite people: Paul Courchaine on guitar, my musical partner for the entire 17 years; Molly Flannery on piano, who has been the primary arranger for many of the songs, and whose composition Undercurrent will be featured on the record; Russ Gershon on saxes and woodwinds, another long-time collaborator who has also been one of the arrangers; Joe Potenza and Sven Larson switching off on the bass chair; and Zeke Martin on drums. 

    The title of our record is The Last Day of August, a special story, told in song, based on an uncommonly beautiful novel. John Crowley’s "Little, Big" is a modern-day fairy tale following   five generations of the Drinkwater family in their curiously constructed house, located Somewhere in rural New England.

    John Crowley once said of his work that his books are made, in part, of other books. This program is also made from a book, and from a collage of songs, both familiar and unknown.

    How You Can Help, and How We Will Thank You

    Our project cost estimate is about $14,000. One studio day is completed and paid for, with two more recording dates coming up in September. The studio sessions and the band I am paying for out of pocket, to the tune of about $5500. What I could use your help with are the following costs:

    • Mechanical licenses for up to 18 songs  $1800
    • Mixing & mastering $2700
    • Manufacturing of CDs (I know, but hard copies are still a thing) $3700
    • Total request: $8200

    Aside from the warm glow you will inevitably feel when you become a part of our project, you will of course also be directly rewarded for your generosity. Depending on the level at which you give, we will send you a shiny new disc in an artfully designed package; maybe a copy of the novel on which the record is based; maybe a piece of custom art jewelry based on one of the songs or a passage from the novel; or, for the most magnanimous among you, a one-of-a-kind piece of assemblage art illustrating a part of the story. You can find the full description of the "perks" on the sidebar, and always choose your path wisely!

    What Your Contribution Means To Me

    If you know me at all, you know that I am not sentimental; but, this project is something I have been percolating for the band for a few years now, and I find myself really driven to get it done. I love the guys in this band, and the music we make. This is the first time I have found myself in a position to be realistically able to pursue capturing this evidence of our existence, after several false starts over the years.

    The novel that it is based on, John Crowley's "Little, Big" has been the most influential book on my life since I was 13 years old (!!!). It is a wondrous story, and I have spent the last couple of years refining the program of songs that maps to its plot. I have barged in on the author's life and he seems suitably amused by this collage of bits of his text into the songs. I've also been sharing with him my progress on the shadowbox assemblages that accompany the show when we perform it live.

    I'm like most people, I would prefer to be able to do this whole thing on my own without coming to you to chip in; but, realistically I know I can only fund a third to a half of the full project. So here I am, asking you to contribute.

    Also, I am not above shamelessly pointing out that in August of 2020 I will be celebrating my (50th!) birthday, so this would be the best possible birthday present. As I said before, the title of the record is also The Last Day of August, and on 31 August this campaign will close. Your contribution to this project will make this the best birthday ever!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't in a position to give, or if you can't give as much as you would like because this has been such a weird and stressful year, you can still help out by sharing this campaign with all of your networks. Be a mensch!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey y’all!

I thought about this long and hard and the people close to me and fans encouraged me to start this campaign to partly fund my new album.

 

Last year we created a lot of traffic with the album Burning Old Bridges, with radio, tv appearances as well as some amazing live shows. We were looking forward to continue touring but the Corona Virus stopped us from doing this. This is a challenging time for many if not all of us and as musicians we’ve been trying to keep entertaining you guys through Quarantine videos etc.

i decided to never ask for anything in return and never posted a PayPal or Venmo account, which many people thought was strange. I just love what I do and enjoy making people smile or feel a different emotion. But because of all the cancelled tour dates there was no income which makes it harder to fund a new album with brand new music for you to enjoy.

 

so here I am humbly asking for your help. Any donation helps towards the completion of this project I am super excited about. Every donation of $25 Dollars or over will receive a signed cd by me and the craziest thing is that Everyone who makes a donation enter into a competition where  I will invite 1 or 2 lucky fans to come visit the studio in Nashville to watch some of the magic happen. A Once in A Lifetime opportunity!!

The winner(s) will have to pay for their own expenses to get and stay in Music City!! 

Please share this Campaign as much as you can to make it a success and we will hopefully see each other soon! Thank you!

story:
La Sposa del Gufo 

My name is Luisa Russo, I am an Italian singer and songwriter based in Egypt. I am also a blogger, Italian teacher and Hatha yoga instructor. I love dancing, especially contemporary dance and traditional Italian folk dance, which I perform with one of my bands (Estabena, the Mediterranean Music Project) blended in a fusion of flamenco and oriental dance. I have a passion for music instruments: I am trying to learn to play guitar, ukulele and 'oud. In my spare time I like to doodle and color, my favorite meditation is travelling, especially walking.

I have been performing most of my life with cover bands, until one day I decided that I wanted to express myself on a deeper level of content and not only form. That's how I started preparing my playlist of originalss to be performed with my dear friend Philippe Humbert (clarinetist). We didn't perform a lot, because of Covid19 restrictions, but I didn't give up and I decided that this is the right moment for recording some of my songs. When I think about my songs I consider them as my babies, my creatures that I want to deliver, recording them would be not only the realization of a dream, but also a "tangible" evidence of my artistic activity, an "art delivery". 

La Sposa del Gufo is a collection of six of my original songs. The songs I picked for this first EP are emblematic of the different stages of my life journey in Cairo, where I have been living during the past 5 years. I only recently moved to Dahab on the Red Sea, where I got the opportunity to re-observe these past years from another perspective and finally started to record these songs. 

When my "babies" will be delivered I want them to be loved and shared with all my friends (and non-friends) and family, what a better tool than a crowdfunding for making it a shared outcome and to reach a wide network of possible audience? 

The more I go deeper in my yoga journey, the artistic and also the "simple" life journey, the more I dive in the importance of sharing. I want to share my art, my journey, my thoughts and my sound.

 

What I Need & What You Get

The amount I am trying to collect is of 1850 €  it's the budget needed to cover what follow: 

  • Recording and producing (900 €)
  • Artwork and cover design (100 €)
  • Reimbursement of expenses for musicians (Philippe, the clarinetist, agreed to be reimbursed by receiving 6 lessons of Italian; Maya, the viola player, didn't ask for a specific amount for the two tracks in which she joined me, but I plan to reimburse her according to your generosity, please be generous her job deserves to be recognized and Tigana, the percussionist, accepted to join in three songs for the symbolic amount of 50 €) 
  • Video of the song Bar20s (400 € plus budget per make up, clothes and various)
  • Art work (printing and delivery) to be defined according to demand.
  • Copyrights (around 300 €)  
  • I elaborated a series of tasty perks that combine all my different skills from Yoga to doodling. Check them all!
  • Priority of funds will go to reimburse the musicians and on the recording and producing.

 

The Impact

  • I think my project is an interesting outcome of 5 years of cultural mediation and exploring of Cairo life and culture. It's an experience on mixing two languages that I find extremely beautiful and poetic and therefore I deeply love: Arabic and Italian. 
  • I successfully run a crowdfunding campaign here on Indiegogo in 2018 which lead to the release of Moga, Estabena first cover album (available on Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-125696263/sets/moga).

 

Risks & Challenges

Time for crowdfunding campaign is really limited, I really want to release the album for my 30th birthday, which will be in October. Delivering some of the perks (from Egypt) abroad might be challenging, but I can overcome this issues waiting to deliver them from Italy, where I will be hopefully for my birthday.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There is not only one way of sharing your abundance! If you can not donate right now, you can always support me, liking my social media pages. It's always good to join forces: you can offer your artistic skills (video making, marketing, make up, clothes for visual materials, visibility). And of course you can talk about my campaign to all your friends and share it on all your social media. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I already want to thank deeply: Mohammad Gamal (Jimmy) for the animation, video editing and mockups of the merchandising, Eleonora Iannotta for offering me to work with her amazing and professional company (IICI) to shoot the video of one of the songs (Bar20s) and to join Salma Safaa in providing the styling and make up for it and all their love and support.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everybody, my name is Brandon Laxton and I am a singer songwriter from Southern West Virginia. Growing up music was always a big part of my life, and I was always surrounded by talented singers and musicians. So, one day I decided to pick up a guitar and start learning to play all the songs that I loved growing up. After playing other artist's music for a couple of years I decided to try my hand at writing of my own music and original songs. I went from playing on front porches, to getting paid gigs around the Morgantown area and in Greenbrier county. Unfortunately the current pandemic has put a stop to the all gigs that were previously helping me to fund my album project. Working part time and going to college really makes it hard for me to save up money to accomplish this goal, so that is why I am asking for your assistance in this project.

What We Need & What You Get

 The production of an album is going to be around $5000. This money will go to all of the elements of music production such as Tracking, Editing, Mixing, Mastering, and the price of getting different musicians to accomplish the sound that I feel will best represent my music. All funds will go into the production of the album and with that being said If we do not reach the goal then I will use the funds to release singles until I save up enough money to produce the full album. Check out the perks section to see what is in it for you!!

The Impact

Music is something that brings people together, it is the one true universal language. Music can make you feel better on a bad day or be the soundtrack to a good night hanging with friends. I believe in the music and songs I have created. I have poured my own personal experiences and feelings into the songs I have written and would love to be able to share that with others. I have never personally released music on a professional level but have played my songs for family and friends with positive reactions. I am a believer that a good song can make the world a little bit brighter of a place, which is something we can all use right about now.

Risks & Challenges

The music industry and a career in music are often thought of as an "impossible" hurdle to jump. I am aware that while there is truth in this statement, you have to start somewhere if you believe in your own dreams. My dreams are not to be the next country superstar, my dreams are to produce music that others enjoy and I enjoy making in the process. I am taking the first step to make my dreams come true and if I can make this album a success then I have already succeeded the beginning of my goal. The largest challenge I am facing right now is a financial one, and that is why I am asking for your help. I don't know much about how hard it is to succeed in the music industry but what I do know is, as a small town West Virginian I believe in myself, and I believe that my music will be something everyone will enjoy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are hard right now and I know that financial help is not something everyone will be able to give. That being said, another way you can help me is to share my posts, come out to gigs (when we can gave them again) , and tell others about both my campaign and my music. I don't want to become an overnight success, I want to earn it. That all starts with the help of you. Thank you so much and God Bless.

The largest challenge I am facing right now is a financial one, and that is why I am asking for your help. I don't know much about how hard it is to succeed in the music industry but what I do know is, as a small town West Virginian I believe in myself, and I believe that my music will be something everyone will enjoy. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Times are hard right now and I know that financial help is not something everyone will be able to give. That being said, another way you can help me is to share my posts, come out to gigs (when we can gave them again) , and tell others about both my campaign and my music. I don't want to become an overnight success, I want to earn it. That all starts with the help of you. Thank you so much and God Bless.

story:
Hola todos nosotros somos Lion reggae más conocidos por nuestros álbumes Tierra, Siente, La Vida Llora entre otros ... Algunos de nuestros Hits incluyen canciones como Cuando Pienso En ti, Tu Belleza, Te Fuiste, Luna y Mucha Fuerza.

Hemos hecho colaboraciones con grandes exponentes de la música y tocado en algunos de los festivales más importantes de Sur América y ahora estamos aquí para hacer una colaboración contigo, esta será la experiencia más emocionante que jamás habremos hecho.

En estos 10 años de carrera como artistas independientes de cualquier disquera este será nuestro primer álbum de estudio. Los fans han sido quienes nos han apoyado todo este tiempo y quienes han apreciado nuestra visión de la música, por eso decidimos usar la plataforma Indiegogo para darle la oportunidad a ustedes y cualquier persona en el mundo de ser parte de este proceso. Indiegogo es una página que se ha vuelto como un trampolín para las mentes creativas, una plataforma sorprendente donde la gente crece apoya y cree en diferentes proyectos e ideas creativas para que se hagan realidad.

Fieles a nuestras raíces en la música reggae, en este nuevo álbum vamos sin límites, también incorporamos elementos del R&B, El Funk, Soul y mas estilos de la música actual. Nos gusta experimentar y evolucionar,  pensamos que de esta forma  podemos llegar a mas corazones y compartir el arte y nuestra manera de interpretarlo, a estos ritmos le llamamos riddims.

 ¿Qué es lo que hemos hecho? ¿Qué hay que hacer?

Basta ya de batallas nosotros con este nuevo álbum no buscamos luchar contra nadie en ninguna escena ni en ningún género lo que queremos es algo de reggae y algo que nunca hayamos hecho antes que estamos aquí para ustedes por primera vez en la historia Lion Reggae presenta su primer disco de estudio.

En estos últimos tres años nos hemos preparado para hacer canciones increíbles, estudiando en la universidad y aprendiendo con algunos de los mejores maestros en nuestra área, tocando con los mejores músicos que conocemos hemos llegado hasta 11 Personas girando internacionalmente Sin embargo, todas nuestros discos o por lo menos el 90% los hemos grabado con nuestros propios equipos y nuestros propios recursos. Además con ello siempre Preocupándonos por el Mastering, realizado en las prestigiosas instalaciones de Anchor estudios en Kingston Jamaica.

Aquí está la parte más interesante, estamos ahora en un proceso donde queremos ir atrás, explorar en el pasado a través de las raíces de la música para tocar las fibras de sus corazones. En este proceso lo que hemos creado es real. Por eso siempre hemos buscado Lo mejor, siempre hemos creído en lo que hacemos y por eso es que luchamos, y aquí estamos haciendo este proyecto contigo.

Tendremos fantásticos artistas con los que colaboramos en este disco amigos como Quique Neira, Alerta Kamarada y Afaz Natural, quienes nos han bendecido con sus talentos y su  apoyo. Lo mejor son los artistas que nos falta anunciar, más colaboraciones para ustedes solo por aquí en indiagogo. 

Hacemos este CrowdFunding  para ayudar a financiar la grabación, producción, mezcla, mastering, prensa y distribución de este nuevo álbum, trabajaremos con grandes productores y músicos con quienes lograremos un gran resultado.

 

Así que aquí van los regalos, por tu apoyo hemos querido ofrecerte algunos premios especiales tienes la oportunidad por tu contribución de elegir diferentes paquetes, desde ser el primero en tener el nuevo álbum y descargarlo desde tu propia casa, una Usb con las caras de cada uno de nosotros, cargadas de fotos y material de Lion, o participar con un pase Vip en 5 show de la banda en cualquier parte del mundo, Tenemos una camiseta exclusiva de Lion reggae para ti, o que tal una sesión de skype con nosotros hablando de nuestras experiencias de vida o lo que tu quieras saber, también podrás tener la guitarra donde Camilo  mas conocido como Lion a escrito todas sus canciones y si deseas autografiada para ti! Te invitamos a darle un vistazo a las columnas del lado derecho para ver cada detalle de los premios disponibles para ti.

                

Gracias por tu apoyo sincero recuerda que si no puedes donar para recibir tus premios, puedes ayudarnos a contarle a más gente, regar la voz y  que muchas mas personas se enteren de este gran proyecto, gracias somos Lion Reggae y los queremos mucho.

story:
Hey, I'm Jordan

I'm a songwriter based in Long Beach, CA and I'm making a record called "The Radio and the Sea." This EP is going to be an indie pop record with ambient, electro pop, electric guitar driven pop rock, and stripped down acoustic folk, all beautifully produced by Mitch Davis of Soularium Sound Studios in Utah. 

My journey to making this record is a strange one. Just last year, I received my Master’s degree in classical voice from New England Conservatory. Along with my classical singing background, I've performed in musical theater productions, mostly on the east coast. An indie pop record may seem like quite a jump from those styles of music, but those experiences all play a huge role in my songwriting and performance style. 

This past year, I've had the wonderful opportunity of raising my baby girl while my wife went to work at her day job. I wrote songs and took care of baby during the day, and taught voice lessons at night. Since January, I've finished a song a week, and I’ve gone through the agonizing process of picking only six of those for this record.

The Radio and the Sea

I found a common theme while working on these songs that made it onto "The Radio and the Sea:" they all have to do with distance. The pain that comes from leaving something or someone behind, the excitement of moving on to something new, or the dull ache of a stale relationship. 

I've poured everything I've got into these songs, and I brought an incredible team of people on board to make this record the best it can be. I recorded part of the record at Izotope's studio in Cambridge with Recording Engineer Matt Carlson.

The rest of the record I recorded at Soularium Studios, under the direction of Mitch Davis, who is producing the entire EP. This man does incredible work, and you should definitely check out the other projects he has worked on and will be releasing in the future. 

We had a blast working on this music. The variety of genres in the EP made each song unique and exciting to work on. Mitch was up to the task, having worked in the past with some well known rock bands like Periphery and Sherwood, as well as pop artists like Madilyn Page and David Archuleta.

Although I've finished all the recording on my end, there's plenty left to do for this EP. Mitch is currently mixing the record, and I'm working on marketing, graphic design work, press, and looking for opportunities to get this music in TV and film. "Radio and the Sea" will be available sometime in October.

How You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to donate, you can help this record by sharing the campaign on social media! Indiegogo makes it easy, just click the links here on the site, write a little personal note, and BOOM! You’ve just done your good deed of the day. But also feel free to donate if you are able :)

A project like this in reality costs well over the $3,000 listed for the campaign, but I believe in this project and I will put the rest of the money required towards it.

  1. Recording, Mixing, and Mastering - this is the largest expense of the project. I believe in paying musicians fair wages for the exceptional work they do, and we've got some amazing musicians helping with this record.
  2. Marketing- Costs for advertising and getting this EP into the hands of people in the music industry, especially for placement in TV and film.
  3. Media Content- This includes hiring a graphic designer to work on the album cover, as well as getting some professional photographs for this campaign and to promote the release of the EP.

The End

Thanks so much for checking out my campaign. It means so much to me that you would even read this to the very end! Thank you for supporting me and my music, and I can’t wait to share this EP with you!

story:
Hi, I'm Jess Goggans from Fort Payne, Alabama.  I've been playing all across the southeastern United States at all kinds of venues, from small solo gigs to large festivals, and loving every minute of it.

 

I'm starting this campaign to record my first produced album and videos.  My goal is to bring my music to a nation-wide audience.

Your contributions will help to get me in front of that larger audience, with the best band, studio producers and film crews.

I've set my campaign goal at ten thousand dollars.  Seventy percent of that is for the time in the recording studio, from tracking to final mastering.  The remainder is for licensing, distribution, pressing, and promotional  materials and videos.

I've set up multiple levels for contributing, with perks ranging from pre-release digital downloads all the way up to an executive producer credit on the album.  Whichever level you contribute at, you have my heartfelt thanks and appreciation.

Make no mistake about it, this album is going to be released and all of the perks will be delivered on time, whether I make my target goal for this campaign or not.

 

I've already started to work.  I've recruited the best musicians and performers from the southeast to build an amazing creative line-up for this project. And while I've had a good sustained career as a performer to this point, and have played with lots of talented musicians, this new band takes my music to a higher plateau.  I'm excited and can't until you hear what we've been getting in our sessions.  Solid, powerful, and soulful FUNK.  I know you're gonna love listening to it as much as I and the band all are making it!

Even if you cant contribute, your support is welcomed and appreciated.  Come to our shows, like me on Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter and share me with your friends.  Whether it's by word of mouth, social media, or the Indiegogo share tools, it's all good!

story:
Communist Daughter has spanned a decade.  We’ve lived through 10 years of tours, playing shows with Jason Isbell to Billie Eillish, Temples to Sturgill Simpson.  Now we are reaching out all the way from the Arctic Circle, with our latest album "Unknown Caller."  The only way we can continue to make music from so far north is with your direct support.

Our latest journey to the edge of the world took us off the road just as we garnered our most national acclaim. Johnny and Molly bowed out of the relentless touring schedule and moved first to San Diego to care for aging family, and then to their new home above the Arctic Circle.  Now making their home in a remote village in the Alaskan tundra they’re reaching out with Communist Daughter once more, to fans across the world. Just as the first album was born out of a “goodbye” to a life lived with drugs and deteriorating mental health, their latest album comes full circle as they once again say goodbye.  This time Johnny walks away from touring and the industry model, again for mental health and a shot at a new musical life.

And just like the first time, Communist Daughter chooses to say goodbye in song. They return to the things that made them break out artists in 2010, private songs that speak to letting go and moving on, and a bittersweet longing for the life they couldn’t live anymore.  "Unknown Caller" is the bookend to their 2010 debut "Soundtrack to the End." The new Communist Daughter album takes their songs out of the basement recordings where it all started, to fully orchestrated productions featuring strings from  the Laurel String Quartet (Father John Misty, Dessa,) & Andy Thompson (Belle & Sebastian, Jeremy Messersmith) as well as horn arrangements from Stephen Chen (San Fermin.)  Once again they collaborated with Kevin Bowe (Replacements, Porcupine) while remembering where they started by pulling tracks from the intimate recording sessions in Johnny & Molly's own bedroom.

It's true, the magic of the internet gives us unlimited music and unprecedented access to artists, all it requires is for musicians to appear live on stage night after night to fund their art.  Unfortunately, some musicians have to choose between their mental health and their musical career. So here we are, after turning down labels and tours at the height of our career, we send you a direct love letter, and ask for you to be a part of making Communist Daughter stretch into a new decade.  With your help, we can give you our third album “Unknown Caller,” on our 10th anniversary. - CD 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let’s get transparent.  Putting out an album takes quite a bit of seed money, even at a very scaled back level.  We’ve put together a basic budget, with two funding tracks, one on the national stage, and one at a much more private level, that show you exactly where the money will go:

Fixed costs:

$8,500 : Remaining recording costs paying studios and producers and engineers

$3,500 : Vinyl Manufacturing cost (Noiseland Industries)

$1000 : Tshirt / merchandise production cost (Fledgling Press design, Afternoon Printing)

$500 : Shipping costs (material/postage) for backers 

-----

Variable costs:

$500 : FB/Insta promotions for campaign visibility

$5000 : PR costs: 

  • $500 : Press photos, (Photographer cost, production cost) 
  • $3000 PR company for single / video releases, marketing,  
  • $1500 Digital PR (ad’s, website updates, digital marketing)

$4000 : Video production (2-3 videos created at bare minimum costs…)

-------

20% of total for operating costs (platform fees, management and legal costs, licensing costs) 

 

Total = $28,000


-------

Track 2 -

Our Initial Goal = $10,000

 

At $10,000 we can pay:

$4,000 - almost ½ the recording cost invoices

$3500 - Vinyl Manufacturing cost

$1000 - Merchandise manufacturing cost

$500 - Shipping costs for all backer orders

$500 - FB/Insta Ad cost for promotion of Indiegogo campaing

$500 - 5% Indiegogo platform fee 

Any music videos, PR, and management/legal fees will be paid after we reach the first 10k funding goal or paid out of our pockets.

 

What You Get

This is a very limited release. This LP will only be physically released on a colored short run Vinyl. People always ask if we will ever have the white vinyl version of "Soundtrack to the End" again, and the answer is always no.  Just like that, this is your only chance to own the first press colored Vinyl.

Besides this exclusive vinyl, we have equally exclusive merchandise only available through this campaign.

Including:

  • The Unknown Caller T Shirts designed from woodblock carving artist Melissa Schlobohm of Fledgling Press
  • Access to the last remaining classic t shirts, because when they sell they are gone.
  • Your chance to pick a song recorded live on video just for you.
  • Merchandise bundles of previous vinyl and CD’s no longer available in stores (or on the internet.)
  • And personal gifts from the band, like handwritten lyrics, original copies of test presses, video messages and more.

With each target, Communist Daughter will release new videos of Johnny & Molly all the way from Alaska, and exclusive B-sides and demos spanning the last 10 years.

 

The most important part of this campaign is the impact you can have on our future:

The reality is that the only way that Communist Daughter can continue to make music now that Johnny and Molly have stopped touring is with your direct support.  

Step outside the new music model and let your values match your spending so that Communist Daughter’s music moves into the next decade.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we totally understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share the campaign on your social media so that others can learn about us
  • Click like, comment, subscribe and interact with us to let us know how important Communist Daughter’s music is in your life.

Thank you, from Johnny, Molly, Adam, Al, Steve, Dillon and all of the rest of the Communist Daughter team.

$500 - Shipping costs for all backer orders
$500 - FB/Insta Ad cost for promotion of Indiegogo campaing
$500 - 5% Indiegogo platform fee 
Any music videos, PR, and management/legal fees will be paid after we reach the first 10k funding goal or paid out of our pockets.
 
What You Get
This is a very limited release. This LP will only be physically released on a colored short run Vinyl. People always ask if we will ever have the white vinyl version of "Soundtrack to the End" again, and the answer is always no.  Just like that, this is your only chance to own the first press colored Vinyl.
Besides this exclusive vinyl, we have equally exclusive merchandise only available through this campaign.
Including:

The Unknown Caller T Shirts designed from woodblock carving artist Melissa Schlobohm of Fledgling Press
Access to the last remaining classic t shirts, because when they sell they are gone.
Your chance to pick a song recorded live on video just for you.
Merchandise bundles of previous vinyl and CD’s no longer available in stores (or on the internet.)
And personal gifts from the band, like handwritten lyrics, original copies of test presses, video messages and more.

With each target, Communist Daughter will release new videos of Johnny & Molly all the way from Alaska, and exclusive B-sides and demos spanning the last 10 years. The most important part of this campaign is the impact you can have on our future:
The reality is that the only way that Communist Daughter can continue to make music now that Johnny and Molly have stopped touring is with your direct support.  
Step outside the new music model and let your values match your spending so that Communist Daughter’s music moves into the next decade. Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, and we totally understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share the campaign on your social media so that others can learn about us
Click like, comment, subscribe and interact with us to let us know how important Communist Daughter’s music is in your life.

Thank you, from Johnny, Molly, Adam, Al, Steve, Dillon and all of the rest of the Communist Daughter team.

story:
My Story

For as long as I can remember, I've been playing and writing music. Trying to find your voice as an artist can be quite difficult, but I think I have finally arrived at that place where I'm confident in what I want to say and how I want to say it. This batch of songs that I hope to release are the best songs I've ever written. They are honest, vulnerable, and at times uncomfortable. They speak to the every day existence we go through. They wrestle through topics of dreams, ambition, regret, race, and family. My goal is that these songs would help reintroduce us to our shared humanness. 

My intention is not to write just another worship or CCM album. I have no interest in joining the white noise. I am however fascinated by the prospect that songs can create a shared language among people. That though we might have different experiences, we can all relate to the same piece of art. I'm drawn to how art can re-mystify the seemingly ordinary world that we live in. That's my goal as a songwriter and that's what I hope this project accomplishes. 

What Is Needed

For this project, I'm hoping to raise $5000. This will cover:

  • The cost of production
  • The cost of hiring musicians to play on the project
  • Artwork & Branding
  • Merch
  • Advertising

What You Get:

My hope is that this wouldn't be something you give towards, only to feel like you're on the outside looking in. Rather, I want this to feel like a community project. With that said, I've made a series of "perks" that I believe will help create that sense between myself, my team, and you. I don't believe this project is just my story, but our story.

 

Thank you so much for partnering with me to make this dream a reality.

story:
Short Summary

Zion Radio Group LLC is a company that was created to own and operate Christian Radio Stations in the United States of America.  As a company we believe Christian Radio is a broadcast media that does not serve the younger Christian listener, and we are in existence to serve that demographic.  The two popular formats in the Christian radio arena focus on adults who are 35 and older.

Christian radio loses the young adult radio listener because they focus on that older demographic.  According to Barna, the church loses about 80% of the young adults after high school for about half of them to come back to the church in their 30's.  We at Zion Radio Group believe a radio station that serves the younger demographic could help reduce some of these loses.

Zion Radio Group has designed a Christian music format that can rival the secular stations that a number of our Christian youth listen to.   The format will be a combination of dance oriented Contemporary Christian music mixed with Urban Gospel music and Christian Rap music.  This format will be a Christian version of the Contemporary Hits radio stations that are popular in America today.

We are looking for the help of our potential listener base to help us purchase our first station in the Columbus, Ohio radio market.  It will take 10,000 people giving $100 dollars to help us reach our ultimate goal.  We feel we need at least $500,000 as seed capital to purchase a radio station, while $1,000,000 will make our goal more reachable.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To purchase a radio station that will serve the Columbus, Ohio area it will cost between 1 million and 3 million dollars.  This will allow us to purchase an FM radio station that will serve a majority of the Central Ohio area.  To get this money we have setup this crowdfunding campaign.

This campaign is tiered into different giving levels.  For each level there is a gift we will give you; thanking you for your contribution.

   -  $25: Zion Radio Water Bottle

   -  $50: Zion Radio Coffee Mug

   - $100: Zion Radio Travel Mug

   - $150: Zion Radio Tee Shirt

   - $200: Zion Radio Tee Shirt and 2 mins of ad time (Once we purchase a station) 

  - $500: Zion Radio Tee Shirt and 15 minutes of air time (Once we purchase a station)            

 

The 15 minutes of air time will allow a person who has a ministry, or a music band, or a business a chance to spend time on the air talking about what they do.  The person who gets this time must remember that the station will be Christian formatted.

About 90% of the monies collected will go toward the purchase of the radio station.  A portion of the funds go to this website company for their services.  Another portion will go to the agency that collects the monies, and a portion will go to the gifts we are giving.

Risks & Challenges

Once we collect the necessary money, we then have to solicit and negotiate with local radio companies to purchase a radio station.  There is a chance that these companies will not sell, or they will price their stations at an unreasonable price, but we feel there are a couple of stations, in this market, that can be bought at a good price.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We at Zion Radio Group, LLC are looking forward to your help in this campaign.  Along with money donations we are also looking for your help getting the word out for others to donate.  Post an announcement on your Facebook, Linkedin,  your Twitter account.  You can also pass the word on by word of mouth. 

We thank you for all you do for this campaign.

story:
We must reach the goal of 35k by May 4th...

(even if you just contribute $5, it will help me reach my goal)

Howdy! My name is Muck Sticky. I am an independent musician from Memphis, TN. When I began making music in 1999, it was strictly for my own enjoyment because music makes me feel good. Period. Then I shared it with my best friend Dennis, and he loved it. So I started sharing my songs with a few other friends, and they all started telling me my songs make them feel good too! I realized this was my life’s purpose: to make other people feel good with music. And to motivate people to follow their dreams, and live a positive, productive life.

I grew up in a lower-middle class income family, and we live in a pretty tough neighborhood. After my parents got divorced when I was 14 years old, I started working various manual labor jobs to support my mom and sister. And when I began making music, I spent every extra dollar that didn’t go toward our bills on new music gear, recording equipment, blank CD's so I could burn copies of my songs for my friends, flyers for my shows, and whatever else I needed to get the music out there.

In 2004 I released my first full-length album “The Nifty Mervous Thrifty”. Since then I’ve self-produced and released 14 albums, manufactured and personally distributed thousands of CD's, booked and performed thousands of live concerts, and released 40 professional quality music videos, all without ever having to be in debt or under the control of a record label. It’s just been my family, my friends, my fans, and me this whole time...


I've dedicated my life to music, and am beyond thankful for the ability to be creative. After fifteen years of never taking a single day off from being my own manager, booking agent, record label operator, publicist, show promoter, production coordinator, advertiser, accountant, studio engineer, video producer/director/editor, graphic/web designer, social media manager, and every other job that goes along with running a musical business, I’ve decided to reach out to my friends all over the world for help. This is my first time doing an online-sourced project, and I put it together myself. Music is my only source of income, and my only means of supporting my family.

I recently had some health issues due to the extreme amount of stress that goes with carrying the entire load of my business on my shoulders, and funding everything out of my own pocket for the last fifteen years. And I am overwhelmed by the amount of love and concern y’all have shown me on Facebook and all of my other social media sites. I can’t run this whole thing myself anymore, but I also can’t afford to pay anyone to help me. I just barely keep the bills paid as it is. If we can reach our goal or surpass it, I will not only be able to successfully release this album, but we will also be able to significantly increase the future productivity level here in the Muck Sticky world.

What We Need & What You Get

Most artists on a label have an entire team of people who get paid to handle their business for them, and the label also supports the artists with financial backing. The average budget for most major label artists to record, mix, manufacture, promote and distribute an album is $100k-$300k. Not to mention a large budget for touring support, merchandise manufacturing costs, and the countless other expenses that accompany the release of a successful album.

Now, after fifteen years of recording and releasing albums on my own, I am planning to release my 15th album “Dang!” on 5-15-15. And recently a few record labels have begun to take interest in me. I have already funded most of the recording of this album myself, so I don’t want to give it up to a label. I just can’t do it! They might make me stop wearing my pajama pants!!!

As many of you know, I have been wearing pajama pants as my public attire for more than 4,650 days. I started wearing pajamas in public and on stage right from the very beginning, but it became a permanent style when my best friend Dennis passed away about two years into my career. He told me I should always be comfortable, and never change my style for anyone. All I need is the support of my friends! And that way I can keep being independent, and I don’t have to give a record label the vast majority of the money generated from the music I’ve put my blood, sweat, tears, and money into since I got started over 15 years ago. Here is how you can help me stay independent









  • Private online hour-long video concert/web chat with you and as many of your friends you can fit in front of your computer screen + 1 physical autographed copy of the new CD “Dang!” (Backer exclusive cover art) + 1 Wristband + 1 Sticker + 1 autographed thank you card

  • The ONE AND ONLY 4-foot tall, 1 inch thick foam core 2-D Orange Hat display used in live shows since 2007 and also feature behind me in the “High Times” music video + 1 physical autographed copy of the new CD “Dang!” (Backer exclusive cover art) + 1 Wristband + 1 Sticker + 1 autographed thank you card

  • The ONE AND ONLY orange & purple coat worn by me in the “Thingy Thing” music video + a special post on my social media sites about you + a phone call from me thanking you for being such a strong supporter + 1 handwritten lyric sheet from the song “Thingy Thing + your name listed in the “producer” credits of the “Dang!” CD + 1 physical autographed copy of the new CD “Dang!” (Backer exclusive cover art) + 1 Wristband + 1 Sticker + 1 Autographed Muck Sticky thank you card

  • $3500 – (1 available) - Your voice will be recorded online and it will be featured in a song on my new album “Dang!” (I will incorporate your name and voice into the lyrics in a fun, friendly way) (Must be your actual name or nickname/artist name) + 1 physical autographed copy of the new CD “Dang!” (Backer exclusive cover art) + 1 Wristband + 1 Sticker + 1 autographed thank you card

  • $7500 – (1 available) - I will personally fly in to the nearest major city with a major airport closest to your town, and you will come hang with me all day, we will go out to dinner, and hang for a private acoustic guitar jam afterward. You can show me all the cool spots in your town to party in pajamas! I might even come over to your house and hang for a bit...if you don’t creep me out too bad! ;) (Must live in the lower 48 states)

  • $10,000 – (1 available) - Wrapped duplicate Muck Sticky van (as seen in numerous videos and used on tour from 2006-2013) with your name added into the wrap – You pick up in Memphis, TN (travel to Memphis not included). I will also hang with you for a while and tell you lots of crazy stories about things that happened in the original Sticky Van. Or for $15,000 I will personally deliver it to your house in my pajama pants! (Must live in the lower 48 states)

If you want to make a larger donation, contact us directly and we will figure out a custom perk package for you!

The Impact

Over the years, I’ve had countless friends ask me how they can help get my music and message heard around the world. Since I’ve never had a “single” on the radio, I basically just ask people to share the music with their friends. And if that’s all you can do, then please just share this with your friends. I will still appreciate you just as much, and give you a big hug the next time I see you. But in order to make this album be the best it can possibly be, I need to alleviate some of the stress and financial worries that my family and I have had these past fifteen years, and for once in my career have a “budget” to work with. I’ve never been able to make an album with complete freedom from worrying about how to release it successfully.  Which, as an artist, is a huge mental challenge.

I’ve also personally paid for the production costs of the 40 professional quality music videos we’ve done since 2004. The filming, editing, graphic design, special effects, and everything else has pretty much all been done by me and a few friends with no budget, yet we’ve managed to release them successfully and we currently have over 15 million views online.


In 2012, I took on my largest project to date by writing/producing/directing/starring in a movie called "Muscadine Wine" with my mom and my friends. It's a 60 minute long feature film, and we made it for less than $1,000. But we've never released it publicly due to lack of budget/distribution. Here is the trailer...


We would also like to make a documentary soon, but that depends on the success of this campaign. Instead of going to a big major record label and taking on huge amounts of debt, I’ve decided to reach out to y’all and simply ask for your support to help Muck Sticky stay independent and successfully release my music and videos worldwide. But I am not asking you to help me without getting anything back. I’ve set up various levels starting at $1, with some great rewards coming to you in return. And EVERY SINGLE contribution will be greatly appreciated! You will be able to help me make the best possible music I can make, and we will be able to promote/distribute this album around the world without having to be under the control of a big corporate record label and be in debt to them for years and years to come.

Instead, I will keep 100% control and ownership of my music, and the money generated will go toward furthering this musical journey. How well we do in this campaign will determine the future of this musical journey. We are doing flex-funding, so there is no limit on how much we can raise! The more we raise, the bigger and better the future of Muck Sticky can be!

If my music has made you feel good, please contribute and share this page with your family, friends, and anyone you know who might want to help keep the music alive. I just want to help people smile, feel good, and enjoy life to the fullest by sharing my happy music. By donate to this campaign and sharing it with others, you will help the world will become a brighter place!

Reasons, Answers & Advantages

I keep it real. I am always honest. If you have any questions about helping me achieve this goal, or just want to know how I came up with the name "Muck Sticky", feel free to ask. We will post updates frequently.

  • Most artists normally don't have the majority of their album recorded when they start a campaign like this, but I do. And I've already funded the recording process so that is out of the way. But I have no budget left for manufacturing, promotion, and distribution.
  • The funds from this campaign will go directly to promotion, distribution, and new music video production. Depending on how much we raise, this might even help us get started on the 16th album
  • Because of my recent health issues, I've been ordered by my physicians to take it easy on the business side of things. So that is why I am reaching out to you for help
  • You may have also seen some posts recently from my friends Chad and Doug. Chad has officially taken over the duties of handling my online world, and Doug is now the official manager of Muck Sticky. Together they will be taking over the business side of things so I can get back to just making good music. After 15 years, I now have a really strong team working for me. But right now, I don't even have a budget to buy them lunch.
  • According to our statistics, we have over 150,000 social media friends. If each one of y'all only gave a dollar, that would ensure I keep 100% control of my music forever
  • You can contribute $1, or a bazillion dollars. Everything helps and is greatly appreciated!
  • If you've ever purchased merchandise from Muck Sticky, you know that I personally autograph and ship the packages directly from my house. And I always add in a few extra goodies to sweeten the deal. 
  • If you would like to donate at a higher level, but don't see a perk you would enjoy, let me know and we will figure out a way to come up with something exclusive for you!

Why I need your help

Many of you might be wondering why I need a budget to release this album. Most artists at this stage in their career have a record label or a personal financial backer who helps cover their recording and promotional costs. And most artists in the music industry have a $100k-$300k budget to spend on recording, CD manufacturing, and to hire a publicist to run a 4-6 month ($2k-$5k/month) promotional campaign for each album and expose their music to the world. Muck Sticky has never had any of that. For the first time in my career I am asking my fans to help me obtain a budget to work with, even if it's a fraction of what most other artists have. Here is how the money will be used in this particular campaign...

$12,000 - 4 months of recording costs (studio time, daily expenses, etc)
$5,000 - CD Manufacturing
$4,000 - T-shirt Manufacturing
$8,000-$12,000 - Publicist/promotional campaign (4-6 months, $2k per month)
$2,000-$6,000 - Music video production (1-3 videos)

Although this budget may seem high to some of you, it's actually absurdly low compared to most musical artists. And that's because I am able to do most of this myself, and have been for the last fourteen albums. But there are still expenses that need to be covered that I can't cover myself. In the past I've always had to cover these expenses with my own budget and volunteer help from friends. For this album, I need a boost on the front end so I can have the same opportunity as most other artists have to successfully release an album. Thank you so much for contributing to the future of my music! Keep the good vibes circulating!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to donate, you can still help Muck Sticky music greatly!

  • Tell a friend or family member how much you love Muck Sticky music
  • Help us spread the word by becoming a member of Team Sticky. Send a direct email to MuckStickyTribe@gmail.com and we will add you as a team member of this campaign page
  • Share this page on your social networks (Facebook, Twitter, etc.), as well as email it to your contact list! Everyone needs a smile, and I'm sure they would appreciate you sending them one
  • Visit my official website www.mucksticky.com for hours of fun music and videos, and click "join the tribe" to become a member

And that's all there is to it. Thanks a bazillion! Let's raise a bazillion in the name of fun music! Keep the good vibes circulating! Much love! Stay lifted!

;) (Must live in the lower 48 states)



$10,000 – (1 available) - Wrapped duplicate Muck Sticky van (as seen in
numerous videos and used on tour from 2006-2013) with your name added into the
wrap – You pick up in Memphis, TN (travel to Memphis not included). I will also
hang with you for a while and tell you lots of crazy stories about things that
happened in the original Sticky Van. Or for $15,000 I will personally deliver
it to your house in my pajama pants! (Must live in the lower 48 states) 


If you want to make a larger donation, contact us directly and we will figure out a custom perk package for you!
    The Impact
Over the years, I’ve had countless
friends ask me how they can help get my music and message heard around the
world. Since I’ve never had a “single” on the radio, I basically just ask
people to share the music with their friends. And if that’s all you can do,
then please just share this with your friends. I will still appreciate you just
as much, and give you a big hug the next time I see you. But in order to make
this album be the best it can possibly be, I need to alleviate some of the
stress and financial worries that my family and I have had these past fifteen
years, and for once in my career have a “budget” to work with. I’ve never been
able to make an album with complete freedom from worrying about how to release
it successfully.  Which, as an artist, is
a huge mental challenge.I’ve also personally paid for the
production costs of the 40 professional quality music videos
we’ve done since 2004. The filming, editing, graphic design, special 
effects,
and everything else has pretty much all been done by me and a few 
friends with
no budget, yet we’ve managed to release them successfully and we 
currently have over 15
million views online. In 2012, I took on my largest project to date by 
writing/producing/directing/starring in a movie called "Muscadine Wine" 
with my mom and my friends. It's a 60 minute long feature film, and we 
made it for less than $1,000. But we've never released it publicly due 
to lack of budget/distribution. Here is the trailer...
We would also like to make a documentary soon, but that depends on the success of this campaign. Instead of going to a big major
record label and taking on huge amounts of debt, I’ve decided to reach out to
y’all and simply ask for your support to help Muck Sticky stay independent and
successfully release my music and videos worldwide. But I am not asking you to help me
without getting anything back. I’ve set up various levels starting at $1,
with some great rewards coming to you in return. And EVERY SINGLE
contribution will be greatly appreciated! You will be able to help me make the
best possible music I can make, and we will be able to promote/distribute this album around the
world without having to be under the control of a big corporate record label
and be in debt to them for years and years to come. Instead, I will keep
100% control and ownership of my music, and the money generated will go toward furthering this musical journey. How well we do
in this campaign will determine the future of this musical journey. We are doing flex-funding, so there is no
limit on how much we can raise! The more we raise, the bigger and better the future of Muck
Sticky can be! If my music has made you feel good, please contribute and share
this page with your family, friends, and anyone you know who might want to help keep
the music alive. I just want to help people smile, feel good, and enjoy life to the fullest by sharing my happy music. By donate to this campaign and sharing it with others, you will help the world will become a brighter place!
Reasons, Answers & Advantages
  I keep it real. I am always honest. If you have any questions about helping me achieve this goal, or just want to know how I came up with the name "Muck Sticky", feel free to ask. We will post updates frequently. 
Most artists normally don't have the majority of their album recorded when they start a campaign like this, but I do. And I've already funded the recording process so that is out of the way. But I have no budget left for manufacturing, promotion, and distribution. 

The funds from this campaign will go directly to promotion, distribution, and new music video production. Depending on how much we raise, this might even help us get started on the 16th album

Because of my recent health issues, I've been ordered by my physicians to take it easy on the business side of things. So that is why I am reaching out to you for help

You may have also seen some posts recently from my friends Chad and Doug. Chad has officially taken over the duties of handling my online world, and Doug is now the official manager of Muck Sticky. Together they will be taking over the business side of things so I can get back to just making good music. After 15 years, I now have a really strong team working for me. But right now, I don't even have a budget to buy them lunch.

According to our statistics, we have over 150,000 social media friends. If each one of y'all only gave a dollar, that would ensure I keep 100% control of my music forever
You can contribute $1, or a bazillion dollars. Everything helps and is greatly appreciated!
If you've ever purchased merchandise from Muck Sticky, you know that I personally autograph and ship the packages directly from my house. And I always add in a few extra goodies to sweeten the deal. 
If you would like to donate at a higher level, but don't see a perk you would enjoy, let me know and we will figure out a way to come up with something exclusive for you!


Why I need your help

Many of you might be wondering why I need a budget to release this 
album. Most artists at this stage in their career have a record label or
 a personal financial backer who helps cover their recording and 
promotional costs. And most artists in the music industry have a 
$100k-$300k budget to spend on recording, CD manufacturing, and to hire a
 publicist to run a 4-6 month ($2k-$5k/month) promotional campaign for 
each album and expose their music to the world. Muck Sticky has never 
had any of that. For the first time in my career I am asking my fans to 
help me obtain a budget to work with, even if it's a fraction of what 
most other artists have. Here is how the money will be used in this 
particular campaign...$12,000 - 4 months of recording costs (studio time, daily expenses, etc)$5,000 - CD Manufacturing$4,000 - T-shirt Manufacturing$8,000-$12,000 - Publicist/promotional campaign (4-6 months, $2k per month)$2,000-$6,000 - Music video production (1-3 videos)Although
 this budget may seem high to some of you, it's actually absurdly low 
compared to most musical artists. And that's because I am able to do 
most of this myself, and have been for the last fourteen albums. But there are still expenses that need to be 
covered that I can't cover myself. In the past I've always had to cover 
these expenses with my own budget and volunteer help from friends. For 
this album, I need a boost on the front end so I can have the same 
opportunity as most other artists have to successfully release an album.
 Thank you so much for contributing to the future of my music! Keep the good vibes circulating! 
    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't afford to donate, you can still help Muck Sticky music greatly!   Tell a friend or family member how much you love Muck Sticky music

Help us spread the word by becoming a member of Team Sticky. Send a direct email to MuckStickyTribe@gmail.com and we will add you as a team member of this campaign page
 Share this page on your social networks (Facebook, Twitter, etc.), as well as email it to your contact list! Everyone needs a smile, and I'm sure they would appreciate you sending them one
Visit my official website www.mucksticky.com for hours of fun music and videos, and click "join the tribe" to become a member
   And that's all there is to it. Thanks a bazillion! Let's raise a bazillion in the name of fun music! Keep the good vibes circulating! Much love! Stay lifted!

story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing 


  • We are Kingdom Choirs. We have an overwhelming desire to see a whole community of musicians step into their destinies as creatives. We've spent many sleepless nights in anticipation of building a space for our friends to come and create passionate, world changing music. We believe this campaign is the first step toward realizing our vision.  

  • This campaign is about building a recording studio for a whole community of artists. This will enable Kingdom Choirs and others to make records now and countless records in the future. 

  • We could not be more excited to be releasing an album that makes much of Jesus, and at the same time, has massive potential to help a whole community of musicians fulfill their destinies! Your contributions are going to shift the way records are made here in Springfield, MO. Let’s start with this small step and hope to effect music-making culture worldwide!


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $16k to complete this album and phase 1 of the studio project. Most of the $16k will go towards studio gear as the foundation of a high end studio. The funds will be distributed in these 6 categories:

    • Monitors - the speakers that the music is mixed on.


    • Microphones - you probably know what these are.


    • Ad/da Converters -the gear that gets the recordings into a computer.


    • Preamps / Console- the gear that makes microphones work and sound good.


    • Studio essentials - things like cables, mic stands, sound treatment, etc.


    • Merch for you guys - t-shirts, stickers, etc.

  • What's in it for you? Check out our perks on the right side of the screen. Grab a Kingdom Choirs' album and a digital download. Want your name in our album credits? You can do that too. You can even get some studio time in Kingdom Choirs’ studio for yourself or someone you love.

  • If we do not reach our full goal, the money raised will go towards gear choices that make the most sense for our community of artists. We will continually be focused on helping artist get their music out. All perks will still apply.


The Impact

  • This project really has the potential to breath life into our local music-making culture and could even become a music-making culture across the globe. We will be able to drive the cost for studio time way DOWN, and this will help artists get their music out. Here’s how we can charge MUCH less:


    • By crowdfunding the gear with our album pre-sales, there will be no extra gear cost for which to compensate.

    • The studio will be in Nathan’s basement (for phase one of the project) so there will be no extra facilities cost.

    • Nathan has 15 years in audio engineering and music production, and Isaac has a lifetime of experience writing and arranging music. So, there will be no extra engineer or producer fees. 

    • In order to produce a commercial release album artists will typically pay $5k-$50k and up depending on their specific needs. Since Kingdom Choirs will own the studio we will be able to charge a fraction of what it would normally cost for an artist to make a record.

  • It’s go time! Kingdom Choirs has always wanted to release music that envelopes hearts with God’s love and build a studio for artists to create their music-making destinies.


Risks & Challenges

  • There are inherent challenges with a campaign like this. The most foreseeable challenges are:

    • Being able to raise enough money for the idea to work.

    • Orchestrating logistics for booking artists in the studio at a low cost.  

  • These challenges are not insurmountable by any means. If needed, here’s how we plan to overcome these challenges:

    • We really do need to raise at least $16k, but if we cannot come up with this amount of funds there will be other possible, albeit less ideal studio scenarios. We will simply have to downgrade from professional audio gear to a “pro-sumer” or even consumer level technology. Will we still be able to make a record on this gear? Yes, but we prefer not to compromise quality. 

    • How will we book artists in the studio at a low cost? The studio will be open on a part-time basis in Nathan’s basement, and Nathan’s schedule is flexible enough to be able to accommodate the artists scheduling needs. The artist will only be charged on the basis of keeping the project studio sustainable.



Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know not everyone will be able to give money to this project, but you can help get the word out. If you think our idea is great, give us a shout out:

    • Click the “Share” links at the top left of the page and tell all your peeps about our project.

    • If you would like to host an event for Kingdom Choirs to talk about their vision or for other ways to get involved email us at: kingdomchoirs@gmail.com

Microphones - you probably know what these are.






Ad/da Converters -the gear that gets the recordings into a computer.

What's in it for you? Check out our perks on the right side of the screen. Grab a Kingdom Choirs' album and a digital download. Want your name in our album credits? You can do that too. You can even get some studio time in Kingdom Choirs’ studio for yourself or someone you love. 
If we do not reach our full goal, the money raised will go towards gear choices that make the most sense for our community of artists. We will continually be focused on helping artist get their music out. All perks will still apply.

This project really has the potential to breath life into our local music-making culture and could even become a music-making culture across the globe. By crowdfunding the gear with our album pre-sales, there will be no extra gear cost for which to compensate.
The studio will be in Nathan’s basement (for phase one of the project) so there will be no extra facilities cost.
Nathan has 15 years in audio engineering and music production, and Isaac has a lifetime of experience writing and arranging music. So, there will be no extra engineer or producer fees. 
In order to produce a commercial release album artists will typically pay $5k-$50k and up depending on their specific needs. Since Kingdom Choirs will own the studio we will be able to charge a fraction of what it would normally cost for an artist to make a record.

It’s go time! Kingdom Choirs has always wanted to release music that envelopes hearts with God’s love and build a studio for artists to create their music-making destinies.
