There are inherent challenges with a campaign like this. The most foreseeable challenges are: 

Being able to raise enough money for the idea to work. 
Orchestrating logistics for booking artists in the studio at a low cost.  

These challenges are not insurmountable by any means. If needed, here’s how we plan to overcome these challenges:

We really do need to raise at least $16k, but if we cannot come up with this amount of funds there will be other possible, albeit less ideal studio scenarios. We will simply have to downgrade from professional audio gear to a “pro-sumer” or even consumer level technology. Will we still be able to make a record on this gear? Yes, but we prefer not to compromise quality. 

How will we book artists in the studio at a low cost? The studio will be open on a part-time basis in Nathan’s basement, and Nathan’s schedule is flexible enough to be able to accommodate the artists scheduling needs. The artist will only be charged on the basis of keeping the project studio sustainable.





Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone will be able to give money to this project, but you can help get the word out. If you think our idea is great, give us a shout out:

Click the “Share” links at the top left of the page and tell all your peeps about our project. 
If you would like to host an event for Kingdom Choirs to talk about their vision or for other ways to get involved email us at: kingdomchoirs@gmail.com

story:
My name is Angie Zawada and I am a non-performing songwriter of inspirational, transcendent music -the message of my songs best expressed under my new banner of ‘JOY RISING UP’!  And of the 19 I have written over the past 15 years, including pieces for full choir, the production and release of 3 of them so far (www.angiezawada.com) has been pure joy for me, for many involved, and for many who have listened.

All thanks to you.  You funded bed tracks ($10,000 in 2006!), helped me produce a demo (2007), and even paid me back, by surprise, for my 1st full professional production (2011).  You helped me launch and run a small community choir from 2006 - 2009 and stood beside me when my efforts to record and produce failed. And in spite of having lost faith in myself for 2 years, and in that time, letting go of it all, you never lost faith in me and my music.  And so you cheered when I got up again and celebrated when one song, Coming to Love, finally went the distance to be fully produced -flowering into the vision I held for it and bringing more joy than I know.  This inspired the release of 2 more over the next 2 years -opening the door for everywhere to go from here.  All thanks to you, a great community spanning the East and West Coast -and some around the world.  Special thanks to the countless number of you who have stood by my side, especially Debra Polomeno.

And now with a clear path to do this, thanks to StudioPros in Los Angeles for the overall production and Boutique de Son in Montreal for the studio choir recordings, such as the choir for 'When I Call' and the choir for Be Still, I am now ready to go the distance, to move beyond 1 a year to putting 8 in motion, most that have been sitting there since 2005.  For the vision I have of each, for the joy and inspiration I believe they can bring, for the aliveness of the creative process and for the opportunity to collaborate with local artists (and more), I can't let them continue to sit there –in a binder, in a box, in the closet. Life is too short to continue to say 'one day'. Well 'one day' has arrived and thus this 'Joy Rising Up' campaign!

These are the songs I am ready for, the old binder dusted off!!! >> 4 choral pieces, 2 pop ballads, 1 up-tempo R&B + 1 song for a female trio.

It will cost $20,000 to produce these over 2 years (at least). Based on my first 3 productions, it is approx.. $2500.00CDN/ a song, with StudioPros in LA and Boutique de Son in Mtl.

Once each song is mastered: I will pitch it to publishing houses and major producers through agencies like www.taxi.com, through which my 2nd song, When I Call, was found for a major American, Female, Pop-Crossover artist.  I will also release it online, such as at www.angiezawada.com, SoundCloud and YouTube.

But the most important thing for me is producing the highest quality tracks possible, with the best vocalists I can find, to serve as little offerings of joy and inspiration in this wounded world longing for liberation -whether they reach the few or the many.  And it is in this spirit that I hope you will join me in riding this wave of ‘Joy Rising Up’!

What you'll get.  If you would appreciate a token beyond the warm fuzzies of knowing you helped make this joy rise up, I've got some perks for you that you are sure to love! These heart-crafted offerings, to nurture your body, your spirit AND the environment, are a small way of saying thank you -in alignment with what this campaign is about. 

ALL contributors will also be acknowledged in the post-production behind-the-scenes 'Joy Rising Up' iMovie, to capture the journey of the realization of all songs funded, mastered and released by this campaign -assuming at least $2500.00 has been raised to produce one.  This iMovie will cover the long, complex yet rewarding journey of carrying each of song from an idea into form (the arranging, notating, rehearsing, recording, mixing, mastering, and more...) -all thanks to you!

And if you would like to contribute but can't financially, that doesn't mean you can't help and won't be acknowledged (including in the video) and appreciated!  Getting the word out about this 'Joy Rising Up Campaign' would be a big help, including using the Indiegogo Share Tools!  Just let me know that you have done so!

So there is everywhere to go from here in this choice for Flexible Funding. Reaching even 10% of my goal is another song produced, which would otherwise not be possible at this time!

If I am blessed to reach this goal AND further blessed to surpass it...well I have 8 more songs sitting there -and 2 more on the horizon. I'm only getting started!!! Still to go:  2 Inspirational Pop songs: A Candle for You (2014), Planning a Big Surprise (2015 );  1 folk duet: Darshan (2005); 3 for Traditional Choir: Warm the World (1999) Nous sommes les enfants (2010), The Spell is Broken (2013); 2 for Gospel Choir: It's All Right (2005),  Still Here (2012);  The excess funds will go towards the next on the burner.

Thank you so much for riding this wave of Joy Rising Up with me, dedicated to inner peace and wellness, and the flowering of every creative vision still in one's head or under the bed.  Life is short! The time is now! No more waiting, excuses. Just do it!  JOY RISING UP!

story: This campaign has ended.
story_txt: This campaign has ended.

story:
In brief...

The Lunar Ensemble is a Baltimore-based new music collective that performs and presents music in ways that redefine today's concert experience, and we are entering our sixth season of thrilling new music in Baltimore, Maryland!

This season, we are proud to be the Ensemble-in-Residence at Baltimore War Memorial Arts Initiative, and we have some exciting events planned:

  • We are honored this season with a New Music USA grant to support our first concert, Old Text Woven New! This concert features premieres of new takes on Shakespeare, written by Baltimore-based composer Douglas Buchanan and Canadian composer David Passmore.
  • We're launching our Pitcher-Perfect Happy Hour series, in which we'll feature pairings of Baltimore's hip composers and hoppy beers!
  • Our final concert of the season is not to be missed: an exploration of the effects of PTSD on veterans of military service, it features a premiere of a new work by Joshua Bornfield, In the Light of Day, and Peter Maxwell Davies' Eight Songs for a Mad King. 

The goal...

We got a great start on funding our season from the wonderful organization New Music USA, who put $1500 toward our first concert of the season! Our aim is to triple that amount - our Triple-Dip initiative will thus provide us with $1500 toward each of our major concerts and $1500 toward our Pitcher-Perfect series.

These funds go directly to artists' fees, music rental and copying, and equipment rental - in other words, your contribution is what will make these concerts possible. And in return, we have a variety of ways we'd like to say thank you - just check out our fabulous perks!

Why Donate?

Maybe you love new music! Maybe you love us! Maybe you love making creative and exciting things happen in the world!
But if you're wondering, "Why support yet another ensemble's fundraising campaign?" we want to tell you what sets us apart.

We are interested in what so many in Baltimore are interested in - community-building. We're the first ensemble-in-residence at War Memorial, which is promising to rejuvenate the downtown arts scene in a way that hasn't yet happened. We are partnering with organizations to extend our reach beyond our already faithful fanbase - we want to help everyone in Baltimore get to hear awesome classical music in exciting ways. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign on your Facebook page, or tell a friend! And, we'd love to see you at the concerts this season!

story:
Short Summary

CH2 consists of Corneille Hutten and Leon Gropp, two slightly crazy guitarists that are NUTS and extremely passionate about music. We breath, sleep and eat music! We have a very unique style of play that has a very impressive visual impact, especially the Flamenco / Spanish and Instrumental Pop style that we focus on. We have been lucky enough to have won a couple of awards locally and abroad for our music, and have met some awesome musicians on our travels. We are so grateful and humbled by the opportunities we've had!

Our main goal is to break into the US and world market with a bang! Our album needs to sound absolute international quality and we would LOVE to mix this album by the best we can afford through this campaign. YOUR help in reaching this goal is appreciated beyond measure!

Our long term outlook is to travel the world with our impressive, unique CH2 style of play and perform in all the great halls our industry has to offer!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds gathered through this campaign will be used exclusively to pay for studio time during the recording process, mixing of the album as well as mastering. This album will consist of two discs: one with our own CH2 compositions (14 tracks) and another disc with mash-ups between the most well-known classical pieces in history, paired and played together with some of the most inspiring modern pop hits. The discs will also be released on all iTunes stores worldwide as well as MANY other mainstream music download websites.

To say thank you for your amazing help in raising funds for our crusade into the US and worldwide market, we would love to give you the world, but that might be a bit impractical... 

We created our own little system to show what you get for your valuable contribution. Apart from these prizes your name will also be included as a contributor in the "Thank You" section of these 2 discs:

-   $1 contribution will get you a personal Facebook message from CH2 on your Facebook wall to show how much we appreciate your time and support.

-   $5 contribution will get you a free download copy of the album of your choice that will be recorded through this campaign.

-   $25 contribution will get you a free digital copy of our South African Music Award winning album PING, and a free digital download of one of the discs that will be completed through this campaign.

-   $50 contribution will get you Level 1 plus a free digital download of the second disc completed through this campaign. That is three albums in total.

-   $100 contribution will get you Level 1 and 2 plus our remix album with French DJ Xavier for download and a copy of our live DVD called "CH2 Live" with a full symphony orchestra, signed by us personally.

-   $250 contribution will get you Level 1, 2 and 3 plus a signed CH2 leather strap for your or a friend's / relative's favourite guitar.

-   $500 contribution will get you Level 1, 2, 3 and 4 plus a signed CH2 hoodie.

-   $1000 contribution will include all the Level prizes plus a free performance by CH2 (travel and accommodation to be provided).

-   $2000 contribution will get you a personally autographed Yamaha guitar (nylon or steel) and courier the instrument to you. Hopefully some day our signature will be worth a lot more...! hehe

-   $2000 and above contribution will get you all of the above and a FAT kiss from us both... lol There is no limit so if you like what we do, please feel free to donate whatever you feel is the right amount for you. Every cent will be put to good use for our music career.

The Impact

We have worked so passionately for 15 years doing what we love, and we will never stop. This campaign's funding will however provide us with the necessary funding to create the two best discs we can, and to break through to the next level in the music industry, taking our music and unique style of play to the USA and other countries. This has been our lifelong dream and your contribution will be an invaluable step to help us achieve this goal. Please feel free to have a listen to some of our past projects and tracks at www.ch2.co.za - and connect with us on our social media. We would LOVE you as a fan!

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE help spread the word of CH2. Connect with us on Facebook, Twitter and Youtube and please ask all your friends and family to connect with us. We love having new fans and will keep on making music for as long as we can to make the world a better and happier place! :)

story:
He has a really lyrical way of playing that instrument, not quite like anyone else.”  – James Tormé (Vocalist, Jazz FM radio presenter, son of Mel Tormé )

His compositions and beats are both really strong. Beautiful flute performance on really good quality pop music. Not only the Smooth Jazz listeners, but also R&B music fans would enjoy his songs.
- Tom Coyne, Mastering Engineer (Michael Jackson, Ne-Yo, Sade, Beyoncé)

When I hear the flute, I think of meadows, flowers, ponds and trees … That perhaps explains why I still find the use of the flute in R&B and jazz to be so shocking. However, as Jef Kearns shows … this juxtaposition can be shockingly effective. - Soul Tracks.com


FIRST DAY OF MIXING COMPLETED!   Check it out:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/k3s4gX4D9js

WHO I AM

I'm likely not who would typically come to mind when you think of a best seller in Soul-Jazz and Contemporary R&B (a historical mark I made for the flute on Amazon.com with my sophomore album, Soulfisticated.)  The genres are usually dominated by saxophone and vocalists respectively.

I am a flautist who, as Detroit Jazz Magazine put it, “makes the flute speak the urban language of soul” with a sound “you normally don’t hear from flautists.” And who, as Smooth Jazz Therapy, a go-to site for smooth jazz reviews said is “dispelling the myth that flute players can’t do urban jazz.”

"Soulfisticated" sat directly between the #4 best seller Janelle Monáe‘s “The Electric Lady” and Whitney Houston‘s “Love, Whitney” on Amazon Japan’s R&B charts.

I learned to speak the language in the best way possible: immersion. Growing up listening to hip hop and R&B on Detroit radio in the 1990s, I was the quiet 10 year old riding the line of “loud enough to hear but not loud enough for my parents to catch me up so late” when basking in Kiss FMs late night quiet storm program “Kisses After Dark” and pressing record and rewind on my hip hop radio mixes.

More recently, a blog from Denmark called me "an unmistakable voice from an unmistakable talent."   James Tormé (vocalist, and son of jazz great Mel Tormé) said I have "a really lyrical way of playing that instrument, not quite like anyone else.” 

On this upcoming album my flute will be doing all the "talking" and trust me: I have a lot to say.  It is my first 100 percent instrumental album (tentatively titled, The Flute.)  It is also the flute album for people who don't think they like flute.

What I Need & What You Get

I have in large part funded the album out of pocket.   I need to record two more songs, and mix, and master the whole album.

1) Mixing (Noble Street Studios ... my last album was mixed there and it has housed artists such as Drake, The Weeknd, Barenaked Ladies etc.)

2) Mastering (Tom Coyne ... he has mastered all my music.   He's mastered for Michael Jackson, Neyo, Adele, Beyoncé, Kool and the Gang, Sade etc.)

3) Remaining recording and production fees.

I am offering my first and second album in digital or physical format with immediate digital delivery of the two buzz singles I have released for this album (Jazz Addiction, and Hurricane.)  

I have also come up with some creative perks such as recording "a song of your choosing on YouTube with a shout out or dedication",   listing you as one of the backers on the album release section on my website. etc.  Take a look!  :-)

And if you would like a perk that is not listed.  Please feel free to present me with the idea!

The Impact

I have listened to a lot of instrumental flute albums, and this one will be the first in history of its kind.   It is a true R&B album enabled by the unusually powerful and authoritative vocal quality of my playing  as well as the producers I am working with.

From the onset of my playing (at age 10) I wanted to create the perception of the flute of being an important voice in R&B as opposed to the pretty background noises it has long been delegated to.   This album is part of my journey to do so.  I am already long down the road, and need your "lift" to help me reach the destination.

The hard date for release is November in order that I can submit it for the Juno Awards "Instrumental Album of the Year" category.   The Juno Award is the most prestigious musical award in Canada.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help get the word out there please help me make some noise about my campaign!   There are lots of Indiegogo share tools!  And I would highly appreciate it.  

History Repeats Itself:


The soulful, melodic and eminently grooving flute master Jef Kearns brings a colorful background into a cool, sophisticated sound that blends the cutting edge of Soul and Hip Hop rhythms with explosive Jazz improvisations.

Kearns keeps his flute fresh and melodic, with improvisational brilliance up front as he delves into concepts that range from trippy and atmospheric to vibey and upbeat – and all inspiring destinations in between. Wildly soulful, truly sophisticated… Jef Kearns is SOULFISTICATED!
– Jonathan Widran (Music Journalist for All Music Guide, Huffington Post, Billboard, Jazziz, Downbeat etc.)

An authentic, fresh sound that brings modern R&B back to its roots.
– Soul in Stereo.com

Soulfisticated satisfies … Kearns’ development as an artist and visionary on this project is heartening, and should provide his growing legion of fans with much to like. And, just as importantly, the combination should please fans of sophisticated R&B who may hear Jef Kearns for the first time. Recommended”
– Soul Tracks.com

“Loving ‘Jazz Addiction’ – it speaks to the jazz lover (and the flute lover) in me. I spent the 70’s listening to Bobbi Humphrey and Herbie Mann , the 80’s listening to Dave Valentin and Kent Jordan and the 90’s and beyond listening to Hubert Laws, Kim Scott and Dwayne Kerr. So, I’m on board…”
– Chris Mann (Smooth-Jazz.de)

“We were impressed by Jef Kearns’ 2013 album Soulfisticated, one on which the flautist/songwriter merged jazz and soul in highly original and melodic fashion. He now returns with a cool single, “Jazz Addiction”, another sweet soul-jazz instrumental, one Herbie Mann would be proud to claim.”
- New Canadian Music.ca

What’s admirable about Jef Kearns’ 11-track album (Soulfisticated) is that there’s no need to skip through songs, as each song holds its own and flows well with one another from the very beginning until the last note played. While listening to the album, it’s recognized that much effort was put into crafting such beautiful work.

Musical enthusiasts will definitely enjoy every moment of Soulfisticated. It’s an album that takes jazz and R&B to another level.”

– Urbanology.com

story:
For almost 30 years, the Black Arts & Cultural Center (BACC) has been the catalyst in the Kalamazoo community and throughout West Michigan for developing potential and creativity in African American’s in the Kalamazoo area, advancing the awareness of Black artistic ability, preserving Black cultural heritage and enhancing interactions among diverse groups in the community.  The 2015 Kalamazoo Black Arts Festival (BAF) will be July 13 – July 19, 2015 . The BAF an annual celebration and sharing of African American art, culture, crafts, music, food and entertainers, with the community.

This year’s celebration consists of a full week of activities and is themed IGNITE the Community. 

We invite you to become a part of our Black Arts Festival Legacy Fund.  Donations made to this fund will help ensure that this year’s Festival is a success for Kalamazoo and surrounding areas.  With your donation to the Black Arts Festival Legacy Fund, you are contributing to the longevity of the unique and essential experience that the BACC provides for the Kalamazoo community and surrounding areas.  You may also visit our website at www.blackartskalamazoo.org and give your donation online. For your minimum donation of $30 or more you will be listed as a supporter and sponsor on the BACC website as well as in our weekly newsletter.

Your participation in our Black Arts Festival Legacy Fund will provide a valuable community service and experience for not only the Kalamazoo community, but all of West Michigan.

For more information, please contact me at info@blackartskalamazoo.org or (269) 349-1035.

story:
ONDATROPICA VOL.2

Welcome to the second volume of Ondatrópica´s story. We need your help through this fundraiser to bring our story to the next stage; consider this a digital “passing of the hat” in the internet age.

Our journey has two strands. The first takes us to the island of Providencia (an English speaking enclave of the Colombian Caribbean), for a week-long studio residency, where we will be exploring the connections between Anglo and Hispanic Caribbean music traditions, working with and recording alongside musicians from Providencia. The second, will be a set of more electric, recording sessions in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia and home to the new tropical-futurist scene. 

Providence Island

One side of Colombian musical culture that maybe most people are not aware of, can be found in the Caribbean islands of San Andrés and Providencia. This archipelago was an English colony until the 18th century, when it passed to the newly founded Republic of Colombia. Having kept Creole English as the principal dialect, and with strong commercial and ancestral ties with Jamaica, the sounds of the islands sway between calypso, mento, zouk and reggae. 

The Capital

Bogotá on the other hand has rapidly grown into the epicenter of a new Tropicalist experimental movement, with forward thinking bands that have one foot in tradition and the other in innovation. The sum and encounter of these two worlds will be sought. That is the goal of Ondatrópica, to serve as a crossroads and to allow for intimate encounters between creative musicians from different walks of life, be it from a small island or a big city. 

Past Steps

The great joy and achievements that Ondatrópica has brought us since embarking upon this musical roller coaster in 2012 have been many! We recorded an iconic first album treasured by many and established a live band, that has to date performed at around 70 locations in 20 countries. From mega festivals like Glastonbury and Roskilde, to squat parties in downtown Bogotá and sports stadiums in Mexico City, Ondatrópica has always been focused on showcasing the interaction of musicians from different styles, regions and generations - an ample serving from Colombia’s musical hot pot. 


The Next Step

We want you to join us in this adventure, accompanying Ondatrópica’s tradition and enterprise of tropical delight. Your help is VITAL, we wish for this record to be an achievement for us all. A new modern classic. There are plenty ways of ways you can help, choose the one that best suits you!  Ondatrópica continues to be an independent endeavor and it is for that reason we need your help.



---------------------------

Important Info on SHIPPING

*Please be aware that you need to add shipping costs. Please add to the final cost according to the list below. If you forgot to add the shipping costs we will contact you directly and you can pay the extra amount in this same platform.

CD or Vinyl or Photo Book or Print or Dubplate: 

10 USD Worldwide / 5 USD Colombia

Discolombia or Bomba tropica Rewards: 

30 USD Worldwide /15 USD Colombia

*All items shipped from COLOMBIA*
---------------------------

ONDATROPICA VOL.2

¡Bienvenidos al segundo volumen de Ondatrópica! uno que esperamos armar con su ayuda a través de esta campaña de financiación colectiva, o como diríamos en Colombia, una “vaca” digital. 

Si se preguntan de qué se trata este nuevo viaje, la respuesta tira para 2 lados. Uno: Buscar las conexiones entre el caribe Anglo e Hispano a través de una residencia de creación en la isla de Providencia, enclave angloparlante del caribe Colombiano. Y dos: Unas sesiones más eléctricas en que se acerquen a la movida tropical-futurista de Bogotá.

¿Por qué Providencia y Bogotá?

Una de las culturas musicales que tal vez no mucha gente fuera de Colombia conozca, es la de las islas de San Andrés y Providencia. Este archipiélago estuvo en manos Inglesas hasta el s.XVIII, cuando pasó a la nueva república de Colombia. Habiendo conservado el Ingles creole como lengua materna, y con fuertes conexiones comerciales y familiares con Jamaica, el sonido de la isla se mueve entre el calypso, mentó, reggae y zouk. 

Bogotá por otro lado se ha convertido en el foco de los nuevos experimentos tropicalistas, con proyectos de avanzada que tienen un pié en la tradición y el otro en la innovación. La sumatoria de estos dos ambientes es lo que busca Ondatrópica, servir de puente y propiciar encuentros.

Pasos Recorridos

Las alegrías y logros que ha dejado este laboratorio de creación tropical que empezamos en el 2012 han sido muchas; Grabamos un disco de antología atesorado por muchos y armamos una banda en vivo que ha tocado alrededor de 70 conciertos en 20 países. Desde escenarios gigantes como Glastonbury, hasta patios de La Candelaria, Ondatrópica se ha enfocado en mostrar la interacción de músicos de diferentes escenas, regiones y edades. Una radiografía del mestizaje musical colombiano.

Nuevos Caminos

Queremos que ustedes se monten en el viaje, apoyando este emprendimiento independiente que busca resaltar las conexiones entre sonidos, edades, estilos, y que ha sido el sello característico que Ondatrópica ha desarrollado. Su acompañamiento es CLAVE, queremos que entre todos armemos este nuevo clásico colombiano. Tenemos varias opciones, busquen la que más les guste! Ondatrópica continúa siendo un emprendimiendo INDEPENDIENTE a través de esta plataforma y gracias a ustedes podremos hacer realidad este disco. 


----------------------

Información Importante sobre ENVIOS

*Por favor tenga presente que hay que pagar gastos de envío. Por favor sume el valor final de acuerdo a la lista de abajo. Si usted olvidó pagar el envío, lo contactaremos directamente y usted podrá pagar el faltante en esta misma plataforma. 

CD o Vinilo o Libro de Fotos o Estampa o Dubplate: 

5 USD Colombia / 10 USD Resto del mundo 

Discolombia o Bomba tropica: 

15 USD Colombia / 30 USD  Resto del Mundo

*Todos los envíos desde COLOMBIA*

---------------------------

Having kept Creole English as the principal dialect, and with strong commercial and ancestral ties with Jamaica, the sounds of the islands sway between calypso, mento, zouk and reggae. 
The Capital
Bogotá on the other hand has rapidly grown into the epicenter of a new Tropicalist experimental movement, with forward thinking bands that have one foot in tradition and the other in innovation. The sum and encounter of these two worlds will be sought. That is the goal of Ondatrópica, to serve as a crossroads and to allow for intimate encounters between creative musicians from different walks of life, be it from a small island or a big city. 
Past Steps
The great joy and achievements that Ondatrópica has brought us since embarking upon this musical roller coaster in 2012 have been many! We recorded an iconic first album treasured by many and established a live band, that has to date performed at around 70 locations in 20 countries. From mega festivals like Glastonbury and Roskilde, to squat parties in downtown Bogotá and sports stadiums in Mexico City, Ondatrópica has always been focused on showcasing the interaction of musicians from different styles, regions and generations - an ample serving from Colombia’s musical hot pot. 

The Next Step
We want you to join us in this adventure, accompanying Ondatrópica’s tradition and enterprise of tropical delight. Your help is VITAL, we wish for this record to be an achievement for us all. A new modern classic. There are plenty ways of ways you can help, choose the one that best suits you!  Ondatrópica continues to be an independent endeavor and it is for that reason we need your help.

---------------------------Important Info on SHIPPING*Please be aware that you need to add shipping costs. Please add to the final cost according to the list below. If you forgot to add the shipping costs we will contact you directly and you can pay the extra amount in this same platform.CD or Vinyl or Photo Book or Print or Dubplate: 10 USD Worldwide / 5 USD Colombia
Discolombia or Bomba tropica Rewards: 30 USD Worldwide /15 USD Colombia
*All items shipped from COLOMBIA*
---------------------------


ONDATROPICA VOL.2
¡Bienvenidos al segundo volumen de Ondatrópica! uno que esperamos armar con su ayuda a través de esta campaña de financiación colectiva, o como diríamos en Colombia, una “vaca” digital. 


Si se preguntan de qué se trata este nuevo viaje, la respuesta tira para 2 lados. Uno: Buscar las conexiones entre el caribe Anglo e Hispano a través de una residencia de creación en la isla de Providencia, enclave angloparlante del caribe Colombiano. Y dos: Unas sesiones más eléctricas en que se acerquen a la movida tropical-futurista de Bogotá.


¿Por qué Providencia y Bogotá?


Una de las culturas musicales que tal vez no mucha gente fuera de Colombia conozca, es la de las islas de San Andrés y Providencia. Este archipiélago estuvo en manos Inglesas hasta el s.XVIII, cuando pasó a la nueva república de Colombia. Habiendo conservado el Ingles creole como lengua materna, y con fuertes conexiones comerciales y familiares con Jamaica, el sonido de la isla se mueve entre el calypso, mentó, reggae y zouk. 
Bogotá por otro lado se ha convertido en el foco de los nuevos experimentos tropicalistas, con proyectos de avanzada que tienen un pié en la tradición y el otro en la innovación. La sumatoria de estos dos ambientes es lo que busca Ondatrópica, servir de puente y propiciar encuentros.


Pasos Recorridos
Las alegrías y logros que ha dejado este laboratorio de creación tropical que empezamos en el 2012 han sido muchas; Grabamos un disco de antología atesorado por muchos y armamos una banda en vivo que ha tocado alrededor de 70 conciertos en 20 países. Desde escenarios gigantes como Glastonbury, hasta patios de La Candelaria, Ondatrópica se ha enfocado en mostrar la interacción de músicos de diferentes escenas, regiones y edades. Una radiografía del mestizaje musical colombiano.


Nuevos Caminos
Queremos que ustedes se monten en el viaje, apoyando este emprendimiento independiente que busca resaltar las conexiones entre sonidos, edades, estilos, y que ha sido el sello característico que Ondatrópica ha desarrollado. Su acompañamiento es CLAVE, queremos que entre todos armemos este nuevo clásico colombiano. Tenemos varias opciones, busquen la que más les guste! Ondatrópica continúa siendo un emprendimiendo INDEPENDIENTE a través de esta plataforma y gracias a ustedes podremos hacer realidad este disco. 
----------------------Información Importante sobre ENVIOS*Por favor tenga presente que hay que pagar gastos de envío. Por favor sume el valor final de acuerdo a la lista de abajo. Si usted olvidó pagar el envío, lo contactaremos directamente y usted podrá pagar el faltante en esta misma plataforma. CD o Vinilo o Libro de Fotos o Estampa o Dubplate: 5 USD Colombia / 10 USD Resto del mundo 
Discolombia o Bomba tropica: 15 USD Colombia / 30 USD  Resto del Mundo
*Todos los envíos desde COLOMBIA*---------------------------

story:
WORUM GEHT'S DENN HIER?

Wir sind die Band "Die BAND" und wir wollen das Album "Das ALBUM" produzieren. Wir kommen aus Dortmund, spielen Punk Rock und wollen uns 1 stabile Produktion des Albums leisten, weshalb wir hier 1 wenig Unterstützung suchen. Das Album wird 18 Lieder enthalten und soll im Herbst veröffentlicht werden. Aufnahmestudios sind teuer, deswegen wird das hier eingenommene Geld zur Finanzierung der Aufnahmesessions verwendet. 

WAS KRIEGT IHR DAFÜR?

Wer uns hilft, bekommt dafür natürlich auch etwas. Je nach Betrag gibt es stabiles, hochwertiges Merchandise (Shirts, Sticker, Fahnen o.ä.) oder sehr individuelle, stabile und persönliche Specials (Erwähnung in Liedern, Mitarbeit im Studio, Wohnzimmerkonzerte o.ä.). Jeder, der 10€ oder mehr spendet, bekommt natürlich dann auch das ALBUM.

Wir haben 500€ als Zielbetrag gesetzt, weil das der Mindestbetrag ist, den man hier sammeln muss. Wir kämen höchstwahrscheinlich auch mit weniger aus, jeder Cent, der hier eingenommen wird, wird in das ALBUM gesteckt. Ihr helft uns also auch, wenn wir die 500€ nicht erreichen.

Um den Versand oder die Überreichung der Artikel zu klären, bitten wir um 1 Nachricht hier oder auf Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DieBandDieBAND

WAS FÜR SONGS SIND AUF DEM ALBUM?

Die BAND spielt Punk Rock, der wie das uneheliche Kind von den Ramones und den Kassierern klingt. Die PARTEI Dortmund hat dieses Kind adoptiert. Das ALBUM soll im Herbst erscheinen und folgende Songs enthalten:

1. Chemtrails über Deutschland
2. Aluhelm statt Rettungsschirm 
3. Nazis vom Aldebaran
4. Piraten nach Somalia
5. Allium fistulosum
6. Eismann Song
7. Oh Hansa Pils 
8. English Song 
9. Sellmann wurde betrogen 
10. Sex in Brüssel
11. Brüssel zahlt 
12. Kabeljaukrokette I 
13. Das Bier ist nicht egal 
14. Wir kochen auch nur mit Wasser 
15. Uns kann nichts passieren, ich hab neue Scheibenwischer 
16. Ratatata 
17. Gefangen im Riesenrad 
18. Das Bier entscheidet 


RISIKEN UND NEBENWIRKUNGEN

Das ALBUM wird sowieso früher oder später erscheinen, von daher ist eine Spende ziemlich risikofrei. Mit Geldspenden könnt ihr die Produktion aber deutlich vereinfachen und beschleunigen. Außerdem wollen wir diese absurden Perks gerne unter das Volk bringen, weil das lustig wäre.


KEIN GELD FÜR SPENDE, ABER TROTZDEM HELFEN WOLLEN?
Ihr könnt uns auch ohne Geldspenden helfen, indem ihr diese Kampagne teilt und euren Freunden davon erzählt! Nutzt hierfür doch z.B. das Tool von Indiegogo!

Tausend Dank!!

Die BAND

story:
Short Summary

The  Fort Collins Chamber Music Society is raising money for our children's concert series, "Melody of Our History", based on stories that local students will recognize from their learning in elementary social studies.

Featuring dramatized performances of “A Life Between”, with music by Greeley Philharmonic conductor Glen Cortese, we will bring history to life this summer in our family-friendly concert series “Melody of Our History: FoCo Concerts for Kids.” Based on William Tremblay’s book The June Rise, “A Life Between” tells the story of Antoine Janis and his wife, First Elk Woman. 

With text and direction by Actors’ Gym Collaborative Theatre Resident Playwright Briana Sprecher-Kinneer, this inspiring tale reminds us that families come in all shapes, sizes, and colors. 

Additionally, University of Wyoming student composer Nathan Otto Beutler will serve up his newly-commissioned piece about local legend, "Annie the Railroad Dog." The concert series will delight audiences also with dramatized performances of “Goldilocks and the Three Bears” and “Little Red Riding Hood” by Bruce Adolphe.

We are a non-profit organization of  classically-trained professional musicians dedicated to performing chamber music in non-traditional settings. We make classical music  accessible to new audiences, cut down production costs, and get musicians out of concert halls and into popular venues such as bars and breweries, restaurants and cafes, and schools and museums.   

What We Need & What You Get

  • Money goes to actors and musicians
  • You get perks (see the column to the right for details!)

The Impact

By supporting this innovative, educational concert series, you not only support our mission to present professional classical chamber music in unusual public places, but you also help us make our children smarter! This is a unique and memorable way to introduce both classical music and Fort Collins History to children.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially:

  • Spread the word
  • Come see us at the Fringe Festival
  • Come see us at other events
  • Sign up for our newsletter
  • Like us on Facebook and other social media
  •  Sign up your child for music lessons
  • Go hear your local symphony
  • For more information please visit our website at: http://www.fcchambermusic.org

story:
Recording Artists of All Ages & Abilities

Music Therapy Connections is a private practice and teaching studio (voice, piano, guitar & ukulele) in central Illinois. We work with children and adults who have a wide range of talents, including those with special needs. 

No matter what their age or ability, our students have a song to share. We're ready to take our recordings of them to the next level, but we need your help.

As we prepare to move into a new building with space for a dedicated recording studio, our wish list of equipment and furnishings has exceeded our budget. A little bit goes a long way, so please consider contributing to our campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

We're setting a realistic goal of $1,500 so that we can purchase the basics for our studio: microphone, headphones, speakers, preamp, and cables. Any additional funds we raise will go towards other equipment, including dedicated computer with recording interface, digital keyboard, and so on (right now we use our own personal equipment from home).

We want to thank you for your contributions by providing rewards, including:
  • recognition on our website
  • digital downloads from our collection of original children's music
  • gift certificates to attend our groups and classes
  • membership to our music resource websites

The Impact

As music therapists, we work with our students to help them achieve both musical and non-musical goals. Confidence, self-esteem, and a sense of accomplishment are goals that every one of our students works towards, and recording their songs -- hearing their progress and sharing the fruits of their labor with others -- can help them achieve those goals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help! Spread the word by sharing this page with your friends via email and social media. Our recording artists thank you in advance!
